review_body: I booked a free cancellation room via Booking.com in January 16, 2020 for a 2-night stay in June 2020. However, after some research and seeing bad reviews, I decided to cancel the reservation on January 22. While the cancellation was free, I realized that the hotel already charged my credit card a total of $321.48, or 80% of the room charges as early as January 17. :(I have been following up via email almost every week since January when they would refund the payment that was charged to me, and until now, they have not confirmed when it will be done. I got an email reply twice from Kye Cabalfin (Data Department), but all he said is “Please be advised we have sent an urgent follow up email to our accounting department to assist you further.”I don’t know how much longer it will take them to refund my $321.48! It has been 5 months, and still nothing from them! This is very frustrating!!! What kind of customer service is this? :(

Really enjoyed out stay here, even booked our last two nights there in NY after traveling around for a week. Decent size room and bathroom with a very comfortable bed and very clean. A very busy hotel with very help staff. The location is perfect, just across the road from Penn station subway and train station. We will use the Pennsylvania again when ever we visit NY again.

The only people who stay here are those that don't know anything about NYC, or because it's the first hotel they see coming out of Penn Station. This place is a run down dump with horrible management. By far the worst hotel I ever stayed in (late night emergency) in Manhattan

I had to cancel my travel plans, booked through Booking.com for February. After more than 3 months, no refund yet of my pre-booking deposit. I sent numerous emails. Really? Won't ever consider staying here. I see other people have the same problem.

After more than two months I'm still waiting for the deposit refund. Speechless.... For the rest the position is great and the rooms are comfortable. But please if someone of the Hotel read this, check my booking and give me my money back. I sent emails but no-one answer...

Maybe this is the last chance to ask you a reply for my issue...I succesfully cancelled my reservation at your hotel on booking.com (confirm number 2967.635.500) on Monday, March 16th. I'd like to know how many days -more or less- will it take to get the refund of the first night fare, paid on November 1st 2019. I sent a couple of e-mail but no reply was forwarded.I understand the hard times you're living but almost two months are passed by and I think I deserve at least a reply.

I stayed at this hotel with a number of my friends and would genuinely not advise anyone to book it. Worst place I have ever stayed in my life. We booked a total of two double rooms. I will not be booking this hotel again in my lifetime or next.PROS: Centrally located in NYCONS: Old outdated hotel with dirty linen, musky smell in the rooms, dirty floors, disgusting showers, poor overall ldecorations and finishing and finally its not cheap!My opinion is that the hotel needs knocking down and re-building! Get the plans drawn up asap!

I went on a trip to New York with college on February March, the state of the room was horrific, WiFi was terrible, it barely reached the room on 2nd floor. I can not believe how messy the beds were and how much filth and dirt was left on the pillows of the bed, let alone the sheets. The showers often leaked or dropped through the night. When opening the window I was left with grease all over my hands, just from touching the side and opening the window. The lobby floors were often messy aswell and sometimes had a smell to the furniture. I can overall say that the 4 days I stayed there it was not as nice as cracked up to be.

There weren't a lot of people at the hotel when I stayed there, but everyone from the front desk to the engineers and the security people were very professional and courteous. When there was a problem with heat, I was supplied extra blankets and an engineer went up to make sure the heat was working. There was an issue with the water volume in my bathroom sink that was rectified very quickly. I was really impressed with the front desk people who were so courteous and only too happy to listen to my concerns and provide quick solutions. The room was spacious and clean, the wide-screen TV had excellent reception.

I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania from 16-20 October 2019.First night in, long queue at reception desk, had to wait 1 hour+ for check-in. Terrible. Not only that, but also they gave me a room which I didn't pay for. In fact, it was a lower one to the upgraded one I paid for. It was dirty, old and noisy. The bed sheets where so dirty that I had to sleep on top of the duvet cover because I didn't wanna get in bed and catch something. I even had to place a towel on the bathtub floor to get a shower because it was very dirty. I complained the next morning on front desk. They changed my room that afternoon to the one I actually paid for and said they were gonna give me a refund for the first night.It's been 7 months since I came back from that trip and still haven't received a single refund. I emailed them and last time I heard from them regarding this issue was back in January and they keep saying the refund is processing and is gonna take up to 21 days for the bank to process payment.I requested a refund receipt from them. Never got a reply back. I sent more than 50 emails ever since I came back from my trip.I got a photo of the room I got on my first night and the one I should have gotten. Plus, I got the invoice that they gave me with the annotations saying what the refund was gonna be.I'm still emailing them about it every single day, and haven't heard back from them yet.This hotel should definitely close its doors since they cannot keep up to the basic hygienic and customer expectations.I even read reviews people saw rats on their rooms. It's legally impossible to allow this hotel to stay opened when there're rats in the room.

I wish I had seen all the recent reviews prior to booking as now waiting for a refund (715euro!) for free cancellation as could not travel for rescheduled dates. Despite numerous emails and contact, no refund. I understand covid-19 is a unique situation but to see so many similar reviews is very concerning and this hotel should not be allowed to take further bookings if they are breaking contract by not refunding. Very disappointing so please beware before booking and avoid!

I booked through booking.com. On 3 February. I took the option of free cancelation. I canceled the booking 3 days later due to corona speculation. Money was then already deducted from my account. Since then, and it is nearly 2 months I am still waiting for a refund. I have been phoning them more than 7 times. Spoke to a lady that transfered me to the finance department, but only to get answering service. I have send several emails, with only 1 reply that I have to wait and give them "ample time". This is unacceptable. How long must I wait? Can someone please do their work and refund me? How long can it take to refund money? Really?

I’m not going to hear about the bush, we had the holiday from hell. We arrived at the hotel to find we had no room. So we thought ho hum, there’s a nice reception area here and set up camp on the sofas. We laid down to sleep and there must have been something sharp sticking out of the sofas because it ripped my cagoule. After a rather disturbed nights sleep on the sofas, we went to breakfast. We were promised a continental breakfast, meats and cheeses, a selection of pastries and a choice of tea or coffee. But we arrived to find nothing! Not a sausage. I do not want to complicate matters as in fairness to the hotel, they never promised sausages. So me and my husband had to find food on the pavement outside. I survived mainly on a diet of insects, however my husband had to eat gravel as he is in fact a vegetarian. Not the worst holiday we’ve had but certainly up there.
user_location: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
user_name:
davidandmarie57
Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom

review_body: Right across the street from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden so easy access to transportation and events. Rooms are typical for NYC - small but well appointed. Liked the security in the building where guests show room keys to access elevators and hotel rooms.

Firsteable, the location its amazing. Right in front of Madison Square Garden. 5 minute walking from Times Square. The bedrooms are fine. The best of Hotel Pennsylvania is the costumer care. We had a problem with the room we get at the beginning. We call to reception and they solve it at the moment.We arrived to NYC on Wenesday 11th of March. Trumph anounced this night the flight suspensions for UE travels. We needed change our travel come back and did it 3 days earlier we supoused to did it. We talk with the hotel and they offered to refund our money for the nights we didnt enjoyed. Awesome.We have no doubt we will book in Hotel Pennsylvania when we will have the choice to come back to NY.Regards!

First I was worried about the hotel because of the reviews I read on the Internet. The Hotel is very well located, 5 minutes walking to Time square. The breakfast is to take in a coffee very close to the hotel and it was good and sufficient (a pastry + a hot or cold drink + fruits or porridge).We stayed in a renovated room and it was very clean and spacious. We really enjoyed our stay and we won't hesitate to stay there again when coming back to NYC.

Came on a college trip for New York as part of our studies, although the lobby was beautiful and seemed extraordinary, me and my friends all had high hopes for our rooms - we were terribly mistaken - the door opened up at the second floor and I felt like I was in a real life episode of American Horror Story, or the Shining. The walls were falling apart, the carpet was coming up to the point I tripped. The doors were vault doors and were so hard to open we called the front desk 5 times throughout our stay. and that’s just one group of bedrooms.There were mouse traps, and cockroaches everywhere, there was mould coming out of the vents, alongside our shower being disgusting. We had 4 beds in our room - 2 of these being camp beds...if I wanted a camp bed I would of gone to a hostel and paid a lower price, especially since I didn’t even have a proper duvet in my bed and was given a couple linen and a blanket? Staff were rude and unhelpful when needed, as there was a paint party next to our room and security just told them to be quite? Unprofessional is an understatement. The website is so misleading and would not recommend.

At first I was worried about the hotel. From the outside the side doors looked very rough. After entering, very bright and well furnished. The rooms were clean, great view, and great location. Couple minute walk from times square. Penn station & Madison Square Garden, literally right in front of the hotel. Great price too! Our view was the empire state building !!!

We came for our 20th wedding anniversary and couldn’t have been more pleased. The room was larger than we expected it to be and the staff was beyond friendly. We’ll definitely book here again on our next visit.

This hotel was quite nice for the price.However there were a few things we were not pleased with. There needs to be more staff at the check-in point, we waited in line for 40 minutes to check in, there was only three staff on. The wifi did not work- which made it hard to organise our day. The breakfast was not in the hotel- I guess they could have mentioned that!

I spent one week at Hotel Pennsylvania with a friend, and I was impressed for the incredible cost/benefit deal.The hotel is located right opposite the Madison Square garden, just a perfect strategic location in the heart of Manhattan for sightseeing, shopping and getting around NYC.The Hotel is a bit old fashioned, yet spacious and clean, and it offers a number of facilities, such as gym, jacuzzi, breakfast included, etc. Last but not least, Maria B. at the front desk, has been an absolute star! She made our vacation. Extremely kind and willing to help, she resolved and accommodated any requests we've had with efficiency, dedication and in a timely manner. Excellent service and customer service.

Perfect location center of manhattan across the street from penn station. , very nice staff but old outdated bathroo.and small dark room, way too expensive for what you get.. leaving early so didn.t have breakfast

We were staying in the remodeled (modern) sector. The room was somewhat small, but it was pretty good for what we needed, with enough space to unfold the suitcases. We found everything clean, tidy, we had a replacement of paper, change of towels and sheets, so we are very happy with the stay. The wifi, on the other hand, worked very well the whole time we used it. The location is the best of all, since many tours take this landmark hotel, and also in front of Madison Square Garden, a very central area, with Penn Station. From the airport, we got there, crossed the street and we were about to stay. Very practical. As for breakfast, we had enough to eat some fruit, a hot drink, and bread. What is necessary to start the day.

We enjoyed our stay after we complained about the horrible Classic Rooms and we were upgraded to the Penn Plaza Collection. Long lines at the check-in, free breakfast was cold breakfast but an upgrade for $10.99 give you hot buffet breakfast. Overall it was a good stay.

The website lobby pic looks nice but once the elevator opened up on the 4th floor I thought I was beamed into someplace else.Threadbare carpets and walls that were beyond grungy and had not seen a coat of paint in 25 years.Good thing the lighting was poor otherwise it may have looked worse.Oh, and you may want to avoid the homeless taking their pants off as you leave the front door...I had not even made it to my room before I knew what the room was like.Use your imagination.Won’t be back

Great location, and just across the street from Penn Station. There are countless eatery's and shops within walking distance. Time square is only minutes away. The hotel had a comfortable bed, and was clean but dated.

Checked in on March 1st and checked out March 3rd.Location was great and the housekeeping did give us fresh towels albeit being stained :( The staff were in general very rude, but I have been told to expect that, which I do not buy in to.The room was so run down. We played the game the floor is fire as the carpet was so disgusting haha The iron had dirty brown gunk in it and ruined my friends shirt. The bathroom had so many cracks in it and the shower was appauling. Having to pay $5 per bag for them to look after your bag, sums up the greed of this place. Please spend money on a renovation and train your staff to be more hospitable. When we checked out I questioned the extra night charge on my card and the receptionist did say i would be refunded and apologised. 11 days on I have still not been refunded $146. After 5 different ways of communication not one person has been helpful. After sales service is the awful. I have now been put in my overdraft because of this charge. To round it all off they attempted to take $25 out of my bank account for early check in!! We checked in 20 mins early!! Literally laughable, especially when this was never mentioned. Needless to say, there may be a few better places to stay in Manhattan!Good luck!

I made a reservation directly through the hotel’s website. This reservation had a 48 hour cancellation policy.52 hours before check in time I found a better rate also directly through the hotel's own website and called to see if I could be credited the difference. I was told that was not possible and would have to make a new reservation through the website at the lower rate then cancel my original reservation which was exactly what I did.Upon canceling my first reservation I received a cancellation e-mail with a confirmation number confirming my cancellation.This same day I noticed the charge for my first reservation was pending on my CC but figured it would go away once the cancellation was processed.On check in day I now had 2 charges posted to my account ( original reservation and the new reservation) and they were no longer pending but charged.Upon checking into the hotel I questioned the rep at the counter and was told it would take a few days for the refund to be applied( it's already been over 48 hours since I cancelled at this point) and took her for her word. When I checked out the next day I once again inquired about my refund and was told things were slower because it was a weekend. I asked to speak to a manager and was told the manager had just stepped out and there was nobody I could speak to about this and to give it a few more days.After waiting another 2 days I once again called the hotel and the person in reservations told me I needed to speak to someone in accounting. I was told they would transfer me to the switchboard and then ask for accounting which I did and was then disconnected after being on hold a few minutes. After calling back and asking for the accounting department again the phone kept ringing and ringing until a message came on saying I could leave a message or email them.I chose to send an email with all the needed information to document everything. This email was never responded to.I eventually had to call my CC company and dispute the charge and I'm now waiting for a resolution on that.What started out as a just ok stay turned into a completely frustrating situation that should have never happened.I will never stay there again.

little issue but manager Steve was the best really made my stay an awesome time after fixing the problem location to show couldnt have bee better look forward to going back best customer service at a hotel ive had in along time thanks to Steve

I have stayed at the Hotel Penn 5 times now, and I always come away having had the same experience. The location can't be beat! The price is good. The cleaning staff is great, always friendly. However, the rooms always need repair. Most recently my shower knob kept falling off, there was no flange in the shower drain, and the toilet was leaking. Nothing major, just a bit annoying. What is truly annoying is how rude the check-in staff is, and how long it takes to get to the counter. They are always under staffed and cranky. I can't think of any other time I have spent so much to be treated so badly. Will I stay again? Probably. But it would sure make the experience better if they worked on the issues at the counter!

11th floor, not facing 7th Ave. Free coupons for breakfast and vouchers for a free drink in nearby bar was great.Security was good, as they had a staff person checking for room keys before one went into an elevator.

The rooms were clean, well cleaned and comfortable.The staff and concierge were welcoming and friendly. It's a large complex and it would be easy to nick pick, but price v comfort v location v staff you won't get much better.

I arrived at the hotel around 2:30 PM, the check in process took over an hour since they had only 3 staff behind the counter. The line was long, however, they didn't assigned more people at the counter during this busy period so everyone was getting annoyed.The room was ok, clean and the bed was comfortable. The overall look was old, needs update.Breakfast was ok, coffee, pastry and fruits.So, if you are looking for a cheap option with Great location, this is the one.

We received the absolute best customer service while checking out from Maria B. she was very helpful and and went out of her way to ensure that we had a great stay while here! She deserves a raise, no doubt.

Visited New York for a wedding and opted to stay at the Pennsylvania because you can't beat the price. Beautiful lobby and they gave us an upgrade to one of the new rooms on the 17th floor. It was by far way better than we imagined or read about. Very large,clean and comfortable.The cleaning lady left a nice arrangement using the floor mat which we appreciated. Nice touch.Very nice and helpful people. Never had to wait long for the elevators.I will definitely recommend and be back.

My stay at Hotel Pennsylvania was adventurous to say the least. Upon arrival everything went smoothly and we soon found out that the Westminster Dog Show was being held during our stay. The hotel did a great job of handling the dog debris as best they could. We stayed in a newly renovated room so the room was up to par for expectations. My only negative comment is that we called for a rollaway bed up upon check in and the whole week went by without it being delivered.

Had the worst experience I’ve ever had staying in this hotel recently. It started off with over an hour to que for check in . Only 3 people working at the desk on a bizzy Saturday morning and a lot of people standing around doing nothing .. their so called “self service” check in kiosks where all out of order so we had no options but to stand there for over an hour . We finally got to check in and the booking deposits for 2 rooms could not be used and the check in assistant insisted we would be refunded ASAP and paid for 2 rooms in full . 3 days later no refunds of €216 . On day 3 we also discovered we had been charged twice for our rooms .. €445 per room overcharged . Got this refunded at the end of day 4 only to arrive home after 6 days stay to discover they charged me again for the room . Took 5 days to get my all my money back an absolute disgrace. Rooms are also filthy, they are not as shown in the pictures. The halls are like something from the shining with cracked tiles , dirty sinks , toilet and a carpet in the room that sticks to your feet . Blinds and curtains have mould and the only positive was I didn’t spend too much time in the hotel . Found this hotel filthy and it’s not a nice place to stay in . Some staff are nice but majority are rude and not very helpful AVOID!!!!!!!!

The hotel location is very strategic especially for tourists. It is right behind the Madison Square garden. You can also just walk your way to Herald Square, Koreantown, Empire State, Manhattan Mall (right beside it), Target, Macys, and of course, Times Square. The room given to us was the older one but it's fine. They have options if you want to book their updated rooms.

Can’t fault the location as many of the key sights are walkable. Staff were friendly and there are handy shops within the hotel. The room however was pretty horrendous! Filthy windows with enormous gaps around them that let in the cold (this was confounded by the thin bedding). The heater below the window sounded like a Diesel engine so we had to have it off while we slept. The bathroom was tatty and incredibly dated and the shower was so low you had to crouch to get your hair wet. We paid for breakfast which was very disappointing, you have to walk to a run down cafe up the road and claim a hot drink and pastry. We were just lucky we had a packed schedule and didn’t have to spend too much time there! TIP: You can use the runners from the beds to clog some of the window gaps.

Renovated rooms are nice- bathrooms can still use renovation. The check in process is a mess. Took us 40 minutes to check in which was a bit ridiculous. But, otherwise a fine stay. Would consider going back

Very good experience. Majority of staff pleasant and helpful. Problems addressed promptly.Refurbished accommodation good,though bathroom a little small. Breakfast across the street fine for us but in high season could be a nightmare with too few places to sit.Would recommend.

The location was right in the center of everything. Hence midtown. The room was small, and worn down. Definitely beed some paint and upgrades. Only a heater in the room, very old. The restroom sink was falling off. The maid service was great cleaned and restocked everyday. The front desk was very helpful.

We stayed for 2 nights in room 922. This room has 2 full beds, but could absolutely hold 2 kings and a bunk bed. Make me the owner and I'd turn this into a genuine family suite!! We added a twin rolling bed and there was plenty of room for at least one more. The HUGE closet could hold a twin bunkbed (wasted space, but was nice for holding suitcases, and we occasionally change clothes in there for privacy. HUGE, I"m telling you!!). If you have a family of 4 or more, this is your room! Penn Station is across the street, also Madison Sq Garden. Not much else to do nearby, but with the train right there, you're ready to hit the town!

We had a great stay at Hotel Pennsylvania. The room was basic, but clean and comfortable and the location was perfect - directly across the street from Madison Square Garden and within a mile of all major tourist attractions in NYC. I will definitely stay here again.

We got one the refurbished rooms. The room itself was good! Well decorated and nice views. The only problem was with the shower, the drain was really slow, which was not nice cause it accumulated the water in the shower when using it which I don't like. The rest was fine.
user_name:
IvanPTSP
New York City, New York

review_body: Location is amazing and I would recommend it for all business travellers,overall stay was very good and never face any problem. I would suggest only two things.1) curtains were not properly cleaned and Air conditioner/heater which is installed inside the room was very dirty. Hotel management should take notice of this, my room number 580.2) There is no place where guest can store laguagge for few hours, like after check out I wanted to utilise 8 hours but could not leave because there is not place and staff there was also not very welcoming at the luggage desk. Over all my stay was perfect and all staff and members were very welcoming and good humen being.. I love the stay and again going there in March for one week.

location is great, you have access to subway, train and buses in the vicinity.As we booked a refurbished room, the bed was very good. Also was the price.It was clean and rather well maintained.No coffeemaker was a disadvantage, no fridge. The nearby cafe which was offered for complimentary breakfast was horrible. A spongy bagle served on a piece of paper, just one coffee, all plastic and paper stuff and a note at the table that you should leave after 30 minutes. This is a big minus for the hotel.

I left my wristband that's from work at the hotel, I went back I was in room 941 all the housekeepers on the floor did what they could to help me find my wristband including who I believe was the housekeeping manager if I'm not mistaken. They went out and beyond for me to help me find my wristband and understood me when I lost it and it would cause me my job. Thank you to the whole 9th floor team who stepped in to help me I really appreciate it and god bless I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was great very clean and the bed was a lot bigger than I expected it to be the view was ok only because of the side I was on was covered by a big building but over all loved the room . Thank you guys

The same as the previous review.... been emailing and calling for a month for my refund as booked with the cancellation buffer !!! Still no money back, and no response.... AWFUL AWFUL SERVICE... No-one replies and when you call you get passed to someone else...

PLEASE do not book at this hotel. Would genuinely give this place 0 stars if I could. I was going to go to New York around Thanksgiving last year (2019) and so decided to book Hotel Pennsylvania since it said that it was refundable as long as it was cancelled within a specific time frame. I found somewhere else I thought was better value, so decided to cancel my booking at Hotel Pennsylvania. It has been 5 months and I have yet to receive my hefty refund. I have called them numerous times (of which the accounting department never picks up even though it is within their calling hours?) and have emailed them countless times of which I have received 1 response about rushing the accounting department, from which I have never heard back. Please do not make my mistake and book at this hotel - you will not get your money back!!!

We stayed in one of the renovated room (floor17), everything was fine in the room, including cleanliness. The location of the hotel is excellent, crossing the street from the transportation hub at Pen Station. Even with the business of the area, the hotel has in place ways to control access and it felt really safe.

The front desk woman was really kind, breakfast it’s just fruit, cupcake, coffee or hot chocolate and croissant. The rooms are really old, but really clean. The location it’s amazing, I enjoy this place.

Location is just perfect, but the hotel is completely outdated. The bed (mattress) was ok, but the rest of the room needs either a clean or replacement. Not worth the money. Don’t go for the breakfast included. 1 bagel or croissant, cup of fruit and 1 drink is all you get. Overall, there is so much potential for the hotel, but it’s too expensive for the quality

The hotel was very hospitable and friendly and close to all main attractions. Highly recommended to anyone.I would like to thank Reina for helping me with checking out which was very helpful. David- Canada.

minimum proper, but very old fashioned and somehow broken. Seems like everything needs renovation in this hotel. Personal was always very friendly. I liked the location, very easy to reach from the airport Newark. And a good starting point for trips up- or downtown.

Hotel Pennsylvania is a terrific tourist type hotel in the heart of New York City. Prices are reasonable, location is amazing, rooms are clean, staff is friendly and accommodating, and a continental breakfast is included. I always stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania when I am in New York City.

Positives.The location is amazing, 5 minutes from Times Square, Empire State and right opposite Penn Station. Plenty of restaurants and bars close by. You can get to anywhere in New York from Penn Station and there is a train to Newark Airport.The hotel let us check in at 1pm rather than the advertised 3pm. No queues and we didn't need to use the express check in machines. Staff were really friendly and helpful. The room itself was a good size, flat screen HD, clean with 2 comfy double beds. NegativesOur room was on the 7th Avenue side opposite Penn Station and it can get noisy (same really as everywhere in New York!) There was building work outside which is out of the hotels control but there is no soundproofing on the windows which aren't double glazed. Also the room could have benefitted from black out curtains as there is a lot of LED screen adverts outside. The bathroom was dated but clean. The shower head is about 5ft 7 up meaning I had to crouch to wash my hair. It also took around 10 minutes for the water to heat up. Overall for the price we paid it was a great hotel despite the small flaws. It is a historic hotel in a fantastic location. I would visit again in a heartbeat.

Nice hotel. Quiet. Nice hard beds and simple rooms. Right across from Madison Square Garden and close to Penn Station. Breakfast is down the street so coat is Required. R cafe was good though. 5 long blocks to Megabus.

Before I begin, I want you to know I'm not a fussy person and all the reviews I write are very honest and genuine.Customer service - zero! Dont expect much from the staff at the front desk. They will not be overly polite or friendly. They do their bear minimum apart from one guy I came across, but that's about it. Look of the hotel. It's old but i knew this already. However i booked and paid extra for one of their "newly" renovated rooms. I dont know how newly this was done but a old Hilton room would still look more modern than this. The hallways and lifts are very old. There is nothing "modern" about this hotel. They dont have sound proof or double glazed windows so yes, you will hear all the noise from the streets every night! It can be very noisy and sometimes difficult to sleep through.Breakfast - oh God just dont. It's literally a bad cup of coffee, a bagel and a plastic cup of fruits! That's it!! And yes, that's every day!! Honestly dont bother. And it's not even in the hotel. You have to walk down and across the street for it. Location- this is the ONLY reason I booked this hotel. It's in a fantastic location on 34th and 7th Av. Opposite Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. I would highly recommend you DONT book this hotel, and pick the hilton down the road by Time Square instead. Which is what I wish I did too now, as I was inbetween minds with them. The only reason I chose Pennsylvania hotel was because this one said breakfast was included. Had i know it is literally just a bagel and coffee, I would had gone with the Hilton. At least you know what kind of standards you will be getting yourself in for.

The location is one of the best things about this hotel. The staff was friendly and nice. I stayed for one night in one of the basic rooms. Nothing fancy about it. Before picking this location, I read that some rooms were outdated and that the upper floors have the renovated ones. I payed for the basic one, so I was on the 3rd floor and I did not expect anything but the basic. The room was spacious but old. I am hoping that they would also end up renovating that section of the hotel, because it was kind of weird having multiple doors inside the room, at first.The carpet was not on the best conditions or anything, but overall, if you are not picky and want a place to just crush at night, you won’t mind. The bed was comfortable and breakfast was included. For the price, though, I would suggest that they offer better or more breakfast options. Instead of just coffee, one pastry and a fruit/juice. Overall, great location, nice & helpful staff and basic rooms (if you pay for the cheapest one).

We (my dauther an I) had a wonderful stay at the Pensylvania hotel. Our room was part of the Penn plaza collection and was great to relax a little after a day of sightseeing in Manhattan. We even had a beautiful view on the Empire state building. In general, the location of the hotel is perfectly situated in midtown and right across Penn station (access to the subway and fast, easy and cheap connection to Newark airport, and probably the other airports as well). Friendly staff, especially at the reception (Maria B :-) Hope to visit again some day!

Perfect location to walk to the tourist spots, comfortable room with the necessary, good heating,good cleaning everyday and breakfast included. Our stay was perfect, we would go again without a doubt!!!

Stayed at the newly renovated Hotel Pennsylvania with a group of friends in a wonderfully appointed suite. This hotel had everything we needed: space, amenities, and a perfect Manhattan location! Definitely recommend!

I had the pleasure of staying here for a girls trip with my best friends from college. The location is directly across the street from Penn Station, which was so convenient for all of us coming out of town. It’s close to all major attractions. The hotel is going through renovations, while maintaining its original charm. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were spotless. I would stay here again.

The updated room was very nicely done and the room was a decent size especially for NYC. The only issue was the shower, we had very little hot water. Will definitely stay here again due to it’s convenient location.

This hotel is in the heart of everything. For the price this place is well worth it. We got an “updated” room which was still a bit dated and need work however was clean. Rooms are small but this is what you get in NYC! Upon check in they accommodated our request for a higher floor and all staff were pleasant. You walk out and your right at penn station. Can’t be beat. We paid $300 for two nights and didn’t except 5 star for this price but really got what we paid for. Was not a bad experience.

Everything was great. I asked to have the highest floor we could for the lower priced room we had. Not only did the lady get us on the 14th floor but we had an amazing view of the empire state building right out the window. I will definitely be back.

Great location in the heart of manhatton. Central to everything. Hotel itself very basic and corridors were filthy however our room was quite and comfortable. Would prefer a more secure lock on bedroom door. We would return again

Good morning, I have a room reservation in your hotel, but I would like to contact you for more information. Please, can you send me an email address ? Thank you in advance, Best regards, Fiona Aubertin

The hotel is absolutely perfect located. It´s big enough. The rooms on 9th floor are clean, big and perfect!!!!! The people that work there were really kind with us. We have no problem. We´ll deffinitly go back there again next year.

Great location! Strong value. Good service. The room was worn but in a nostalgic way. Stripped of extras we were left with an efficient, comfortable room a comfortable walk from many desired tourist sights.

When we initially checked in, the room we had paid for wasn’t available, we were given room 450 and as soon as we entered the room the freezing cold air of -7 degrees hit us right in the face. After investigating a bit we found that the cold air was due to the window frame and actual closed window had a huge gap. The plus point was that the heaters were working. With two young children this room was unsuitable however as we checked in past midnight the main priority was to get some sleep. All with layers of hoodies socks and blankets. We were eventually moved to the room we paid for by the next day but this particular room 450, should not be made available to anyone in the freezing condition it was in. The rooms were spacious and clean however the furniture is very very dated and about to fall apart. The rooms could really do with a lick of paint. The breakfast included in the hotel stay was very basic with a fruit pot, pastry and hot drink. For and extra $10 you can have the buffet breakfast and the selection is quite vast with noodles, rice, different kind of eggs, sausages, potatoes, chips and porridge. Staff were friendly but the check in counters are barely manned by people, the hotel management are keen on customers using the self service machines. The queues to the checkin counter is usually very long if you want to speak to a human being. There is an option to leave your luggage at the hotel after checkout at $5 per bag. But again to gain these tags you have to queue up at the main reception. Would have been more convenient and time saving, if the baggage tags were available at the Bell Captain counter which seems to be quiet most of the time.

The hotel staff are extremely rude when we tried to complain about our room which was extremely dirty. Staff have no manners and told us to go to another hotel if we didn't like it! They also threatened to cancel our booking because we complained. No interest in customer service at all. Yes it's central, but that's the only positive aspect of this hotel which is very run down and needs major refurbishment. If you want a pleasant experience, spend more money on a better hotel than this.

The hotel was ok, however the breakfast was the things we didn't like.. you have to get out of the hotel to a cafe near the hotel. Also our hotel room key didn't work well we had to try a lot of times before it opened

I stayed in room 1487 which was newly remodeled. Front desk was friendly and helpful. The room had 2 full size very comfortable mattress and excellent pillows. Very clean and well functioning bathroom. I stayed in this hotel 2 years ago and I can not say enough about about the amazing transformation. My stay included Continental breakfast in a nice restaurant next door. I will definitely stay here again. Great value for the money.

Hotel Pennsylvania has some outstanding staff members. Thank you Maria B. ( front desk) and Maggie (concierge). Maria and Maggie both went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable! Make sure when you book a room it is newly renovated. Continental breakfast needs improvement. Bigger cup of coffee for a start!! We'll be back. Location is excellent!

Great location that it helps a lot, but unfortunately it was expensive for all the commodities that it has. The bed was good and the bathroom was clean, but the room didn't smell nice. Besides, every time we call the elevator, we feel electrified and is not a good sensation. We paid with breakfast included, not recommended. The breakfast is outside the hotel in a cafeteria and it is only one type of bread, fruit and 1 beverage. The place is very useful if you only need it to sleep.

It is a very well located hotel with an excellent value for money. If you are looking for designer furniture, a trendy cocktail bar in the lobby or a clean and tidy room, this hotel is not for you. But if you want a central location for a reasonable price, this hotel is unbeatable.

Great location, good value for money. Comfortable bed. Shower was hard to adjust but otherwise very happy with the room. Checked in early .. thank you people. Felt very safe there. No restaurant there which was a pity.

Amazing location but room (renovated) cleanliness was only mediocre. Lots of stains on the floor and some on the sheets. But again, good price for the location. Staff members were friendly. All doors to the rooms are original “valet doors” - looked kinda creepy at first from the hallway, but very cool and historic.

Completely enjoyed the customer service! They were super nice and very welcoming. The place was super Clean! I enjoyed been helped and given directions that were easy to follow. The hotel is located not to far from all shopping, eating, and some site-seeing places that you may want to visit. Penn Station is across the street for transportation.

The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was frindly, the hotel is good located and services available. The check in and check out was fast. Only you need is enjoy the New York. I recommend this hotel for your next visit

The room was safe and the hotel is very conveniently located to everything in lower Manhattan. It was not the finest and appeared to be due for an update in decor, but it met our expectations given the price.

Pictures in hotel web and booking pages were definitely not what room was.Not very clean, pillows are way too used and you sink into the mattress.Staff was kind of nice. And really.. kind of.I get that you pay for location, but this is absolutely scam publicity.

Front desk staff were much more friendly than in years past. My only problem was they charged my full stay 3 days prior to check in. Which was for a full week. I was planning on paying cash for my stay. I was not given a heads up that this was going to be the case?

Good location, good staff , room cleaning good one time Chinese Lady clean on 13/feb and 17 feb clean by Bangladesh Akthar both clean my room very good as I want.Hotel was all good I enjoyed my trips Thx Pennsylvania

Location it’s excellent! Subway only a few steps away and food all around! Empire State Building just a few blocks away, we walked to it! Cash only for the coffee shop by the front desk! Very centralized!. Excellent service, very clear really enjoyed it. No mini fridge just FYI!

1. Check in on your own. Don’t expect any assistance for your suitcases.2. Old but functional. We liked the old design. However, the common areas are dirty. They could have kept the old design but at least ensured things are clean.3. Breakfast - the worst! Cold Bagel that’s taken out of delivery boxes - very unsanitary. Fruit slices and coffee. 4. Service - zero. Expect to do things on your own. No slippers or toothbrushes (not even water) provided.5. Location - excellent.

Our room was on 7th floor. Door to room looked like something from a 70’s crime movie, all that was missing was the crime tape. Filthy stained carpet, flimsy sheet, thin blanket, no extra ones in wardrobe, bed platform had dog pee up it, a creature was digging through wall, under door and throwing rocks into room. bathroom was not much better, sink moved, bath had no drain cover, just a gaping hole. Air conditioning control we couldn’t even bare to touch. Hallway reeked of pot and walls were paper thin you could hear everything next door. We were in town to watch the WKC dog show which promotes this hotel, very disappointed.It a shame as location is great and they must make good money, just not re investing it in hotel. I've posted some photos to back up my review.

I wouldn't say this is a luxury hotel but in respect of location and courtesy of hotel staff I cannot fault it. Great base for exploring NYC. Definitely recommend to others. Less than 10 mins walk to Times Square and a couple of blocks from Empire State Building.

Bathroom was in desperate need of a revamp.. toilet leaked and shower was brutal. Air conditioning unit in the room was like a tractor running so we turned it off as soon as we were going to bed. No hair dryer in room. We got a smoking room despite asking for a non smoking room so had to leave window open during the day to get rid of the smell but other than it’s faults it’s in an ideal location. If you don’t plan on spending much time in the room it’s an ideal hotel. Bed was very big and comfortable. For a New York hotel it’s ideal if you don’t get too many expectations.

Satisfied for a no frills night in NY with comfortable bed. Location is very convenient to everything, and you can leave your bag when you checkout if you have business to do. Stay included free continental breakfast too.

We had a great time on our girls birthday trip! I always fall more in love with NYC every time I go! We stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania which is a great location right across from Madison Square Garden!!

Overall for our trip the hotel was a good base. The location was very central with good transport connections. It is also just across the road from Madison Square Garden so is great for watching games. Some of the rooms in the hotel are however in need of a bit of renovation - especially the bathrooms. The beds are relatively comfortable. One issue is that the breakfast is very small (just 1 pastry, 1 pot of fruit and a drink).

Been staying at the hotel Penn for years! Maria B keeps us coming back. She is always smiling and wants the best for you and your visit while at the hotel Penn. while she was checking another group in she was speaking Spanish so when I arrived at the counter I asked if she grew up with Spanish .. she said “no I learned it while working here!” She is so accommodating to every guest!!! They are upgrading their rooms the 10th floor is awesome. Price and location superb

Very nice and clean. Room was nice and price was very good. Location is excellent, you can get there very easily from all directions. Breakfast place, which is not in the hotel itself was a bit hard to find but was delicious.

Had what they termed as upgraded room on the 10th floor. The hotel has a lot of character and is in excellent location next to MSG, Macy's and Empire State Building. Everything in room was good, was kept nice and clean through period of stay, toiletries refreshed every day. Cleaning ladies very polite. Breakfast was provided at Cafe R up the street, fresh fruit, pastry and a drink which gave a decent start to the day. I've stayed in Manhattan over previous years and I thought the Pennsylvania provided a good experience.
user_name:
philipm253
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed in room no.500A..My stay was for 3days but very comfortable. Ms Akhter Jahan is an excellent worker and kept the room neat and clean. I wish her all the best and keep up the good work..cheers!!

I enjoyed my stay! The people from checkin to house cleaning were the best. The hotel is older and very nice for the price. I will stay here again and the location is very close to all point of interest.

Stayed here for 4 nights with friends. We waited 2 hours for rooms to be organised for us, having been offered rooms close together. Had we known it would take so long we would not have accepted offer of neighbouring rooms. Staff in reception are rude, abrupt and extremely unhelpful.Their default position seems to be unfriendly and negative. And each person we dealt with had the same attitude. The first time we left our room the key card would not reopen door. I queued for 20 minutes to sort this and was met by a very rude young woman who wanted my ID. It was locked in the room!! I felt as if I were a naughty child rather than a paying customer!We booked newly renovated rooms however one of the rooms bore no resemblance to photos on website of these rooms. There was no chair or desk nor table. The bath had a crack in the enamel surface. Floor tiles were worn . Definitely not renovated in recent times.but we paid the rate for renovated accommodation!A payment for our deposit was charged to the credit card of a different customer. While this was finally sorted the manager we spoke to behaved as if it was no big deal that such a mistake could be made. This is a huge hotel where customer service is of no importance whatsoever. They also charge a fee to store baggage. However at our insistence the manager finally waived this fee as a gesture to make up for credit card mix up.Despite location I would never stay here again. There are better and more pleasant places to stay in New York so search them out.

I have good experience with this hotel. Very fast check in. Lady on the front desks MARIA B is very professional and make very good Servis and she made everyone feel comfortable in the hotel. Tanks MARIA B

Room was not good to old and maintenace bad.Carpets bad smell and dirty. Just something Good, a counter service person, name Maria B, was a very nice person and gave me a better room. That was the best thing happen at the Hotel.

Hotel is in a really nice location [Madison Square Garden across the street] but rooms can be kind of dated. I highly recommend you get one of the renovated room on a higher floor, as they seemed nicer then what i heard about other rooms. No amenities in room [fridge or dresser], which is hard if more then 2 people share a room. Showers can be difficult, as hot water was intermittent. Linens were clean and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful.

My room had a good, comfortable bed and more room than I had thought possible in the middle of Manhattan. However, it was a "classic" room, which turned out to mean "not renovated yet." It had some obvious rust and mold, especially in the bathroom. (I avoided using the shower for that reason.) The "continental" breakfast, which is across the street, consists of one cup of very watered-down coffee, a tasteless fruit cup, and a stale roll or bagel.

I found the room to be very deceiving from what was actually depicted in the photos.My room had damaged ceiling tile and no one informed us of the breakfast tickets during our stay. The staff was very nice and friendly and upgraded us to a better room.

I had a wonderful Stay at Hotel Penn.I have been staying there for over 20 years.They have come a long way, and i have been every step of the way with them.Hotel penn is my home, when I fly home to New York.This Historic Hotel is like no other.I’m an American who is proud of hotel penn.I Attended Modeling school in hotel penn, at Barbazon Modeling school.You will never find better rates any where else in New York’s Manhattan, than Hotels Pennsylvania.There rooms have been updated, and more updated rooms are being done at this very moment.I love Hotels penn, and I’ll never stay anywhere else.In the picture is the actual room I stayed inLook at my bag on the bed.That’s hotel Pennsylvania!!! No gimmicks!!!!The best location in Manhattan!!!Hotel Pennsylvania is awesome!!Vernice Wiberg Sweden

Maria B from the lobby helped me out with my checking process, she was so sweet and very helpful since I was in a very tight situation. I really appreciate the effort and efficient service. The room was clean and very nice.

We arrived at the busiest time of the year on January 1st itself. As soon has we check-in which took a long time considering being under staff. We enjoyed are stay. Great location and many thing to visit. Not enough time to do everything we wanted but had a great time.The room we were given was not great and the mattresses were out of shape. Also we ask for another room because of the smell of pot. The upgrade was great. Tanks to Maria 'B' at the counter.

Great location. Directly across the street from Penn Station puts it near many subway lines and a 10 min walk to Times Square. No frills place that is affordable. Very friendly staff, clean rooms. Third time we’ve stayed here to visit NYC. If you’re expecting a 5-star hotel, look elsewhere. If you’re looking for an affordable nyc hotel in a great location thst is safe and convenient, look no further.

After a first night in a room that was not what I paid for, they switched us for another one on the 14th floor that was very nice. The hotel is very well located (6th ave and 33rd street)The rooms are nice and clean!

I know that a lot of people have given negative reviews, but I really enjoyed my stay here. Sure, it’s not the most modern or the fanciest hotel in NYC, but you sure can’t beat the rates, and the staff was friendly, the rooms clean, and the beds were very comfortable - more so than some high end hotels I’ve stayed in. The location is great, especially if you come in by train, so you can get anywhere you want to go without a lot of effort. We had a view of the Empire State Building, which was unexpected but wonderful! We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here and it was great! Get the upgraded room’s and you won’t be disappointed! Close to everything and you can walk to most things! Near time square! You won’t be disappointed! We stay here all the time!

Well,Friendly helpful staff ,perfect location for exploring New York but !!! the quality of the rooms is nothing like the website pictures. Wind blowing through the windows, peeling paint ,the most filthy rusted heating unit,very dated furniture bathroom was very tired,carpets threadbare,cardboard walls could hear everything from a screeching woman shouting at her dog ( oh yes very !! pet friendly ,Madison square gardens had a dog show for the first two days of our stay ,the smell of dog everywhere was disgusting ). We complained straight away,the reception showed us 3 !!!! yes 3 more rooms all as depressing ,dated and same as the first ( we’re still wondering where the rooms on website are ). Unfortunately we stayed in the first room as told that’s it no other rooms available. Luckily we were out all day and evening so didn’t need to sit about in a depressing room. Would I recommend this place ? Mmmmif like us you only need to sleep their yes but ask for extra blankets the beds only have a sheet sandwich on top (sheet-very thin type of blanket-sheet ) bloody freezing.

The hotel is worth your money. Has a fridge in room and flat screen on the wall. Yes,rooms are small but its NYC ALL rooms are small. Area is super convenient. Directly across from Madison Square garden and Penn Station. Lots of shopping and eating right around the corner. We had the upgraded king room.

I have stayed at "Hotel Penn" many times, but this most recent visit was superior. One may stay in the newer side of the hotel, but for the price, the older unrenovated option is still a good consideration. I had a corner king room at the crossroads of 7th and 33rd. The room was cleaner than usual and had a bonus frig.As I was only there for a few days to attend the Westminster KC dog shows, and flying in from Honolulu, I picked the Hotel Penn for it's convenience throughout - Penn Station across the property making commuting in from JFK on the LIRR a breeze and departure back to Washington, DC on AMTRAK. Shuttle buses to the Piers for day shows were contiguous to the property and running consistently to and from. Evening program was at the Gardens so it was a simple walk across the street, all saving precious minutes to do squeeze in other points of interest by train or subway.Most important to me, staying at the Hotel Penn gave me an opportunity to observe how dogs were welcome at this property as I am always looking for properties that accommodate dogs.This centrally located hotel is close to everything - restaurants, POI, shopping, transportation hubs, and an almost 24/7 US Post Office right down the street.The only reason the rating was not a five is because the bathroom was not as complete as it could have been - no face towels, shampoo, conditioner, shower cap. Also, the bed was not "finished" as it was on the first day.

The Hotel is very old and has hardly been updated. The room I had, had a matress which was totally outdated. I guess it has been from the 60ies. It was a box spring mattress.But the Hotel is central. I have been there for the famous Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show and for this reason the Hotel was perfect: central, inexpensive and they offered a Shuttle Service to the day time Shows. The Show in the evening was right across at MSG.

Really fast the checking and good service, the help was amazing, and the room was fantastic, hope next time with less money for a night. I paid almost 500 for 2 night, if it was cheaper I will be staying more day

I booked this hotel and due to circumstances, I had cancel. Cancellation policy was that it was free, if cancelled before 4/12. Cancellation was done on the 27/11. To my surprise my Credit card was charged for the full amount. After two months discussing, still no refund.

I stayed at The Penn in 2008 and it was getting quite worn and outdated then. I was not going to book there again for my February 2020 trip, but their website said they had 'updated' rooms available for a higher cost than the standard rooms. I was in NYC for the Westminster Dog show and really wanted a hotel close to Madison Square Garden. For that purpose, you cannot beat The Penn. It is right across the street from MSG. Against my better judgement, I booked a King Penn Plaza Collection room for myself and my husband, and a double bed Penn Plaza Collection room for my aunt and her friend. Problems began at check in. My aunt arrived before me and they would not let her check in for her room because I had booked it. Even though my aunt's name was on the room! She finally got them to let her check in, and she goes to her room and can't get in because the key doesn't work. Bellhop goes to get a key that works. He comes back and they open the door to find a tiny King bed room that has the same new furniture they advertised for the Penn Plaza Collection Rooms, but was about half the size of the photos. There was no way for my aunt, her friend, and a dog to stay in the room because they had to be able to set up a crate for a medium sized dog. The room was too tiny to be able to have the crate on the floor and still have room to walk around the bed. In the meantime I am checking in and get the keys to a room with two double beds. Obviously, they just switched who got what room type, but that doesn't take car of the size issue for the dog crate. My husband and I go take the small king bed room, and my aunt goes back to the front desk to get a larger room. They finally get a larger room....with a king bed. OK no big deal, they get a twin bed in to the room and there's enough space for the dog crate now. The small king room is teensy tiny----to be expected in NYC., But there is next to no space to store anything. You can't fit your suitcase under the bed. The closet has about 12 inches of hang bar to use. There is no dresser. Only two bedside tables with a couple small draws. There are no blackout curtains - only flimsy pale colored panels. So no blocking light out. Our HVAC unit was super noisy and rattled.The bottom bed sheet left about 1/4 of the mattress pad exposed and had different hairs stuck all over it.The bathroom was the worst. I have stayed in places with tiny bathrooms all over (Paris, Amsterdam, Rome, Jerusalem, etc). I don't think I have unrealistic expectations for NYC. The toilet didn't really get everything flushed down. The shower stall was the smallest I have ever encountered. It had a fabric curtain, so when you turned on the shower, the whole bathroom flooded. The water temperature was the worst - no matter what you set it on, the water coming out alternated between scalding and freezing. The tiles were broken in places and stained in others. The paint job was so sloppy - the room looked like it had been painted over a million times, and each time was done very poorly so you had globs of paint at some of the edges making the room look very dilapidated. The walls and doors have NO sound proofing. You can hear everything going on in the hall and the rooms next door. All the hotel hallways reeked of marijuana. The Penn could be nice and charming since it was a groundbreaking place when it was built. But it has not been kept up well and the age shows in a bad way. We had four nights booked, but after the first night and the worst shower of my life, we found another hotel to stay at for the rest of our trip. I will say that the manager was very nice and gave us no trouble about refunding us for the unused nights. Proceed with caution about The Hotel Pennsylvania. You can stay other places within a couple of blocks and the same price range that are much nicer.

Dimo at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and AKHATER JAHAN was very nice and friendly. She took the special time to help me with my room. I was attending Madison square Garden so the location of this hotel was ideal. Thank you for a very nice visit.

I needed to book a stay so I could attend a multi day business meeting at my company. Hotel PA was across the street and appeared to offer a great rate. I booked it - and found out that the posted rate of $68 DID NOT INCLUDE a $35 / night facility charge (WTF?). I found a better deal at a nearby Marriott property and cancelled the reservation with more than the 2 day notice. When I got my credit card bill, there was a charge for the stay, anyway. I have contacted the hotel and they told me that I should not have been billed, but that I needed to call their accounting dept to reverse the charge. I did that, and they don't answer their phone, even during their highly restricted business hours. I emailed them, and they don't reply. I do 70 - 100 hotel stays a year and I have NEVER been treated so badly. I can only imagine how bad my service experience would be if I had actually stayed there. Best BET - If you can't find any reasonable hotel in Manhattan - stay on Long Island or NJ and take the train. DON'T STAY HERE.

We stayed in the “new” section of the hotel, but the room didn’t have light block curtains (hello 24 hours of light in NYC!), no comforter on the bed (just sheets and a thin polyester blanket), and the water faucet in the tub dripped continuously. The elevators are a bit slow and clunky, and often do not respond when called (likely due to high demand when we were there for Westminster Dog Show), but the staff was very friendly and attentive, and they have a shuttle for the dog show people. All-in-all, it was an ok place to stay. But hopefully they add a few details to make the rooms a bit more comfy!

I've heard stories...here's mine. There are areas of the hotel being renovated, most just need deep cleaning. My 2 double-bed room hadn't been updated, it was small, but had sufficient room. Refrigerator worked great. Elevators ran timely. Wish The Penn had a restaurant and bar. Bellmen and concierge are outstanding. I was there competing at Westminster week

Perfect hotel for Madison Square Garden events. Currently remodeling from the top down, so request a high floor. We went for the Westminster Dog show. Many of the dogs stay here as well, so it is fun to interact with them. Bathrooms are outdated, but the staff is excellent.

Returning to Hotel Penn, I was pleased to find appreciate its slow, steady improvement. My room (yes, small room) had a spiffy newish shower. As return customers know, this hotel is attractive due to being across the street from Penn Station. This location is appreciated after a long flight. The staff is always competent and friendly. The multiple elevators are speedy. There is a security check by the elevators. Nothing fancy, to be sure, but the plusses far outweigh the negatives.

I've stayed at this property many times before - but, with the incredible upgrade to the Penn Plaza Collection (I was on the 14th floor), I will surely re-book at this location again. Wow!! Wonderful improvements. Also, I was attended by Maria B at the front desk a number of times - she is always pleasant and incredibly customer oriented!!

Very good value. Clean room and bath. Room good sized. Decent window. Great location. BUT rug by elevators and the hall on 9th floor went I uncleaned for 3 days. Sheets and towels dingy and worn. No coffeemaker, no fan in bath, no counter space to set toiletries. Hallways reeked of pot smoke.

It's a hotel with great location, nice to only sleep and enjoy the city. If you want to use the train, it's the best option for your stay. Also if you have pets, you can take them!!, A good experience

I have stayed at the Penta maybe 20+ times in the last 35 years. Room was good size and clean, which has not always been the case in past years. Fresh flowers in the floor lobby was a nice touch. The upgrades they have made are great! Breakfast was just enough for a good start on the day so you could enjoy the wonderful food of NYC. We had a great stay!

Location great went to Westminster we will be back! Staff excellent, shower would go hot and cold on its own. The room was not huge but nicely appointed. Parking was a little expensive but we are from Upstate NY so we are not used to the prices in NYC.

Big hotel at an excellent location....next to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Walking distance to Times Square and Empire State.Inside, my room was very dated, but I only needed a room to sleep and leave my gear!Good price, and I got breakfast vouchers for a local cafe, and money off vouchers for dinner at a couple of Irish pubs next door.Travelling solo, so wasn't looking for 5 start luxury!I'll do a separate review of New York

Absolutely love this hotel!!! It has all the old charm from over 100 years ago when it was built. Will be back. It is in a great location. Easy to walk to some great stores and also awesome pubs across the street.

The hotel was great the room was a great size large.Free breakfast was good. The service at the front was wonderful shout out to Marie B. and Flora they are awesome. We will come stay here again. The dog show was fun also!!

We had a great stay in their new executive rooms. Lots of space and Light! The furnishings were new and modern and the bed was quite comfortable. The updates are wonderful. Maria B provided above and beyond service and I would send anyone to hear to make sure their stay is excellent. Great Value for the size of room in NYC!

The cost for the room (a remodeled one) was $60 plus about $50 something in taxes (welcome to NYC). With that being said, I understood the quality of the room I was getting at the outset. The check-in process was easy and they were well staffed. Took less than 10 minutes. I stayed on the 16th floor. Although I looked at pictures of the room on the website before booking, there were some discrepancies. First, the carpeting already looks old and had stains on it. The walls needed fresh paint. And the bathroom looked like it hasn't been touched in years (although I will say the bathroom looked clean). Two main issues: (1) the sheets on the bed; and (2) the lack of AC. For the former, when I was getting ready to go to bed, I visually inspected the sheets. Noticed hairs and stains on the sheets. Clearly, the sheets had not been changed. As you can guess, I was disgusted. I ordered new sheets and they were brought up to me. However, I did have to put them on myself. My sleep that night was not great because of this. For the latter, and although I was staying in NYC in February, I was not able to turn the AC on. Room got to be too hot and I was forced to open the window, which brought in way too much outside noise. Nevertheless, for $60, I guess I shouldn't have expected much more. I would give one star if it wasn't so cheap.

Ever since I first stayed at this hotel in Feb 2019 , I’ve gone back more than a handful times and ever time they always out do themselves when it comes to booking my room. After the remodeled their 8th floor the customer service and rooms have only improved since. I will stay here 100x over any Airbnb in NY. That’s my opinion but I’ve also saved more money booking with this hotel than any other Airbnb I’ve booked previously. 5 STARS! Oh and let’s not forget to shout out the front desk rep who always helps me MICHAEL (I forgot his last name I’m so sorry he’s always so nice to me and actually remembered me based on my art on my apparel which was humbling to say the least)

We were at the 7th Ave hotel and everything was very nice and clean. We were very grateful. Because we had to wait several hours for our room to be ready, they graciously upgraded our room and we could not asked for a better room or location!

My husband and I were visiting from Tampa and came in for a Wedding, visiting family and he worked from his NJ office while there. Great location for him to catch the path train. clean and comfortable room. We enjoyed having the cafe and sundried store in the lobby. We enjoyed this hotel very much and would highly recommend it and cant wait to book it again.

Location, location, location. That said, my visits to NYC are always good, it has little to do with the hotel, the hotel is secondary. I did have a small visitor, the rodent type. It really didn’t bother me that much, but really? I did report the visitor to the front desk and they appeared to be alarmed so I would imagine something was done. So, other than that, it’s all good.

The location was great! We got around very well and Penn Station right across the street was nice! The hotel was very busy the weekend we were there and everyoneseemed friendly and helpful. The rooms were a little on the small side, but we literallyfell in the bed whenever we did get back form our day of adventure in this wonderful city. No coffeemaker in the room though.

Love it all. The restaurants and shops at the foot steps of the hotel. Transportation every second.The people from all over this earth. New York is amazing. The hotel very clean and spacious. Westminster dog show at Madison Square Gardens in front of the hotel.Every day was perfect so lively and happy. ❤️❤️❤️

Centrally located, access to Penn station is only a 2 minutes walk, Times square is another 10 minutes walk.Hotel Pennsylvania - Old beautiful hotel, rooms are good.The Stay - Initially the room allotted to us had the smell of cigarette but the concern was immediately addressed by the reception clerk Maria 'B', she allotted us another room as per our requirements of the view of Madison Square Garden (MSG).The breakfast was very good, the staff is very friendly and helpful, Maria 'B' has been a wonderful host and made our stay memorable.

Old beautiful hotel, great convinient location, super friendly stuff, I stay in the same hotel many many times for 17 years.Now you can have a new pool/gym, restaurant ( at discount pr.), free breackfast, Penn station across the street, free local/international calls, Internet speed better than home - you don't need anything else, do you?

Our second time staying and had no regrets. Although the queue for the line was a bit long when we arrived it moved quickly. We got a room on the 14th floor which was spacious and clean. The bed is probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Lots of restarants and shops to visit in the area. This will be my go to when opting to stay in the city.

Very centrally located. Good breakfast and nice room. But was given initially a very unpleasant room and though it was changed the attitude of the checkin clerk underwent a complete change from pleasant to rude. On the whole a good hotel

We stayed here to rest our heads on this journey here in the big apple. The place is quite fancy and the staff was super friendly and efficient, I had no complaints. I would rebook and enjoy this place all over again in due time

We had a wonderful stay at the hotel.Our room was very comfortable and very clean.Stuff was very welcoming and attentive. Loved our stay!!!The location was great close to everything.Can't wait until our next visit

A group of 15 stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. this was a school trip so my students behaved like typical students. The staff was friendly and kind to us, we thought one of our rooms was too small and they quickly gave us a bigger one. They served us very well. We stayed at this hotel last year for the same period of time and we will definitely be back next year. The greatest part is THE CUSTOMER SERVICE. We felt like we were all related.

First stayed at the Penn some fifty years ago to attend Westminster dog show. Have seen it go through several "renovations." For the first time, it's been done right, including giving staff some pride. Stayed in a renovated room on the 9th floor.

My friend booked this hotel for our trip in the summer as we were attending a concert at MSG and the hotel is directly opposite (great location!!!) later we read the reviews, we was concerned we had made a big mistake. When we arrived the check in was fairly quick despite the long queue and we went to our room (I cannot remember which floor we was on) but when we got to the room... we was literally waiting for Lady Gaga to rock up and murder us both. The room was small and very dark.. eery!! The whole floor smelt of cigarette smoke aswell. The air con unit in the room was full of dust, the room was incredibly dated and there was a strange mark on the floor that my friend thinks was blood. So we decided to go and have some lunch and think about what we wanted to do.When we returned we decided we wasn’t going to stay in that room to die so I went to reception and asked to move. The lady I spoke to understood completely and offered two other rooms so we went to see both and we was pleasantly surprised! The room we stayed in was so much brighter, cleaner, bigger! The windows were clean which made a huge difference, the bathroom was a lot bigger... not today Gaga.We was so happy that we were given another room I genuinely don’t think that we could have stayed in the first room for 5 nights, Gaga or no Gaga.The hotel has WiFi and a coffee shop in the lobby. If you have breakfast you have to go to a small cafe down the road for a continental breakfast bagel and coffee - we did this once it’s not the best. This hotel is in a brilliant location, literally opposite MSG and a short walk to Times Square, Macy’s etc. As above we booked this due to location and it was reasonably priced too. For the location it’s worth it (if you get a better room that our first one!) the staff were helpful, the security was good, it’s a busy New York hotel but you get what you pay for, it’s not the ritz! Overall I have to say it was a lovely stay! I would def stay here again if next time I visit NYC!

No problem as usual renovated rooms are very spacious first class location people need to be a little more relaxed on holiday and stop complaining about things that don't matter remember your on vacation to get out not find fault with a hotel room

At first I was disappointed with the room, but that was no problem cause once I went to front desk and coincidentally the manager Tiffany assisted me and how disappointed I was, she upgraded our room really nicely and had a great stay. Thanks it was for making me feel comfortable. Besides that it's a great location, centric, lots of stores and restaurants all around the hotel.

Felt the hotel was very nice and especially so for the price! We stayed in a renovated room and it was clean and comfortable. Only problem I had was the placement of the shower head!?!? Whaaaaaat? Yes... the shower head... It sprayed out toward the curtain and it could not be moved down or in so I ended up having to take baths in order to get clean and RINSED!! Only other minor problem was there was no blackout curtain so it felt like daytime in our room during the night! Word of advice: Get an inside room... the noise (sirens, horns honking, traffic) of NYC is constant ... and loud!

I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania for the second time (the first was May 2019). This trip, I needed 14 nights of accommodation and, based on my enjoyable visit last time, I chose Hotel Pennsylvania again. The location is simply unbeatable, being across the street from Madison Square Garden and the major subway station, Penn Station, a short walk to Macy’s, Target, Old Navy, Sephora and many food and beverage options.When I arrived (late at night after 24 hours of travel), the room I had requested was not available. Unfortunately, my experience at this point was far less than satisfactory and not what I had expected since my first stay. Reservations clerk Maria B. really came through for me and went to lengths to ensure I was comfortable, at least until the following day when she put me in touch with Steven Fennell, the Director of Front Office. This man went above and beyond and was determined to ensure my satisfaction which I appreciated enormously. I was finally relocated to a room even better than the one I had requested and will always remember the genuine kindness and professionalism showed to me.In booking my stay, I had unwittingly created some confusion with my bookings and so my account became a bit convoluted. Steven again applied focus to correcting this issue and reassuring me it would all be resolved.As for the hotel itself, it’s an old property and as such, has some ‘character’ that has featured in many, many negative reviews. What people need to remember is that there are two choices when booking Hotel Pennsylvania … the cheaper ‘Classic’ rooms and the higher-priced ‘Penn Plaza Collection’ rooms. The latter are recently renovated and, in my opinion, can’t be faulted. Many of the rooms at Hotel Penn are extremely large, not just by NYC standards but generally speaking.Pay no attention to nasty reviews that mention vermin and other awful things. If you want an excellent place to stay, in the middle of everything (but not in tourist central, Times Square), then choose Hotel Pennsylvania. The wi-fi was 100% reliable and fast, housekeeping and maintenance are responsive and efficient, porters are friendly and there is a 24hr store in the lobby for coffee, snacks and drinks. There is a large gathering area on each floor for meetings or social get-togethers, and an ice machine and vending machine on various levels. Hot water and water pressure were good, my bed was exceptionally comfortable and clean, rooms are serviced daily and the heating system was efficient and worked well. Large screen TV even offers Chromecast.Special mention to my lovely housekeeper Iris who was warm, friendly and did a great job every day.
