Much appreciated.When booking at Hotel Pennsylvania, if you intend to spend a decent amount of time in your room, invest a little extra and request a Penn Plaza Collection room. If you intend to simply lay your head down at night and spend the rest of your time exploring New York City, then keep in mind that this is an old hotel and you truly do get what you pay for and if only sleeping there, then it represents good value for money. Meanwhile, the hotel is undergoing a gradual transformation so in time, all the rooms will be of the same, much better standard.I will definitely be back next time I’m in NYC.

This is NYC, you get what you pay for...Unless you are willing to pay 300 plus a night, you are not getting the same room you got in Orlando...The location is great for all the NYC things u Want to do...Plenty of security

I can’t say I’m surprised that everything about this hotel was awful! The check in staff were not friendly. First off, hard to find the reception. Hotel room was dirty and size of closet. Booked this hotel for fun seeing it was cheap. You certainly get what you paid for. The hallways were so long and it took a little while to find my room. It just seemed like a maze and crime scene waiting to happen. It felt like an asylum. People should pick this for October, a Halloween scare and torture.

When my family and I had first arrived we were told our reservation did not exist, Maria B saved the day and hooked us up with the best room in the hotel. If it wasn’t for her our trip would have been ruined. I 100% recommend this hotel because of Maria. So if you go she’s the person to talk to!!

This is my second visit to the hotel.the 1st one was in August 19. Thus time I booked the renovated room in the 10th floor. The furniture, carpet, tv screen & bathroom are perfect. I loved that the tv screen has a Chromecast feature its really cool. The wifi is goodLocation is excellent.The only comment I have is that the heat in the air conditioner is weak. I really recommend it as the best value of money. I will come again for sure

Quite decent. Huge hotel, old building and fixtures, slightly strange smell in the passages, but in terms of value for money and central location in NYC you can't get any better. If you want to stay in central Manhatten, give it a a try.

Fantastic Location right across the street from Penn Station and Madison Square gardens, for getting around NYC, but that is all this hotel is good for. Honestly, the staff are pretty good too, but I feel for them...working in such a gong show. You need to request everything twice, at least, and even then, you might not get it...like a bath tub plug, but instead get a cocked on strainer over the drain while out exploring! Or a proper blanket, good luck...beds are comfy enough,but don't expect a proper blanket or duvet on it.We moved rooms 3 times in 24 hrs, and it's not because we are picky, we have stayed in all sorts of places, and worked in hotels over the years, but never anything like this nutty place...anyway we had water issues in our first room, meaning dark brown greasy water pouring out due to a maintenance issue, and then again for getting put into unfinished rooms. The staff did their best to work with what they have,but it ain't much! Shout out to Maria on front desk, she was literally the only reason we kept our week long booking here. Nothing really was done properly, in their refurbished rooms, so layer of bathtub coming off as you run water, wall paint all over carpet and drips down walls. It's sad, because this hotel obviously was spectacular, but clearly not enough put back into it.It smelled like weed every day in the hallways. When you get the breakfast you feel like you are lining up for daily rations or something. Bagels were good but the rest is a waste of time.Overall, definitely will not stay here again when I come back to NY and we do not recommend.

We stayed there for 10 nights,some of the staff were rude, I too work in a hotel and that's a capital sin in the hospitality industry.Right from the start, we got there at around past 6pm room was not ready, so we were instructed that we can leave our luggage, we went downstairs to use their disgusting and seemed to be a public restroom, when we saw the bellman we asked him if where do we leave our luggage then he got mad, he raised his tone saying the luggage counter was close who told us we can leave our bags? I talked to the guy at the Front to report the unacceptable behavior of the bellman but he seemed to not care. When we got to the room. Bed was well made but the carpet was still dirty. We requested a 12pm check out but boy, we 2 different housekeepers knocked in our room the second one was very very rude, she asked us in her words, you know what our check out time right? i told her we were given a complimentary 12 pm check out and she replied “oh yeah?” With the tone insinuating I was making it up. Location was great, close to penn other than that there was

Muy buen hotel excelente ubicación y todos muy amables y atentos Está frente al madison sqare garden tiene el metro en la esquina me gusto mi estadiaVery good hotel excellent location and all very friendly and attentive It is in front of the madison sqare garden has the subway in the corner I liked my stay

Booked a room for one night. Great location across from Madison Square Garden. Lobby is lovely. Room not so much. I stayed in 515A. As soon as I walked in I did not have a good feeling. Outlets were overloaded with plugs. Pictures were missing from the walls. Bathroom shower was missing a drain. Closet door was falling apart. Towel holder was 80% rusted. Security at the elevators was also a joke. I almost forgot to mention the dust by the radiator.

We stayed here for three nights, got a room with a great view to Empire State Building at no extra charge, clean room with clean restrooms and nice environment. Hotel is located near train stations so is very easy to move to any place in manhattan, queens, Bronx or Brooklyn. Continental breakfast is included ( a bagel, fruit and a drink) but for ten dollar I upgraded my breakfast to the very decent buffet.I have stayed before at other hotels but this was just better at very affordable rates. I would definitely stay here again!

When you got at room, everything was okay, but when we try to took a shower, there was not hot water in shower, then I call 3 times to front desk, they said that will send someone to try to fix, but we have to leave to grab something to eat, when we returned, nothing happened, so we took a cold shower, in next morning the problem was there, so then I call again, but no one did something to fix it, then I did my checkout to another Hotel, and when I was doing my checkout, they apologized for what happened, and gave me 50$ for inconvenient, but what's 50 Dollars , Just pone night there was 175$ I`m very disappointed with them.

The location is amazing, right outside of Madison Square Garden, 5-10 min walk to Times Square and less than 5 mins to ESB. The hotel it’s self is really dated, we changed rooms as the first room has plaster falling off the ceiling. Our second room was better but still needed a full return. The bathroom was pretty disgusting, to be honest we did end up buying new towels as they looks gross. Over all great location shame about the hotel itself.

This hotel was great to stay in I’m not sure why this hotel have so many negative reviews. The hotel was clean and all the staff members was Friendly. The breakfast was great I upgraded and $10 dollars but it was so good I will be coming back again

The price was good but the room that we had it wasn’t the best. The photos that are in the web doesn’t compare for what we get. It was a really dark the room. The bed it was good and the bathtub it was ok.

Just love it ! Rooms great size good tv , bathroom good size no complains at all , room service great all staffs great service ! I’ll definitely will come back again with out thinking! For the price definitely worth it!

We are still traumatised. Everything about the hotel is awful with the exception of the location. We arrived on Christmas Day with two little boys and were so horrified with the state of the hotel, we walked out. We were prepared to sleep in the car rather than this place of horror!The hotel needs massive refurbishment. It’s dirty, mouse droppings in the corners of the hotel’s room and hair in the sink, carpets covered in mould. As many other reviewers said, the hotel looks nothing like the pictures on their website. Crowded, smelly, disgusting place. Rude staff was clearly immune to constant guests’ complaints. Yes it is cheap and yes it is in a good location but if you have any wiggle room on your budget I suggest you book elsewhere so you can sleep and shower in peace.It took us a month of daily emails and phone calls (from the UK!) to get our money back. A miracle, most guests never see a penny of the refund promised.

The hotel is one of the worst ones I've ever been to. Not only the room was not fit to accommodate, but also the clerk overcharged us 100 bucks as a "security deposit" that they never refunded. The only good thing about this moldy sorry excuse of a hotel is its location.

What a horrible level of customer service! I have even e-mailed to their accounts team asking for an update for my refund and no one bothers to respond, despite having sent reminder E-mails. Due to some unforeseen circumstances, I had to cancel my booking prior to the stipulated date and I was eligible for a 100% refund. Yet some amount had been charged by the hotel which has not yet been refunded. This kind of service is abysmal! Horrendous to say the least!
user_name:
Siddharth M
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Very good rooms, the location of the hotel is perfect. The hotel is between the Madison square garden and the empire state building. We has a good time in this lovely city. Hlighly recommended. Hope to come back someday.

Yes it's not the Ritz Carlton, but if you like reasonable prices, large rooms and nice and friendly people for a nice clean room in midtown then this place is great!Our room was a little dated and could use some freshening up, but this place is 100 years old and gives off that old world, return to yester-year feel. I loved the experience.Went to MSG for event and and you couldn't get any closer.Would stay here again. Just reserve the updated rooms if you want to avoid possible bad rooms as they renovate.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 days whilst in New York. We stayed in a Penn Plaza room on the 11th floor which was lovely and quite big. The hotel service is good and we were lucky to have been served always by lovely staff. Breakfast across the street at Cafe R was very good and we recommend eating at Feile Pub near by also. The gym downstairs was great also. We would definitely stay again, the location is top!

Needs (1) renovation, (2) more and better front desk and housekeeping staff (3) upgrade of "Business Center". and (4) in-hotel sit down food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The good and only reason I chose the Hotel Pennsylvania was location.

Theses guys are hooking people with low rate, but resort and other fees are more than room rate. This place is actually way more expensive than comparable places with no fees. Room dated and a little thread bare but the shady fees show a criminal mindset. Boo.
user_name:
Frank L R
New York City, New York

review_body: This is now my go to hotel when I come to NYC for concerts. We have stayed two times so far and plan on making it our "concert hotel" from now on. The upgraded rooms are beautiful. Just as any other place, they have their flaws (a broken handle here, chipped pain there) but nothing major. I haven't stayed in the old rooms so I can't vouch for the shape they are in. The price and location are perfect!

I'm New Yorker, who knows this city so well, you can blindfolded me. It was an amazing surprise. I love this hotel at the moment ,I walked in.This is a landmark hotel Early years. The Hotel Pennsylvania was built by the Pennsylvania Railroad and operated by Ellsworth Sattler It opened on January 25, 1919 and was designed by William Symmes Richardson of the firm of McKim, Mead & White, which also designed the original Pennsylvania Station located across the street.This an old hotel.With marvelous fixtures, the old charm. beautiful chandeliers. Is been renovated and when is ready would look amazing.the location is great, restaurants, bar, boutiques all near by. Very commercial area. But Happy..The rooms are quite spacious if you are lucky to book with the right agent. And the front desk and staff are so kind and friendly. Always willing to pleased. A found a wonderful staff person, who helped us to get an upgraded deal, since we were staying longer the them we supposed to , we had to vacate and checked back to the hotel again .Expedia had us panicking, for not making the proper arrangements. Neither have our reservation for the following day .It was very stressful. And Maria B at the front desk saved us, it was such a relieved .She not only exchanged our room for a better room, she was fair enough to make arrangements so we can have our favorite room available again for our remaining days . You are the best Maria.Thank you so much.Our home are going through renovations, so we were allover this town trying to find a decent place that we can feel comfortable. And our wallet wouldn’t bleed Since we rather not staying at the strangers homes. We found Penn Plaza, reasonable rates and close to everything we need to be. They are renovating, needs a refreshing up. This is a beautiful hotel. Grand. Marble and golden fixtures is found everywhere. High ceilings, with beautiful chandeliers. Circa 1919. I would have loved to be here decades ago. Would have been fabulous. Hey I felt at home lol.Generous breakfast on the house. Free drinks for the guests. A gym. Whatever do you want?We had a great stay and we recommend the lower floors, for families as the rooms are quiet spacious. And the higher floors, are the new penn collection. We feel very comfortable.Lets not forget to tip the staff. New Yorker's would like you even better. Book it!
user_name:
bonvivantnyc87
New York City, New York

review_body: Me and my brother were staying at other hotel and decided to change it some other option. I was at this hotel 7 years ago and it was amazing to come back to same location. On check in there was lady receptionist called Maria "B", she was justtt soooo friendly, sweet and helping. Nice to see customer service is improved and rooms much more modern. Location is as known too good to be true, everything walking distance. Clean room and housekeepers as well so friendly that almost feels like home. Definitely would come back and reccommend to friends this spot. Rates are affordable and good.

I was in New York during the holidays with my friend. we resided in Pennsylvania hotel. It was a great hotel, clean and welcoming. I did a lot of walks because the landscapes was Wonderfull, the size of the buildings is incredible and there were so many buildings that it's impossible to count them. New York is a most beautiful city! I also ate a lot, and the fast food out there is not like there. Obviously I was seeing the statut of freedom because she is the celebrity of New York. It will remain my best trip and I will never forget.

Stayed again after visiting a few months ago and enjoyed my stay again. The new rooms are lovely and the housekeeping ladies were so nice. Loved my swan! Can't get this deal anywhere else for the price and service. Thank you Pennsylvania.

Room was fairly clean, except for a hair we found under the top sheet. The AC / heater must have been broken because it only blew hot air, so we slept on top of the covers. Otherwise a very nice experience and staff was quite friendly and helpful.

Loved the hotel, loved the location, close to anything you need, restaurants, bars , subway, attractions, coffee shops everything, housekeeping staff were AMAZING doing their job rooms always very clean, the security people and at the door i don’t know the name of the job , very welcoming, operator asked for something was very nice, reception desk , everything was very nice , loved it, hope to come back and I will stay again at Hotel Pennsylvania

For the price, the room and the hotel delivered. It was selected because of it's convenient location to Penn Station. The breakfast is modest, but at least gets your day started with something. I would choose it again.

The location is fantastic. Close to Madison Square Garden and Times Square. Also, within walking distance of AMC and Regal theaters. Lots of bars and restaurants in the vicinity.1. Please carry ear plugs as it gets noisy almost all the time. You will find it comfortable to wear them when there's noise after midnight in the corridor.

Everything you need for a trip to the city. The voucher for breakfast was a nice surprise and the coupon to a nearby restaurant for discounted meal and a free drink was also a nice touch. The valet parking was also easy ($55 for 24 hours) and a no hassle experience.

Room was ok, dated. But clean. Did not enjoy all the doors banging so early in the morning. check in and check out was very swift. Location was the best for what I needed. Price was good.Breakfast in the morning was ok...had to walk outside and down the street for a bagel and drink and fruit cup, but it was enough to get me started. Breakfast voucher with check-in. All-in-all....good. I would stay again.

Hotel Pennsylvania has excellent location, easy access, suitable and quiet room at the most affordable price. I would stay there again. Room were large and clean everything worked. It's not luxury but it works!

Very best place,very good price,very good service for the oldest and biggest hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Amazing transportation,attractions,shopping etc. I recomend this hotel for all with pleasure

It was a great time!! The bedroom was clean, very comfortable, it had a big tv. The bathroom was okay, everything was clean, I just regret that it didn’t have exhaust. But we had a great experience in that hotel

Stayed through 01/02/20 for a night, and encountered so many boom boxes and ongoing marijuana drug fests on 3rd floor that I had to be moved an hour or more to another floor. The problem was that management could care less about the guests, and in this case I was compelled after flying in from London with a young daughter to go up and down from my unacceptable room to find what was finally an evasive manager to move me. This is not a hotel that cares about sleep and accommodation, and their arrogance that night should cause them to lose their license or have it suspended as a guest accommodation center in NYC

Hotel Pennsylvania now has an online room service. My experience with this was terrific. The menu is interesting with good basic stuff. I got a really excellent beef stew. The price was very reasonable: $16! No service charges fees etc. I did tip of course. From the time I logged on it took only 30 minutes for the food to be delivered. This was at 8pm on a weekday night. This makes staying at Hotel Pennsylvania very agreeable.

I really appreciate Maria B! She is lovely and made me and my dog feel comfortable about our stay. The room was also very accommodating. I have been returning for the past three weeks. Conveniently located in the heart of fashion square and across the street from Penn Station!

Central location.. right across New York’s famous Pen Station and Madison square garden but that pretty much all this property has to offer. The rooms:- Dingy and dirty.- Toilets are dirty and you’d be very lucky to have to cleaned every day.- Paint is peeling off (photos attached).- Rooms don’t have an air conditioning unit. - Poor heating system. Doesn’t work 24/7.- Don’t be fooled by the ‘free breakfast offer’. The property provides coupons for breakfast at a near by cafe (which is not located on the property). You will only get a bagel, a fruit and one drink on that coupon. The management:The management doesn’t bother about your suffering. I booked a king room in the newly furnished building but was given a run down room in the old building (don’t be too excited about the new wing. It is only renovated in name). The next day, after multiple complaints I was moved to the king room after 7pm. The room had bed bugs but the management didn’t bother doing anything about it. The toilet did not have warm water and they didn’t do anything about it.I had no option but to check out. The manager was rude and over charged me while I was clearly suffering at this property from day one. Over all: Not worth your money. The lobby, the rooms and the toilets are in bad shape. I suggest you walk into this property and have a look before booking. Pay attention to the absence of cleaning. It is filthy. Found bags full of trash in the elevators (photos attached). I wouldn’t recommend this property even if it is the last place that has a room to offer in the city. Look for other options near by. Check in and check out will take forever. They usually have one person on the long old front desk. Don’t expect much help from the rude manager. Stay away from this hell hole!

The Hotel is ok not bad, . My disappointment was my money back I reserved a room on september 15 they told me that I can up grade the room , I accept that they charge me more . I paid but they charge a deposit as well I know every hotel charge a deposit it is ok.. but the problem is that now is Jan 2020 and I dont see my money back in my account, I called may times and not body can answer me or resolve that situation I e-mail as well many times and the same thing.. Please dont leave any credit card you wont see the money back and your account and it it happens not body will respond you...

I have not even stayed at the hotel! I booked this hotel for a week in December 2020 with a full refund no prepayment agreement with the hotel. They charged me $250 on 7th January, I contacted them immediately. I received a reply form my first few emails but now they are completely ignoring me and still have not refunded me my money. So just a warning to anyone that is thinking of this hotel, I have been treated awfully and I still do not have my money!

very good value at the price its located in a very great location steps from the meetings I had to go toI would return on my next trip My only complaint ishow busy the location is being so near Penn Station

The room was small, but very nice, clean and had all of the amenities that I needed. My disappointment was that I made my reservation in October asking for a handicap accessible room and when I arrived 3 months later not only did they not have one, they put me as far away from the elevator as they could. I thank them for a walk in shower, but it doesn't help if you have nothing to sit on and your balance isn't the best.

Great place. Lovely renovations. And the price was very reasonable for the amount of days. Very friendly staff all around. Their perks are great. Plenty of options and things to do. Great location!! Will be there again very soon.

Wonderful location. Hotel is nice enough and very convenient to many restaurants, etc.The location is directly across the street from Penn Station which is how I travel to NYC regularly. Pleant of restaurants and pubs just steps away.

I come to New York City often and I will not stay anywhere else. This hotel has a very convenient location, clean and cozy rooms, and helpful staff. What more could you ask for. Oh, the price! The price is unbeatable.

I book with this hotel frequently for work and staff is great, I always have a wonderful experience with Maria B. at the front desk. She’s always willing to go the extra mile for her guests and it shows (trust me- I’m typically not someone who leaves reviews for hotels). Thanks to Maria B. and all of the other staff members that work hard to create a wonderful guest experience!

The hotel overall is good, new rooms and good location! In my opinion the hotel should have a restaurant, so you don’t have to go outside to get breakfast. And with that location a rooftop bar would be nice too!!!

Great time, great hotel, great funEvery time we stay in Manhattan we come to Hotel Pennsylvania. We loved the upgraded room. Very nice much nicer then the classic rooms. Also location is the best.....

We stayed here last year (2019) and our experience was not very good. This was our first time coming down to see a NY Rangers game and stay over night. The staff was not helpful and our room was pretty dismal and not at all nice. We thought we would give them a second chance since we knew that Hotel Penn was renovating and making changes. I am glad we did. My wife and daughter were much happier and enjoyed being in New York and doing some shopping. Our room was clean, modern furniture, the room had lots of open space, the room was much brighter, and the bathroom was clean. The staff person was helpful on our express check-in and gave us our tickets for continental breakfast and complimentary drink tickets to Feile or Stout. The continental breakfast was at Cafe-R outside of the hotel and down the street a little ways. The breakfast consisted of a large fruit cup, bagel or (muffin,danish), and a drink (water, coffee, juice). This worked very well for us and it was well stationed to handle the people coming through. The family was happy. We attended the Rangers game at MSG and lost the game in the last 26 seconds of the 3rd period. A real let down! After the game we went to the Irish Bar Stout and used our drink tickets and that put back a positive spin back onto the evening events. Overall my girls were happy with the shopping, the Hotel turn around, and were a little disappointed in the Rangers loss. The beauty of it for us was that we took Amtrak down from Syracuse to Penn Station, you walk across the street to your Hotel and MSG is right there across the street. No hassles and very easy. We are very likely to do this again next year!

We were in this hotel during X'mas & New Year. Booked 2 rooms in 5th Floor. Ms. Akhter Jahan was the house keeping lady for most of our 2 wks stay. She was fantastic and friendly. We really appreciate her hard work n dedication. Hotel need immediate attention on carpets, lights and the reception. They should think about adding more staff in the front desk to manage check ins.... Hotel has enough space to arrange a break fast area instead of sending guest to nearby restaurant!

I was in room 924A. When I walked into the lobby, my first impression was WOW! So BIG. I checked in and went to my room. My first impression was WOW. So small! I did have a small frig, a desk and chair, a bathroom with a loe seat, and a shower only. The window looked out into an office building across the street. The training I was attending was in this building, so I did not have far to go to my meetings. I did get a free breakfast at a resturant down the road and across the street. Also, two free drinks and 15% off lunch, 20% off dinner at two different bars, again across the street and down the road a bit. Overall, I think the hotel is a good for many people. There is an option to use the NY Fitness Center down the street as a person staying the the Hotel PA.

We were just doing a quick NY stay! We walked out of PENN station and there was the hotel! Perfectly located for everything we wanted to do! We could walk to see the Rockettes .... Times Square.... great places to eat! The room was clean and check in and out was easy! We will be staying here again! Also, we were able to get a room with 3 beds!! PERFECT FOR A FAMILY!!!! The room was huge!!!

It was great to step off Amtrak and go across the street to your hotel.Hotel was nice, clean and comfortable beds. I am sure it will be better when they open up the Restaurant. I think it is sad the this big hotel in midtown has a "Cash Only" coffee & bakery shop -- come-on its the 20th century and inside the hotel, very sad. It would be great if the rooms or a central location had a microwave the guest could you.

Location is wonderful price is great most of the rooms is not updated. But the rooms that are not updated is very spacious. The manager angel was very accommodating. The one downfall there was no blankets on the bed. End it takes forever for them to bring you something when you call down to the front desk. But had fun for the weekend. Oh one more thing the valet parking is $55 a day and you cannot go in and out. In the regular parking that they tell you to park in is $37 a day.

In a world filled with modern technology and bustling city life, Hotel Pennsylvania truly capitalizes on the authentic and vintage experience. With checker-tiled bathroom floors and crown-molding ceilings, it feels like you have been transported into another era. Yet, as you step through the revolving doors that lead you towards the outside world, you are greeted by countless taxis, stores, markets, and restaurants.This hotel is in the center of everything; right across from Penn Station and Madison square garden; a few blocks away from Times Square; surrounded by fan-favorite eateries like R-Cafe, Charley's and S'barro. Hotel Pennsylvania provided my family with a unique and thrilling experience.

Very convent location to Madison Square Garden. Only stayed 1 night. Very clean and the staff was very friendly. Would defiantly stay there again. Stayed on the 9th floor. Beds are comfy and room was clean.

The front desk attendant was extremely pleasant! “Maria B.” She made my experience here in NYC so much better! She couldn’t have been more helpful and addressed every one of my needs-Extremely professional, and caring! Definitely coming back, and will only stay here!

The staff are very rude & no manners at all. Just some terrible people working there. What an awful hotel. Will never book this rubbish place for a second time. First time seen such rude staff in my life.

Me and my fiance at the time visited this hotel and was checked in for 4 nights back in december. Long story short our room had zero electricity and the carpet was covered in mould, the bathroom was disgusting and we demanded a refund for our room to which they then was rude. Me and my fiance ended up £1,000 out of pocket which we have never been refunded.Will never ever ever stay here again. It's a hotel of nightmares

EXCELLENT location, this is the best feature. Penn Station is just across the street and it´s right in the middle of midtown, walking distance to all major attractions. Good breakfast, it´s maybe simple, just a bagel and a fruit cup but it´s always fresh and tastes good. The hotel is old, let´s even say it´s a historic landmark, so don´t expect the comforts of a new construction (although they are going through renovations). For example, the room´s window was super drafty and the room was cold but they solved that giving us extra blankets. And this takes me to my next point: the incredible staff, everyone there was nice, accommodating and eager to solve whatever issue we had. Especially MARIA, she did our check-in and upgraded us to a newer room, then when we talked to her about the room being cold she immediately called management and solved the issue. People like Maria make a huge difference in your perception and experience. It doesn´t matter how new and cool a place is if the staff sucks.Bottomline this place has the best location and amazing staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Great stay. Front desk personnel very nice. But security guards next to elevator were very rude and not helpful. Rooms were old but clean. Would recommend to friends. Great location close to many landmarks

Good sized room, well decorated. Large, very comfortable bed. Large T.V. and fast access to Wifi. Bathroom a little dated but clean. Staff helpful and friendly. Breakfast included and was served in café across the road from 6.30 to 10.30. Again friendly, helpful staff and a good selection of food- fresh fruit, porridge, various pastries, juices, tea or coffee.

Nice Hotel very convenient to Madison Square Garden and the train station in the basement of Madison Square Garden. The breakfast they offered at the Cafe across 32nd street was very tasty and filling. For an older building, the room was very clean very modern. The overall appearance of the place did not look like it was stuck in the 1970's. There was an issue with one of the self check in kiosks, however there was an on sight attendant that was able to work through the issue.

The location is perfect - across 7th Ave from Penn Station/Madison Sq Garden, even easy if you're driving (blocks from the Lincoln Tunnel). The staff was accommodating (no problem checking in a few hours early.) Room was clean. Yes, it was small, but most of the old hotels in NYC have small rooms, and this one had a king-size bed with plenty of space to move around, so it didn't feel cramped. Free continental breakfast (pastry, fruit & coffee) included (cafe/buffet across 32nd Street.) Full buffet available for more $. Complimentary cocktail at bar across the street. All for less than $120 - that's a NYC bargain!!!

Its a crappie place. Was very disappointed when I saw they didn't have a microwave and they cancelled my reservation before arrival time so I had to make a new reservation and pay more money. They wouldn't even let my guess arrive at the hotel before me. Definitely do not recommend unless you going smash crash then dash

The staff were all friendly and helpful, the room had everything I need, also quiet, despite the location in the city centre. If you don't mind that the hotel looks old (but then, it is an old building from 1919!), it can be very enjoyable.

We stayed a couple of nights after Christmas. The position is really strategic. Because of some problems during check in they gave us a suite so that was nice. The rooms were big with a wonderful view. The bathroom definitely must be upgraded. The lobby always full of people, very long waits. Some at the reception were nice. Some rude without a smile nor a hello (blonde woman with black glasses ). Too bad the prices shoot to the stars during that week.

Starting with the positive, Good location....that's it. This hotel is dirty, loud,crowded, rooms are tiny, staff are rude or dis-interested. The cheap and nasty renovations seem to be falling apart before your eyes. (Very clever photoshop on marketing material) The bathroom linen is terrible (I think this is where hotel towels go to die) and that's if housekeeping have enough by the time the service your room, after 4:00pm on many occasions. Be prepared to walk half a block and line up to get your "on the go breakfast" of 1 x danish, a cup of fruit and rubbish coffee. To add insult to injury on check out the hotel charged me for the rooms that were already pre-paid ($4,000 AUD). I did not discover this until I was in another state and called only to be told that it was a software error and I would get refunded in 7-10 days(took about 2 weeks), this resulted in being stressed financially for the remainder of my vacation.

The room was pretty old, fairly clean. Not very noisy. Really good location next to Penn Station and only a few blocks away from Times Square. Pleasant staff, good service. Can hold luggage there for 5$ a bag for a single day.

Pictures are not what this hotel is like. Booking in - we used automatic machines on entrance and when we were done and no keys appeared, we were told to book in at reception. Receptionist lovely. Entrance fab. Booked into rooms on 3 rd floor. Just ewwww! Thank god only here for one night. Very run down. One beds sheets have small blood stains. We have horrible brown covers. Carpets need good clean. Windows need good clean. Place need rooms gutting and redone. Awful

We had a very nice stay at hotel Pennsylvania, the room was clean and neat. The house keeper was friendly and attentive. We also met Maria B and she answered all questions we had with enthusiasm and a smile. She made us feel welcome and looked after. She was a joy!!

Honestly the most accommodating woman I’ve ever met! For two days she was the highlight of our stay! I will be returning for sure and it’s mostly because of her hospitality. The rooms are great for price as well.

The hotel is nearby of everything, take the upper floors rooms, i took one of Peen plazza Collection its great room, staff are amazing especially Maria' B" as for her she is keen to give you the perfect service and help.

I have no complaints! Our room on the 17th floor was very nice, roomy and very Clean. We had a great view and the service upon check in and out was impeccable. There is a museum on the 1wth floor which is a must see. You will see the toilet and shower head are very low....lol taking a trip to the museum will give you all kinds of answers as to why.We will definitely be back

I only booked here because a friend recommended to stay here since I was going to Madison Square Garden. Well I guess you get what you pay for. Dirty Carpets, Dirty walls with pencil markings and it gets worse. The bathtub in room 502 has huge cracks and holes in it. You can literally stick your toes in the holes. I didn’t bother taking a picture (forgot) because I immediately grabbed my bags and left. Booked at the renaissance (Marriot) as soon as I walked out. Yes it is cheap and yes it is in a good location but if you have any wiggle room on your budget I suggest you book elsewhere so you can sleep and shower in peace. The staff was nice and professional.

I stayed in the Penn Plaza Collection with 2 double beds. Very spacious room and was able to fit a roll around bed in there as well! Clean and simple rooms with great prices for the location and helpful staff. Would definitely stay again!

We booked in the newly renovated tower! Rooms were spacious. As for the beds.... can I recommend a fitted sheet or mattress cover?! Also thank goodness for a window to crack open at night because the heat would not turn off. This hotel is in the middle of everything and you can walk to most of NYC main attractions from the hotel. The free bfast vouchers were a nice touch and we loved being able to check in early for a small charge. Staff and security were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely keep Hotel Pennsylvania in mind when planning our next trip to NYC.

After reading all of the terrible reviews, I was very apprehensive of seeing how our hotel visit would turn out. However, we were very pleasantly surprised with what we got. We arrived around 7PM and checked in within 5 minutes...not much of a wait at all and very painless. We got a room on one of the newly renovated floors and we had no concerns or issues. The rooms were clean and had everything we needed. The rooms are pretty small but for the price we paid and the location of the hotel, you can’t beat it. The hotel is located literally across from Penn station which is the best part. We were given vouchers for free breakfast for both mornings which included bagels, fruit, and juice. We also got free drink vouchers for the bar next door. I can’t speak for the non-renovated rooms, but from our experience, I would return back to the Pennsylvania Hotel.

Very good room but no towels in the room,I call and ask for two towels and the lady on the phone was very rude to me,1hour and 30 min pass and still didn’t bring anything so I called again and when I asked again for towels she hang up the phone on me.i didn’t like her attitude and how she spoke to me please do something about it .i had to leave the room all wet and ask the housekeeping girl for towels but everything else was fine and okay I loved it .!!

For what you pay, for the location, the cleanliness, the included breakfast and pleasant staff, this hotel stay was an excellent value. Super easy access to the subway, Penn Station, and great location. It is an old hotel, the room fixtures aren’t perfect but who cares you’re just sleeping there. The continental breakfast was perfect and for only $10 pp you can upgrade to an unbelievable breakfast bar. Would stay here again!

Very convenient and located on good spot!needs some updates new smooth blankets y una Buena manito d gato tal vez unas sabanas más suaves,son muy ásperas ,easyAccess to the station , in front of Madison square garden,al frente del madison square y de fácil acceso a las estaciones.

Classic hotel with friendly staff. Room was huge, but would have benefited from a fridge, maybe even an ice bucket!Clean and comfortable and across from Penn Station, a convenience we were looking for. Beware of pricing policies - a room for $100 gets an automatic $30 service fee which I was told covered the free breakfast and WiFi. Umm, that ain't free then.

absolutely perfect location & the lobby is beautiful. the rooms are super outdated and kinda gross but if you’re one to only sleep there and be out most of the time, it’s a great place. low prices are definitely a bonus.

It’s a great place to stay, the renovated rooms are very confortable. The hotel has a great location, over the subway station, it gives the ease of moving easily to the different places also locates in front of the MSG.

If you are thinking of booking this hotel think twice. My friends & me just flew 10 hours from ITALY, and arrived at the hotel almost at midnight. The reservation was made more than 1 month ago. Since we got here late, they gave our room away. YES they overbooked!! They said they were cleaning the rooms at 1:00am???!! What hotel cleans rooms at midnight? These are all lies!!! One woman flew 14hrs from turkey and was also without her room, there were few people with this same problem!! The manager was the most disgusting, unprofessional and rude person that exists. He should never work at any hotel ever!!!! THIS IS A NO NO!!!!

This year, we were given one of their newly remodeled rooms and it was much, much better than our stay last year. This hotel is not the best, but for a weekend trip to NYC in December, it's close to everything you want to see and do as well as affordable.

I found a rat in my room. I called to Guest Services and they hung up my phone call. Then I went to the front desk and talked to the manager who made me wait for a couple of minutes, and then when i explained my situation he didn't apologize about this. He just offered me a new room which is in the same poor conditions as the one that i was before.It's important to me that the Hotel would show some interest in my situation. A rat in a room shows a lack of mantaince as a low sanitation.

This place is ugly. The room is ugly. The shower needs to run for 5 minutes to get warm water. Pillows are hard and you only get one each. If you want an upgrade it’s $58 per night. I don’t think the upgrade would improve your experience. But the good points are...It’s cheap.The gym is very good.Free breakfast. Coffee, pastry and fruit.Close to everything. Huge room.Walk in robe.Clean and comfortable bed.TV works.Bring your earplugs. The street noise is incredible and doesn’t stop. Also my 8am wake up drill make sure I hit the gym each day.

The room are old and the hotel isn’t clean. For the cost of that hotel you can find better deal in nyc.They first gave me a room at the 5 floor. Small and dirty. After that they change me for a room at the 7 , big and dirty.

We were extremely disappointed with the room and the cracks in the tub, how dirty the toilet was, the furniture was old and warn, the bed was old and extremely uncomfortable and it was very loud outside of our room with people "hanging out" in the hall outside of our room. We asked them to go into a room but they didn't. Then at 9am, house keeping walked into our room while we were sleeping. We were told to use the 34th street parking garage and it was $36, i asked for the address and the woman said there is only 1 parking garage on 34th street. So we didn't check the cost of the parking garage and ended up paying $73 to park the car for 20 hours. We were extremely disappointed with our stay and will not be staying there again.

I checked into the hotel and Maria B, i’m not sure of her last name, was very loquacious and accommodating. i had nothing organized and she was patient and helped me with everything. On my second day i asked Maria if i could get a mini fridge and as i got back to my room someone was waiting for me with one. She takes a lot of pride in customer service and i will come back to Hotel Penn as long as she is here.

This hotel has an old-world feel... oh wait.. I mean third world feel to it. It's run down and crowded. The lobby looks and smells like a bus station and the lines for the reception and baggage are ridiculously long. Half the hotel is renovated and the other half looks like the hotel in the Shining. Dark and creepy hallways. They should send the bellhop down the side street to target to pick up a few light bulbs. Oh wait. They don't have a bellhop.So if you want to store your luggage for an hour or two? No problem. Five bucks. Cash. And they have a convenient ATM in the lobby that only charges six bucks for withdrawals. Then you can haul your luggage down to the basement where Lurch and Uncle Fester will safeguard your valuables.And the carpeting looks like it was purchased at auction after a train wreck and installed by drunk chimpanzees But that would be insulting. To Chimpanzees.The other bad reviews about this place are all spot on so do yourself a favor. Stay somewhere else.

After a nightmare getting a decent room, horrible customer service and wasting my time! Finally a manager helped getting me a better room, after all this I met Maria ‘B’ at the front desk who have the best customer service, a happy person that helped with everything else was missing for my 8nights stay! I hope the other workers were like her!.

Hotel Penn is a beautiful hotel me and my husband room was very nice and clean the staff had amazing hospitality I definitely would come back and stay at Hotel Penn its right in the heart of the city!
user_name:
Mrs_C_Rhodes
New York City, New York

review_body: Me and my family stayed on the third floor. First, the room looked really old and second a big mouse entered in the middle of the night. It was awful. The upgraded us to a better room on the 16th floor but anyways i dont recommend this hotel.

Stayed in one of the updated/new rooms- bathrooms were pretty small but you absolutely can not beat the price and RIGHT next to Penn station and very central to everything. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful - ALSO i loved that they offered early check in as early as 11am.

My mom and I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania from January 4th to January 6th, 2020. We were in room 1017, which is one of the newly-renovated Penn Plaza Collection rooms with a King Bed. While the room itself was on the smaller side, there was still plenty of room to store our suitcases and not feel packed like sardines in the space, and both the room/bathroom were very clean, which is honestly all that matters to me.We got to the hotel at about 9:45 AM after getting into the city on an early train (Penn Station is directly across the street, so that was the shortest walk ever with luggage), and were able to have our luggage stored for $5 a bag and the tickets for that were purchased from the front desk. This allowed us to go explore Midtown until we could check in, without having to worry about dragging bags with us. When we got back to the hotel at exactly 3 PM (check in time), we were able to easily use one of the express kiosks in the lobby, without having to wait in a long line to check in. This kiosk is also usable for checking out at the end of your stay, and the room keys can be dropped in a box near the elevators.Overall, this was an excellent stay! Staff was friendly, the facilities were clean, and the location could not be more perfect. We actually already have this hotel booked for early April when we go back to the city for Elton John's shows at MSG. Thank you for an awesome stay Hotel Pennsylvania, we will be back in a few months!!

It's old, it's relatively inexpensive-- except for when they load on the 'perks,' the free breakfast is down the street. And we shared a room with local widlife: a wee mousie. We saw it twice, so it was used to being seen. I said this to the woman who checked us out, she offered that we could speak with the manager, but by that time we were running late. It's not all glamorous, but it is adequate..

The “newly renovated” room was basic and needed touch ups, there was only lotion provided, no shampoo or soap in the bathroom- thankfully we always bring our own anyway. For the price, next time we won’t spend the extra for the “newly renovated”. It was close to everything we were in NYC for so that’s the plus.

Absolutely terrible hotel. Terrible customer service they don’t care. We had no running hot water for 48 hours no solution no nothing. Room was unsafe with wires hanging out the walls and dirty bathroom. I paid a lot of money as it was Christmas and my partners birthday we asked to leave the day after checking in to be told we weren’t allowed to leave as we’d already been charged. This wasn’t told to me on check in. Just awful. The hotel has ignored my 4 emails of complaints that I’ve sent they just don’t care. I work for a holiday company and have never in my life stayed in a worse hotel. Wasn’t even safe to put an animal in let alone a human! Paid triple what they advertised on their website too but they couldn’t honour it they said as I’d booked with another company. Utterly pits. Avoid !!!!!

Excelent experience. Best location, surrounded with public transportation. It was a great price. They gave us one of the old rooms, really small for the four people that were staying. But I still recommend it for low budget trips

I would not recommend the hotel at all!! The breakfast was good but I had stains on my pillow case and the sheets were dirty. There was a lot of stains on the carpet and it was also dirty. The bathroom had old gum stuck to the wall.most of the staff was ok.

Found Hotel Pennsylvania from the internet ad having the cheapest ratebof $59 per night however once you book and finalize online it sums up to.$113 per night with a 3 pm check in and 11am checkout. I arrived from the airport around 1pm and wanted to rest so requested for an early check which they ovlige with an extra$28 charge thereby making the room.cost at $141 per night. They give me a 100 year old room on the 8th or 9th floor with a vault type.steel door they said eas.original from 1919. Oh my, the place.smells old, the bath tub paint and wall paints are peeling off and there is no wardrobe it wast just a bed and side tables. The heater knob was broken too. Be very careful in booking this hotel, it is not cheap as they are advertized online. Service is mediocre because they clean the room late like 7PM when you are already back to the hotel to rest. No second time for me on this HOTEL.i am giving it 3 star as respect for its 100 years history and early glories but currently it is not worth the pay.

what I enjoyed about this place is how they kept the original design of the building. I loved the location! Right next to the hotel are many affordable places to eat. Around the corner there was Old Navy, Manhattan Mall and Target!! We got there at 3 AM and the receptionist was very professional and attentive. The rooms are a bit small and bathroom. The rooms were clean and the TV was working.

Booked for NYE last minute so was not expecting 5 star for the price. Initial room was small but clean and comfortable. Maria B on reception was outstanding!! She was able to upgrade our room to a renovated one which was more spacious with a small fridge. She made sure to check how it was when she saw me next and always had a smile. Only downside was no hot water for showers most of our trip!! Have to shower in the morning to get hot water.. The location can not be beaten though!

the house keeping were friendly.. and even though everyone was busy with many customers, and some employees were frustrated they all provide great customer service..elevator need maintenance. need to have desk in all room.

All was great and convienent express check in. The room was clean and comfortable. However, housekeeping barged in un announced without a knock around 9am check out day which was odd and very disrespectful of our privacy.

Hotel location is very good but1. Behavior of staff is rude. Staff is not at all cooperative.2. Breakfast is very limited and not good. You will have to walk to another restaurant for this.3. Not a single water bottle provided in the room.

The room was cramp but clean. The bathroom standup shower needed a better cleaning. As for the staff, very rude and not pleasant. I asked about the upgrade for the room after we checked in and was given much information on the upgrade. The staff member said he just started 2 weeks ago and does not know anything about the upgraded rooms. My wife and I only stayed at this hotel for the location for the PBR. It is literally across the street. If you want a place to rest your head for a night after an event at Madison Square Garden, reconsider the Pennsylvania hotel. There are nicer hotels around the corner. Lesson learned.

The hotel is dirty and dilapidated and dated but the location is optimal a stone's throw from time square, atm and metro at the exit of the hotel, the breakfast is so The muffins are quite good. Highly recommended I hope you renew it

Booked trough Booking. Com for a 500 SF Suite. Got a 137SF shoe box . People behind desk barely spoke English. Basically got a Royal screwing. Hotel claimed they have nothing to do with Bookings and it was take it of leave it. Screw Bookings and the Pennsylvania Hotel.

We traveled in by train to Penn Station. Was able to walk across the street to the motel. Safe, clean, simple room. Nothing fancy but very centrally located. Walked everywhere we needed to go other than to Yankee Stadium. We took the subway there.

Great location in Manhattan especially if seeing an event at Madison Square Garden. Yes, this is a very old hotel, but serves its purpose of you understand the room you are booking. We stayed in one of the renovated upgraded rooms, I am sure we would have been dissappinted with the old rooms as the upgraded room just met some standards. The bathroom could have been updated more as well when refurbishing such as new tiles or some counterspace. Typical Manhattan hotel room which are very small compared to staying anywhere else and they are pricey everywhere for what you get. No frills room, bathroom had very little to almost no counter space and the size of the room was just a few feet wider than the king bed. We didn't spend too much time in the room and slept well, but it was pretty small navigating around and getting ready and very little drawer space. Understanding this as we have been to Manhattan before it was fine, but in the future we would prob stay somewhere else for a little newer hotel and a little bigger room.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA
user_name:
Ikoiko79
Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

review_body: Excellent location for Times Square, Subway and move. The bad thing is that old facilities and rooms.The price and location do that is a good place is you don’t care about the excellent clean and facilities

Already in May 2019 I booked the room. The reservation was canceled on December 29, 2019. Then I was at the airport and I didn't read the mail. I arrived at the hotel at 11 o'clock on December 29th. Then they told me that my reservation is not live because my credit card is not valid.This was not true. There is an ATM next to the reception. With that card, I immediately took out $ 1,600. So the credit card was good. I had to pay for the room in cash and was even happy to get a room at midnight after a 1200km flight. There was no immediate need to turn around. Finally, I completed all my planned programs.I'm Hungarian

Had a wonderful time at Hotel Pennsylvania. From front desk service, lobby and door service, room service, convience, location, everything was well done and I for one certainly enjoyed my 14 day stay.

We had the older room that was pretty bad. Bed was horrible, temp control sucked and the shower really needed better cleaning. The staff was so accommodating though that it made up for it. We were there for concerts at MSG. So you couldn’t get more convenient.

Okay, let me start off by saying that this is NOT The Plaza ! If you want that sort of hotel for $400/night, head north. Otherwise -- this is a low-medium priced hotel in a great location in Midtown. Walking distance to Times Square, 1 block from Macy's, 3 blocks to Andrew's Cafe (my favorite place to eat breakfast). The hotel has been around forever, but I found it to be exactly what I needed - Clean, comfortable, and convenient. Bed linens were super fresh, crisp, good size TV, small refrigerator. Not a lot of extras, but if you are in NYC as a tourist, how much time are you going to spend in your room anyway. Spend your money on dinner, shows, touristy stuff ! Safe hotel for single travelers, lots of diverse guests; good security. Special kudos to Ms. Sonia M. who checked me in. She was WONDERFUL; was able to get me in a room early (I had been traveling on the train for a long time and was exhausted. Explained everything to me, my FREE breakfast for two, very pleasant, personable and professional. Thanks Hotel Pennsylvania and Ms. Sonia M !!!

Room was comfortable. Large by NYC standards. Great hot water. Comfortable mattress and bedding. Pleasant staff. NYC Penn Plaza location - best place in town. I walked to Columbus Circle, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Washington Square, Lincoln Center and Greenwich Village and across the street to Madison Square Garden.

Marie B was a shining light in a messy check in situation. I was seriously considering leaving this hotel before checking in.The lobby of this once grand hotel felt like a russian train station. But Marie B was fantastic. She cheered me up and directed me to one of the newly remodeled rooms. It is fantastic. I am glad I stayed.

Maria B at check in was extremely helpful; gave recommendations on what to do in the city, where venues are located, how to get around. She made sure our room was great and up to standard. Would come again

Maria B checked us in at the desk. She was friendly, efficient, helpful and very nice. Maria B. made the check in process a breeze. Our room is newly renovated. Close to Madison Square Garden. Super pleased

The Pennsylvania Hotel is ideally located in the heart of Manhattan with access to all transports in New York (Train, Subway...) near all shopping centers (Macy's, Manhattan Mall, Fifth Avenue and Fashion avenue) with quick access to café and restaurants.

The room are clean but very small for a family (4 persons). It’s ver-te central, it’s noisy but perfect To explore All Manhattan. The breakfast!! Is outside of the hotel, it’s not bad, but the Rockets Thays the hotel tive To you are not enojes for all theday’s of your Stalingrado.

Great location! Nice updated rooms! I was surprised that the hotel staff replaced towels daily along with replenishing shampoo/ soap. So convenient to walk anywhere in Manhattan along with it’s right beside penn station and MSG

Our room was nice and clean and it was quite except for three noise on the street but that is by no means the hotels fault. There staff was nice and friendly. The only complaint I would have is the coffee shop located in the lobby. The prices changed every time I went to get the exact cup of tea. When I enquired why the employee who works the night shift went to snatch it out of my hand even though I paid for it almost burning me in the process. I asked for his name and a receipt and he threats me. However the day staff are nice. Unfortunately a business is only as good as its employees. On the bright side there is a Dunkin Donuts on the next block with friendly staff! !

Extremely bad.Never answer on calls when i was calling reception from the room.No hot water in WC.No one told us that breakfast is out of hotel and in 7 in the morning there was no breakfast .In the hotel full of people from the street who are no in the hotel and drinking and lying down in lobby area.Unsafely totally. Very bad experience.Like you are on bus station.We are moved to another hotel after 24 hours.

The check-in was very fast. The wonderful woman, Maria B found my reservation before I knew it. She is fun loving yet extremely kind and patience person with high professionalism. Best way to start a vacation in NYC.

The Perfect Place to have Your First Time in New York ...But I have been in NYC More than 30 times and I choose the Pennsylvania because is: Clean, Big, Not Expensive, the People Who works there are very Kind with the customers, everything Is So close(Madison Square, Penn Station, Macys etc) Please, give Me a Good REASON to change My mind!!! Hahahah!

My first impression of this hotel was horrible thanks to the clerk that helped me check in. She was nice at first but when I went upstairs and opened my room, I immediately closed it and went back downstairs. My reservation was for a room in the upgraded PPC - Penn Plaza Collection room. What I was given was an old room! When I went back to the counter the lady argued with me and was very rude telling me she gave me a room on the 10th floor which was part of the PPC. I politely told her that the room was not upgraded. She then went to a manager and said the manager approved my move to the 11th floor. The room was modern and updated than the one on the 10th floor. Rooms are very cold so ask for extra blankets. The towels feel stiff...so you may want to bring your own face/wash cloths. If you are taller than me (5') and weigh more than me (135lbs.) good luck sitting on the toilet. It is so close on the left to the wall and the toilet paper holder is literally touching your side. Oh, the coffee/snack shop on the first floor has the worst customer service. I think they also charge you for things based on their mood. $7 for two bottled waters and $1.50 for hot water!! Just go to Starbucks around the corner for free hot water and cheaper water bottles. The best thing about this place is the location. Very close to the subway and a nice walk to Times Square.

Stayed here with my wife and 2 year old daughter. Paid for and reserved a premium room ahead of time in their Penn Plaza Collection newer remodeled area. When we arrived, hotel told us they gave away our room in nicer area and instead put us in the older area which is definitely the type of room that you don't quite feel comfortable or clean in with significant peeling plaster walls, rusted chipped bath, and really just a room in need of a makeover. They told me to talk to manager the next day to discuss a credit. Next day comes. Wait to talk to manager. Finally able to and negotiate $120 credit for unable to fulfill room we had reserved. Says that I need to request via Delta / Expedia where I reserved and they can't issue directly but that they would make a note. Short trip ends and Expedia gets back to me and says they contacted hotel and request was rejected from Hotel after multiple attempts. Still working on credit that hotel manager promised after in person meeting.Another side note. Hotel states they have cribs available. Prior to leaving on our trip I called to arrange one. Hotel would not guarantee a crib for the room even with offering additional money to reserve. They noted that these are all given out first come first serve and will not let anyone reserve. Because of this we checked and brought our own pack and play. Overall, the lobby is nice and is in a convenient location however, the customer service has significant strides that need to be made.

The employees are very nice and hard workers! Available to help us anytime! We got a very clean room 910. The location: the best! Free Wi-Fi and breakfast! We really appreciate all the beautiful smiles we have receive from all of you! Thank you ti Lidia and Kathie! We will back for sure!

Plenty of other reviews have commented abut how grim the hotel is. To top that, this hotel has now made two fraudulent charges to our credit card following a stay in August; on in October, one in December. This is outrageous. Stay clear at all costs.

Great location. Lack of hotel bar or restaurant, but you are surrounded by 100’s of choices. Penn Station subway below the building was awesome. Few blocks from Times Square, 30 Rock. Needs new management with tons of cash to update it. It’s huge so it would take a bunch. Would pick something else next time, but it was worth the price. Must stay in newly renovated room. I could not imagine not.

Very good for families with children. In the heart of downtown Manhattan, near all trains and buses. Plenty’s places to eat and shopping is great. Stores like Macy’s, forever 21, Sophie’s, jacks. Lot of souvenirs shops as well.

First thing, the lobby is gorgeous! Location is amazing! Right across from Penn Station so if you are needing to go to the airport the LIRR is right there. Also it is next to the 34th st subway station so everything is easily accessible. Secondly, it appears that they are little by little renovating the building as some floors outside the elevators have nice furniture in them and some look completely sad as the carpet is being warped from years and years of use. We arrived on a Thursday and checked in to go to our room on the 15th floor. Once we Exited the elevator at the 15th floor it looked pretty sad and I did not have a good feeling about our short two night stay here. We opened the door to our room and it was just like I thought, a sad and forgotten tiny little space that did not smell nice at all. Dingy bathroom and what appeared to be holes in the bottom of the wall was all it took for me to tell my wife to hold on while I go speak to someone about upgrading. All this to say: MARIA IS AMAZING!!!! I went downstairs and asked Maria if there was any way I could upgrade and she let me know that they were all booked and to try in the morning again. As I walked back to my room I was not looking forward at all to staying in that room with my wife but when I got back, the phone rang and it was Maria! She didn’t forget about me! She asked me to come back down because she was going to try and keep checking for anything else. She moved us to a different room on the same floor but this one was much better! Bigger bed, view of the Empire State Building and no holes in the wall! Maria, you made our trip so much better and we are so grateful for you! Well done!

Good location if you enjoy walking which we did. Spent week before Christmas with Daughter an Granddaughter...we had a blast!! Did self check-in so did not have much interaction with staff but all were friendly!

Spent a pleasant 3 nights at the historic Hotel Penn, in one of the classic rooms. It could have used a night table and lamp on the right side of the bed - there was plenty of space - and a wastebasket at the desk (there was only a recycling bin). But other than that, it was fine, and in a terrific location at a good price for NYC.

Great location for seeing all in NYC and very close to Penn Station. This is an older hotel but provides the basic needs. No frills but clean and spacious rooms. Unfortunately many of the staff were rude and unhelpful.

Nice location , very convenience to take any place around there. I spent great time Christmas with my friends and we always took metro train to many places. Exactly it’s very easy to take the trains , make us save time and save value.Next time we’ll be there again.

We had mice in our room which we caught on camera. As we told the management, all they could say was sorry. No refund for that night, nothing. This hotel should be put to sleep. It was the worst place I have EVER stayed. Do not book this hotel. It is old, fallen apart, smells, small. It's just not good at all.

This place is appalling! I do not understand how they are even open. Warn down, dirty, smelly and tired. Everything is either chipping, duck taped or peeling off the wall. Upon arrival I am told the two king beds I reserved and prepaid for weren’t available and the rooms we now had both had two twin beds. The agent said he’d make a note to have me moved tomorrow. This wouldn’t have been an issue if both rooms weren’t literally falling apart. Walk into the rooms, one room doesn’t even have all the linen on the beds, both bathtubs have giant pieces of paint chipping off them. How is this safe?!?! One rooms TV didn’t work. Instantly called to tell the manager we were checking out and I wanted a full refund. Checked out and never looked back. The only positive thing I have to say is the staff. Yes, they seem tired, miserable and warn out but that’s because they work in a sh*t hole and are yelled at by people constantly. I appreciated the agent and manager who assisted me with their kindness and understanding. They didn’t give me any push back just apologized and helped me ASAP. Word to the wise, READ REVIEWS!!!

As this was my first trip to New York, I wanted a place that was located close to everything and didn't cost me an arm and a leg.Hotel Pennsylvania definitely ticked these boxes. It might not be the grandest Hotel in NYC, but the service was excellent and the stay was very pleasant. Thank you all the staff that assisted me, you made my experience in New York even more pleasant.

Id rate this place a negative 5. Tiny rooms are the norm for NYC, but not chipping paint, dirty floors and over-used linens. Hallway carpets are stained and buckling-a tripping point, room doors are filthy. Not worth the “bargain” at +$300 a night.

We felt like we got a really good deal due to the fact that it was downtown NY for NYE. We knew the rooms would be dated, but when we arrived my pillow had blood on it, a string of hair was on the other pillow and a clump of black hair was lying in the corner. We complained and were changed to a different room even though Housekeeping told us it was completely booked. Two ladies in front of us in line had the same issue and got a full refund back and left. When we got to the more “updated room,” we found cracks in the walls, ceiling and our room had one towel for two people. Called front desk and took them over an hour to deliver the towels.The place is completely in shambles. We knew it would be outdated in parts but, it’s disgraceful. Everyone complained about it. The carpets are stained in the halls and it looks like something out of The Shining or American Horror story. Just save yourself the hassle and pay a little extra for a clean and nice place. I feel like I could say more but I think this would be enough.

Could not be better located as it’s literally across the street from Penn Station and subways. Huge room. Clean. Needs maintenance. Rug torn and taped. Loose carpets in all hallways. Tub drain has broken enamel and no trim. I guess they guard the toilet paper as you have to run out before getting more. BUT location over rules all negatives.

Nice hotel and the staff was so friendly especially Raymond Gonzalez who was so kind and nice and he helped us in our booking, he was a wonderful person to meet there. I strongly recommend this hotel.

1st Class Hospitality, Excellent Location, & Luxurious Accommodations!!!Steven Fennell, Sonia, Andrew, and Sergey all Took Wonderful Care of Our Stay and Made Us Feel at Home!Couldn't Recommend This Hotel More For Your Next Visit To NYC! :)

100% good service,prices Incredible experience and the price View is beautiful Nothing compared to New York City Staff was friendly and professional Next time I come to NYC I will beHere again XxxxxxxxYyyyyy

As prices were sky high during my stay in NY, I was booked into that hotel - luckily into one of the refurbished rooms. But I must say it was easily still one of may worst stays in a hotel ever. The good things first: the location is great! Now for the bad: super long line during check in, unmotivated employees, all feels very old, dated and dirty. My room had a bit of new colour and furniture, however the heating system is still anicent which means temperature couldn't really be controlled in the room. I would say some youth hostels have nicer rooms and better service. I wish they would do more to upgrade this hotel, especially the service as the location is amazing.

I m not recommending this hotel because we found it to be outdated, very dirty and not a good value for the money. The bathroom needed two gallon of bleach, the beds were so old that we felt like we spent the night on concrete blocks. It is however in great location, close to everything.The rate you see will almost double with State tax and car parking feed that are outrageous here in NY.

I booked this hotel in November 2019 for a family vacation in February 2020. Their site advised that you pay at the hotel with free cancellation. The hotel charged my credit card almost immediately so I decided to cancel the reservation and ask for a refund. They tried every trick in the book to refuse to process my refund. I was asked several times to send screen shots of my bank account showing the payment made to them. I did this several times, was told several time to allow 10 to 15 days for processing the refund and was finally told that they do not believe any money was taken from my account.I was furious.....Thankfully, the booking was made via Booking.com who took up my case. Finally, an entire month later, Booking.com refunded the money to me and will invoice Hotel Pennsylvania for the full amount.Most reviews for this hotel are horrible and I regret making a reservation with them.Please stay away. There are other much better hotels in the same area. You have a 0% chance of getting a refund from this establishment for whatever reason and they try to frustrate you into giving up. Don't give up - they will pay up in the end as they know they are wrong.Never again.

Clean room, good service, kind personnel especially Betty. Comfortable bed and pillows. Close to all services needed. But I am missing a beautiful off white sweater with lilac flower design and hope to get it back

Nice and clean. Close to all touristic places ( just walking to the time square, battery park, Brooklyn bridge....). Not expensive and reasonable price . The bulding is old but our room was very nice and quiet.

We really enjoyed this historic hotel. The location is convenient right in the middle of downtown and uptown. It is directly across from Penn Station and Madison square garden. Easy check in and out ( hint: use the kiosk!!). Staff very friendly. Close to shops, food, subway. Highly recommend

The Hotel Penn is massive (2.5 million SF) and old. There was a constant line at the front desk, day and night, with travelers checking in. Everyone we met that works there came across as indifferent and would rather be somewhere else. There was supposedly a pool, but I never saw where it was and we didn't bother since it stated on the website nobody under 18 allowed in (really??). No restaurant either.A portion of the rooms have been renovated (which I can't speak for) and a portion are VERY old and decrepit. We stayed in an older suite, but I'm not complaining. Why? There were 5 of us in our party (my wife and I and our 3 teen children). For $330 a night, I was able to get a 3 bedroom / 3 bathroom suite which was HUGE. There was a newer TV in each bedroom and also in the sitting area. There was also a big (old) dining room table. This total space must have easily been 1,200 SF. In midtown Manhattan. Across the street from Madison Square Garden. For $330/night.The ceilings were 12' with great views (old drafty windows). The beds were newer and comfortable. Everything else was old, worn and desperate need of replacing. The first night, I called downstairs needing a few more blankets and pillows (I called at 11:30). When it got to 12:00 and nobody showed up yet, I called again and immediately received a dose of NYC attitude that the guy was 'busy'. He actually knocked on our door at 2:00 AM with the pillows and blankets. The handrail in our tub was half pulled out of the wall, the cold water handle in the shower was broken, so you had to be fast with your shower and we had mismatched (and loose) interior door knobs, chipped paint, damaged baseboards and trims. The hotel clearly could care less about routine maintenance of these older rooms. In so many ways, you would call this room a dump (maybe no longer up do NYC building code??), BUT, it was 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms for $330 a night in Manhattan. Would we stay there again? Yes. We could even travel with another family and stay in a single room. BUT, we would only return with others that have a similar mindset on a NYC room. We spend most of our time out in the city and only come back to sleep and shower. There can't be another hotel still like this in midtown. Being able to walk from Penn Station was a huge plus, for we came into the city on Amtrak. The location was perfect.If you know what you are getting yourself into, you should be fine. The ironic thing is, I don't think I'd want to stay in one of the newer rooms if they are postage-stamp small based on the rest of the hotel and the demeanor of the staff. The service in the hotel was so-so at best and I'd only want to come back if it meant getting one of these monster suites for a steal.

It might look ok in the photos and it might be a great location, but don’t let that fool you! Hotel Pennsylvania is a very poor standard, noisey, shabby and old. There are no services within the hotel, no restaurants or gyms ... while they are close by, nothing in the hotel. So if you are looking for a very average place just to sleep, it’s ok, but bring your ear plugs. Be prepared to line up and wait for any service staff at reception. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone nor would I stay here again.

So... there are lots of reviews on here about the rooms and yes we had a classic which was bloody awful. Shower hanging off the wall and a window that didn’t shut properly. “The wind cuts right through you, it’s no place for the old” sung over and over again throughout our first night, god it was cold. Then we met the lovely Maria B (I’m lead to believe there is a Maria A!!) , she sorted us out straight away and we opted for the upgraded room. Not only that she saw my daughter was a bit under the weather and sped the cleaning up so we could get in and sort her out. She was fantastic and a credit to hotel. Pen hotel could do with a face lift but not the staff, they are only working with what they have. Hotel 20 min walk to Time Square and 30 seconds to the number 1 subway which takes you down to ground zero etc. My advice would be to upgrade. We went from a fridge with no way of cleaning to a corner room with a view of the Empire State Building. Worth the money.

Thank you so much for making our first time in the city amazing. My little girl stated that the hotel was a perfect way to experience the city. Thank you for making it memorable. Thank you to the manager Sean for making our accommodations pleasant. Merry Christmas! Sincerely, Alliesha S.Connecticut

This hotel is perfect for the tourist who’s gonna walk around all day. Close to the best subway lines, right in front of Pen Station and with great shops around the corner (Macy’s) But... be aware that the Staff is not friendly at all.
