Room Service is super weak, to the point where they would do one bed and not the other, or forget to leave towels for everybody. Another touch point is that bedding and towels are quite old - had to deal with some holes and hard textures. The big thing about it is “Breakfast” - the hotel has a partnership with a cafe at 32nd - They will give a cup of fruit, one option of bread and one option of drink - We are not breakfast people, so for us, it was enough.

I had a good experience in this hotel. I was satisfied with the room and service. The hotel is in a great location. I walked everywhere - Theater District, Times Square, Famous New York Sites. I will stay in this hotel again.

It’s a nice hotel if you’re searching a good & centric place for staying. Only a 10 minutes walking to Times Square. Penn Station connects with differents Metro lines, In front of the hotel is the Madison Square Garden.

Large Hotel opposite Penn Station but very convenient for travel by rail and the subway. Large well appointed room. Large queues to check in. Breakfast at restaurant outside hotel. Good job it was dry. Facilities inside Hotel OK e.g. shop, coffee / food.

Great location and nice hospitality. Enjoyed the stay at hotel Pennsylvania and its close to station and subway really good location. I hope it was a better breakfast at same location instead of the cafe.

Considering the rooms in hotels in NYC are mostly over 100 years old, it was excellent. It was clean, and the staff was excellent. They were helpful and always had a smile and happy to help!!! The Hotel is in an excellent location too. We will stay there our next visit!!

What a pit! This hotel is an E-M-B-A-R-R-A-S-E-M-E-N-T for NYC. Extremely outdated, dirty, moldy, and run down.FYI, if you'll want (and you WILL want) to "upgrade" to one of the updated rooms, prepare to pay additional $60-100 per night.Absolutely disguisting! I will tell everyone I know to avoid this place like a plaque. It should be CLOSED

We got the cheapest room 3double bed. The room is big but the A/C is not working only heat. We ended up opening window for the whole stay. The bathroom i sooo small and lots of hair on the floor and stains on the sink. Bed is not that comfortable. We get what we paid for. This is just an FYI for other travelers looking for cheap room in Hotel Penn.!!!!

Awesome!! I love it and my family too. Excellent service. The room was clean and so beautiful. We have an amazing time in family. Is the second time I stay in Hotel Penn and I truly say that for me Is the best place to stay when you’re in New York.

Large hotel that has undergone renovations. The room we had on the 9th floor was spacious and clean although finishes in the bathroom still look as though more work needed especially on the bath tub. Family had same room opposite us and theirs was quite smaller

The hotel is really well localized. But is just that. 1st of all, when we started the check in, the lady the was doing it for us said that they did not have king size bedroom, although I made the reservation 20 days before the trip and I’ve chose the king size bedroom and also payed for l the 1st day in it since a week before. It was very disappointing and we were so exhausted from the trip... then she said “let me check with my boss if we have a king size bed” and after a couple minutes waiting, she said “ok, we have it”. It sounded like our reservation was not important and we were being treated like some “walk in” that just tried a hotel night. But no, I made a reservation in a good advance time. They showed how disorganized they are since this time. After that we went to the bedroom, which is ok. The bedroom sheets were ok but not smelling softer. Also, the bed seemed more queen size than king size. Then we left the room to buy some stuff and the when we got back, the key card did not work and we got locked outside of the room. We went back to the reception and we got new key card, which, again, did not work. At this point, we were so exhausted and we called security. The security guy helped us and then, just after all this issues, we got inside the room. Caution with the free breakfast and park: the breakfast is served in other restaurant, outside the hotel and they let you eat just one pastry (bread, English muffin, croissant) and one beverage. If you want to upgrade it, you have to pay 10 extra dollars and the price of the breakfast without the voucher that the hotel gives you, is 11 dollars. In this case, it’s completely unnecessary the voucher, because the breakfast included in the room rate it’s too poor!! Also, the hotel does not have a park. They send you to park in other parking and you have a discount (20 dollars less if park by yourself) from the regular price. Note: the park is not far away from the hotel, but it’s not too close and also, it’s uncomfortable carry luggage in the middle of NYC streets to get there. Be sure you can do it (do not take to much weigh) and you’ll be fine. Overall, it’s just ok (nothing especial or really good) Do not expect much because it’s a cheap hotel.

My husband and I have just checked out of this hotel after a one night stay on our way to a cruise sailing out of Brooklyn . The hotel location is great . However , I think that the photos on the website are misleading . I think that this must have been for an upgraded room . Our room was on the 15th floor and I don’t think I have ever stayed in such a run down room . It was clean , that is the only positive thing I can say . Paint peeling on walls and ceiling . Hot water but awful bath tub. Very small room . I would never book here again but location is good and if booking , make sure it is an upgraded room. We weren’t aware of this . Chaotic reception but this k this is the same for all city hotels at this time of year . Lady called Betty at reception was very polite and helpful at bookout . Just be aware of bad dated rooms , felt that I was an offender just released from prison and room was like a half way house for offenders .

Great accommodations worth the money easy and convenient to everywhere wife and I enjoyed the room,lobby,Restaurants in the area train station extremely close for Quick travel Bibby O. The doorman was outstanding

The very best spot, near most of attractions. Breakfast is not served in the hotel But in a restaurant nearby: lousy breakfast, dirty place. Had to call security for cigarretes smell, They told me could not do anything unless i knew who was smoking.

We arrived yesterday afternoon I emailed the hotel many times and they never responded to my calls or emails. We were then given a room which was old out dated dirty really disgusting myself and my partner are 5’9/-6ft in height. We could not even shower. The shower was too small I could not even wash my hair. We went down to reception to speak with a manager who then proceeded to go on like it was our fault we were tall and could not shower. He said he was not aware of our height and we did not state it when checking in. I didn’t know we needed to state our height to book a room in a hotel. We had to wait 2 hours for our room to be changed. While missing out on some of the activities we have planned. Management have no idea how to deal with customers and the problems of this hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anymore. Extremely rude management.

Could not fault the location. Directly opposite Penn Station; landed at JFK, air train, LIRR , we were in the hotel within the hour. If you want a hotel just to put your head down for the night, lovely hot over the bath shower, clean towels and bedding, this is the hotel to stay.We chose the Penn Plaza Collection room, as these had been recently refurbished but the room was still very basic. We included breakfast, which was in another building a short distance from the hotel. Ok, as it is a snack for people on the run, which was fine for us as we were on a short break and needed all the time.Majority of the staff were very friendly, especially the lady on the information desk, helping to arrange tickets and giving us directions. In conclusion a very basic hotel, in a good location.

I was very happy with our stay in one of the updated rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful, The room was clean, water pressure was great, temps of room and water were just fine. Bed was not the most comfortable, but I am a picky sleeper. The location is perfect, right in the heart of the city, close to subway. Would stay again.

Hotel was ok. It was clean and we only wanted it to sleep in. Was all we expected. Continental breakfast was. Nice touch. Located right across the street from Penn Station and walking distance to many great sights and great food.

Hotel is just opposite Madison Square Garden and the train station. Room had standard amenities and was comfortable. It’s in the heart of the city less than 10mins walking distance from Empire State Building and fifth avenue. Manhattan mall is on same block as the hotel.

Choose the Penn Plaza Collection room.I have stayed here multiple times and the Classic room is extremely dated and will negatively impact your stay whilst the newly renovated rooms are a breath of fresh air. Yes it’s loud and you’ll hear sirens all night...but the hotel is in a great location (opposite Madison Square Garden in Midtown), so you have to expect that anywhere in Midtown is going to be loud. It’s the value for money that makes this place worthwhile. Being opposite Penn station makes everywhere readily accessible, so if you intend to be out and about most of the day (and or night) and then return to a decent room and comfy king size bed...then you just can’t beat this place for value.

Overpriced rooms. Definitely false advertising of what rooms look like. Hotel told us they had oversized parking and that was a false statement, which cost $65 a night. The hotel room cost was 300 dollars 3 weeks out and now it is 85 dollars one day in advance. I would never recommend this hotel to my enemy.

Hotel has a great location but outdated rooms. Bathrooms had rust and bath tub was very old. Beds were not the most comfortable. Other than the rooms being old however, the stay was enjoyable due to the location being central and very close to the subways.

Loved the whole experience, was able to get an early check in , room was nice and bed was comfortable, great location near the subway , would love to return again and enjoy the sites , only thing wish there was a do not disturb sign cleaning lady woke us up several times

The lobby is elegant and the staff is courteous and professional. The room was adequate. Not much of a view but I waited until the last minute to book. The room heater could not be adjusted. It took a long time for the hot water to get up to temperature. Free breakfast was a coffee and bagel but we upgraded to the buffet for a nominal price. Location is the best thing going for it. We walked everywhere we wanted to go in the vicinity. Rockefeller Center, Times Square. MSG across the street.

was worried after reading reviews ,and they did the same to us we had paid an extra £100 for a better room back in march for our trip in december , after a long day traveling we was put in the worst room i have ever stayed in was upset because i had organised this trip for three friends and myself we were so tired we stayed in that room for one night and at 5 in the morning i went to reception to complain . the man said come back in the afternoon and we will give you a better room so we had to cut our sight seeing day short to come back to the hotel for a better room why o why was we not given this in the first place . dont get me wrong the second room was not brilliant but after the first room we acepted it we were only on a short trip didnt want to waste time keep complaining . the hotel is in a brilliant location so sad it has got so run down . the breakfast tickets we used once wasnt our thing .i notice some people got vouchers for a free drink we didnt get any . the coffee place near reception open 24 hours was brill

I enjoyed my stay. The room was very clean, and had a nice view to the Empire State building. All was christmas decorated and lool really nice.They gave me two free drink tickets for the bar next door, which was great.

The hotel is in a perfect spot in front of Madison Square Garden. Subway stations right outside the hotel so it is easy to get anywhere. The only thing is that we'r went with the lowest priced room and the rooms are old with terrible beds. We ended up upgrading to a new room and it was much better. The only thing is that it took half my trip to get one of those rooms. So if you go here go ahead and get an upgraded room.

We stayed for 4 nights and had a nice time. Location location location!! The shower was not the best. No hot water in the shower all the time. The room was very spacious. Old building and bit noisy but overal good enough. We had the renovated rooms. The breakfast is outside at a deli, the staff is not friendly at all.

I have stayed here multiple times. This last visit has been my best yet. They are working to upgrading the hotel and sound a good job. It’s taking time but was happy to receive an updated room on my last coat. The location is great

good location, courteous and friendly staff, nice lobby, dingy hallways, roomy but dated room. Only real downside to stay: Could not get hot water for shower once each day of our stay of the two showers we took each day of a two night stay at approximately the same time of day, although order of cold-hot showers differed each day

My group and I stayed at this hotel when we visited to attend the New York Makeup Show. Great location, fast check-in and checkout, room was excellent, perfect size and very clean. Ms. Maria Augustine assisted us with everything, she was very pleasant and helpful!!! Overall my stay was a great experience and I will definitely stay at this hotel again!!

The location of this 100 year old hotel hotel is one of the best in Midtown Manhattan. One is close to everything: The Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and endless great restaurants and delis. The price was reasonable. Very drafty room, made it a bit chillier than we had wanted, but we had each other to keep ourselves warm. Try the Feile Restaurant right across 33rd St. good food reasonable prices.

location of hotel was amazing, only 10ish blocks from times square or one subway ride on 1,2,or3 line. room was decent, i didnt stay in one of the newly renovated rooms. the concierge with the blue eyeliner was SO friendly, i loved her. only complaints: room was hot even with heater/AC turned off, TV didn’t work in my room (524), & the shower is meant for someone below 5 feet tall. otherwise it was an amazing stay

They show one room online and when you get there wow. The faucet was running continuously I had to purchase bleach to pour down shower drain there was some small things flying around. Hotel across from Madison Square Garden should be on point.

The service was excellent!!! Even though we arrived hours earlier than we anticipated, Maria A was a great help in getting us checked in early. Room was spacious and well kept (probably as it was in the newly refurbished wing :D We did have a few minor issues, well I would call them minor because they were dealt with immediately in a most professional manner. Thanks again Maria A for all your patience, understanding and assistance, and we will definitely see you soonThe location was perfect!!! just within reach of the make up show, times square, empire state building, broadway, eateries, madison square garden ... OMG we loved it

BREAKFAST - if you have breakfast included be aware you have to leave the hotel and attend a nearby cafe where the breakfast is provided. There’s no restaurant or kitchen for breakfast and we made the mistake of just popping downstairs in shorts for breakfast to be told it’s up the street in the snowy freezing cold December month.I stayed in the king PB room, apparently upgraded and newly refurbished. Really good size, good en suite room and clean and tidy. There is however no mirrors in the room anywhere apart from the one in the bathroom, there was also no coat hangers or anything like that in the room. Early check was available for no extra charge, luggage was stored for a price below the lobby. All in all it’s an easy stay at this hotel. Nice and quiet, clean friendly staff. Room decor let’s it down and the no on site breakfast facility also. You could spend a little more for a more efficient stay.

I stayed at Hotel Penn in May 2019 while attending the New York Makeup Show.the hotel was ideally located to my destination and amenities nearby that made my stay a great one. Maria Augustine service was A class , she our team the best deals and made sure we were well taken care off for the duration of our stay at Hotel Penn. Many thanks to her for making my trip and stay at hotel Penn a memorable and enjoyable one.

It was a nice stay and nice location, I just worry I won’t get my random $100 they took out back because when I asked the guy at the front desk, he didn’t really explain anything to me, just said it was back on and it’s not lol

Thank you Maria B for the warm welcome and your fun personality! “How You Doin” LOL!!! Our room was beautiful and clean! We look forward to our yearly visit at the Hotel Pennsylvania! Thank you Joey Stark and Darcie!!

I had a fun stay at the Hotel Pennsylvania, where Glenn Miller use to play. When we checked in, an older gentleman working the front desk said that the Café Rouge in the Hotel Pennsylvania has been reopened as a private event space called Station32. architectural details were saved, just all painted over in white. Before checking out, we also got a peek at the 18th Floor Ballroom, and saw the framed set of sheet music for Pennsylvania 6-5000The hotel is great for those who love NYC history and entertainment nostalgia. Rooms are basic and efficient, nothing fancy. The room during our most recent stay had a splendid view of the Empire State Building.There are many bad reviews out there for the Hotel Pennsylvania, if you want something fancy and top drawer, this is not the place for you. It’s the perfect place for those on a budget, the history is rich but accommodations are basic and simple.When checking out, don’t forget to take advantage of the bag check service. You Can obatain $5 back check tickets at the front desk, then check your bags down stairs. It’s a nice place to store bags while waiting for your train, plane, or bus.

Hello friends. I've been staying at The Pennsylvania Hotel for more than three years in a row. I visit New York City, to received a medical treatment, at the Comprehensive Epilepsy Center of the NYU Langone hospital. My experience, with you all, have been a really good one. I feel safe and I'll always be thankful for the wonderful job you all do. There's a lady named Sherry (or Shirley) at the reception counter, who always reflect respect and understanding with everyone. She's great!Continue with the renovations. They look wonderful. Once again, thanks for anything.

This hotel is beautiful, very clean and the staff were all so nice!. Close to everything I was worried about some bad reviews about rats and it being unclean. That could not be further from the truth. Enjoyed our stay and will stay again. Thank you Hotelpenn

We recently stayed here for two and were very sorry we did. Where do I begin?First, I booked a newly remodeled room, but was given a room that was not. When I spoke to the woman at the desk she told never I did not. My reservation confirmed that I did infact. She was not very pleasant and I just decided to deal with the mix up later and enjoy my trip. Upon getting home I contacted the hotel and no one ever reached out to me and it has been two weeks. Other complaints- a 45 minute wait to check in when I was second in line is unacceptable. Seriously one person working the night of the tree lighting?The first night we only had one wash cloth for the two of us. The second night we didn't even get one! The tiles on the shower wall were falling apart. Although we had a king bed we only had two flat pillows. Christmas time in NYC and we didn't see one happy friendly face here. Next time we will stay where our friends stayed. Even their hotel treated us with a smile.

Located on the corner of 7th and 33rd, everything was easy to accesd via subway. Rooms were nice and roomy. Beautiful lobby. Lots of attendants. Carpets need cleaning. Every worker was pleasant and helpful. I would definately stay there again.

The hotel is old and shows it. This is more of a utilitarian stay than a luxury getaway. If you need to be near MSG or Penn Station, this will do just fine. The hotel is clean and comfortable. There's no restaruant/bar that I ever noticed but there are so many in the area that you don't miss it. Everyone who works here, from what I saw, could use an attitude upgrade. I don't think they even try to be friendly or efficient and they certainly don't try to be fast. They have 1700 rooms but only 4 people checking people in. If you need to leave your bags they charge you $5 a bag. If you valet a car expect to wait 45 minutes for them to bring it to you when you check out. You will definitely hear street noise from pretty much any room and you may also hear other guests but it's not too bad.

My group of makeup artistes stayed at Hotel Penn in May 2019. For a group of approximately 15 persons we were all treated with the utmost care and concern by all hotel staff. For many of us it was our first visit to NY. Ms. Maria Augustine of the management team at the hotel made all efforts to ensure we were comfortable and well guided to maximise our time in New York City.She "adopted"the girls for the duration of our stay and catered to our every need, from extra blankets any request we had. I would highly recommend a stay at Hotel Penn for value for your travelling dollar, excellent service and a guaranteed enjoyable stay.

I went for The Makeup Show in New York and I loved the location. It is a very central location. I was able to make it to the show and back with no problem and go shopping at great locations that had all that I was looking for. The service was great, I had no issues at all. If you would like the experience Manhattan, definitely stay here. Not much disturbance from outside, the rooms were clean and definitely a great location.

The location is ideal. We were in the newly refurb rooms and they were spacious, clean and comfortable. I wouldn’t say that the bathroom was refurbished but as a whole the room served its purpose. The express check in was great as there was a large queue and we were able pop down after when quieter for WiFi password & breakfast tokens! Breakfast wasn’t great, there was a choice of food but like a school cafeteria experience (porridge was more water than oats!!). Definitely not worth it! You also have to pay $5 per luggage item if you want them to store for a few hours which is excessive! Overall I would stay again....

I was given the sleaziest room I’ve ever seen upon arrival. The carpet looked like it had been salvaged from nearby penn station. Second floor with a direct view of MSG but with all of the noise and construction to go with it. Might as well have slept with the homeless in Times Square. Fortunately I was given a somewhat decent room after complaining. Why not right away? If you have to stay here don’t accept the first room they give you. I met several others in the lobby that were also shocked about the quality of the rooms.

Room had mold, peeled paint and absolute filth, we couldnt even stay the night. we left and they rented the room to someone else. NOW they WONT REFUND US. i have pics of the filth. DONT STAY HERE EVER.

The location of this hotel is hard to beat, close to some great attractions as well as right next to a well connected subway and overland station.The room I had was fine, cleaned impeccably daily and had some nice touches like the lights with USB chargers hidden in them.Breakfasts were at a separate location down the road, but that didn't bother me as it could be a stop off on the way out.The only downside was check in and out was a queue or automated and I found the automated machines quite user un-friendly

We enjoyed our two-night stay at Hotel Pennsylvania. We were lucky to be given a corner room which was quite large (especially for NYC rooms) and had windows on two walls of the room. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and the outside noise was not too loud to interfere with sleep. We did book an updated/renovated room so I can't speak for the non-renovated rooms. The hotel is directly across the street from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station which was extremely convenient. Additionally, we received breakfast vouchers for a free bagel or pastry, mixed fruit and a drink (coffee or juice). Our only minor complaints would be that the bathroom could use better renovations, the elevators were quite slow during check-out times and the line to check-out was long. However, we overall really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Our stay here was great, This was the best priced Hotel for the location it is in. Times Square was about a 10 minute walk, Rockefeller Center was about a 15 minute walk. We will definitely stay here again!!

Pros- Great location- Room was clean- Breakfast couponsCons- Rooms could use some furnishings, maybe a small coffee machine instead of having to go out in the morningWe thought this hotel was reasonably price considering the location. We read quite a few reviews before we booked.We did ask for a renovated room. Although the hotel is showing it's age, it's still a good place to stay. It's very busy so if you don't like crowds, wait times (even with 12 elevators) and typcial NYC business, this is not the place to stay.Although, I doubt they are associated with the hotel, the coffee shop is all CASH. Sort of strange that a coffee shop is all CASH these days. Which is located in a hotel that accepts Credit Cards. Just a little off in today environment.

All of the terrible reviews I've read about the Pennsylvania Hotel did not do justice to our recent stay. We arrived during a busy Christmas-season Saturday and we queued up to check in, like at an airline counter. But the line moved fast. Our room was not ready--it was 3pm and checkin is at 4--but I was not feeling well and the amazing desk clerk got me water and a cold cloth, then talked to her manager and got us into our suite with little delay. The desk clerk's kindness and sensitivity set the tone for our visit. Finding our room was a bit crazy--rooms with the letter A are in the annex wing, just keep walking past the rooms without an A and we finally found ours. We had a 2 room suite. The rooms were both very very large. The living room had a sofa bed, a chair, and a TV--no other furniture, no table to sit at, no side table...just kind of barren. The bedroom was nicely equipped, the bed comfy, the sheets sweet-feeling, and the bathroom was comfortable, with subway tiles setting a nice tone. The room was very very clean (as was the hallway as we approached our room). The heat control was not ideal--off or on, the temperature regulator didn't really change the setting--but the room warmed up to a nice temp. Our windows overlooked 7th St/Madison Square Garden, lovely to people watch from our 10th floor window seat (a bit noisy at night with city sounds, though!). Breakfast the next morning (included) was a continental style across the street at a local cafe. The large fruit cup was delicious, the pastries tasty, and the coffee wasn't terrible. Good deal! All in all, we had a great stay and it's clear that the hotel is working hard to overcome its poor ratings over the years. We can recommend this hotel if you're in a renovated room.
user_name:
rmwhitt
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel has lots of old character charm. Location is fantastic! Close walk to Times Square, Macy’s, Rockefeller, theatre, etc. Few minor things in newly renovated rooms, but large and plenty of room. Only complaint is staff at front desk NOT FRIENDLY at all!!

The actual hotel was of good quality, however the service was not. Welcoming staff outside the hotel was rude and not helpful with valet before of after staying at the hotel. Check in staff was just as rude and unhelpful with any questions I had. Fortunately the cleaning staff was great. Also, new 2019 collection rooms were not as great as the pictures showed, but they were still nice. View was less than satisfactory. Location in respect to Time Square and subway stops was very convenient. Irish bar across the street was great!

Good Location, clean room. Our room was better than expected considering some of the reviews I read. The house keeping staff was very friendly and took very good care of us. Missed a bar and a restaurant

The room was clean , furnishings were new and pleasant, water pressure outstanding ,circulation of air poor. I could not get the room cool enough in December and to put the unt on fan only still had puffs of warm air .

The location was great and the rooms were clean. The house keeping staff was very friendly and took very good care of us. The lobby was very nice, but the floor and room we stayed in was outdated and could use a remodel especially in comparison to the lobby. We would recommend this hotel overall as it was decently priced for the location.

Small rooms and AC unit was loud. Good enough to stay and roam the city. The sheets had stains and there was toothpaste from the previous traveler when we checked in. Express check in and check out was a nice feature!

Our room was better than expected considering some of the reviews I read. The location is perfect for accessing everything Manhattan has to offer.We drove in so it was great that there’s ICON parking so close to the hotel.We’ll definitely stay here again.Thank you!

Our family stayed here for 2 nights in November 2019. This is an older hotel The hotel is centrally located in mid town Manhattan and is right across the street from Penn Station. We ended up taking a NJ transit train in from Hamilton, NJ to NYC Penn Station. The hotel is also right across the street from Madison Square Garden. We were in town to see Pentatonix in concert in the Hula Theater within Madison Square Garden.The hotel is close to many area restaurants and there is lots of shopping. The Macy's flagship store is just 2 short blocks away from the hotel. There is also a nearby Target and Old Navy. Times Square is about a 9 block walk or you can take a taxi or subway. Rockefeller Center is about 8 or 9 blocks away and the Empire States Building is within 2-3 blocks of the hotel. The hotel is close to subway stations as well. Subway fares are $ 2.75 each way as of 11/19 and we had a metro card for the subway that we preloaded with funds.The hotel offers a few different room types including rooms with 2 twin beds, 2 double beds and they even offer a 3 bedroom suite as well. Hotel has free high speed wi-fi. We had no issues connecting to the wi-fi. There are 1,700 guest rooms at the hotel. There is the City Perks café that is open 24 hours in the lobby area. The hotel is pet friendly as well. The hotel also has a fitness center for guests even though we did not use it. The hotel also offers banquet facilities for events, etc.We had two suites with two twin beds in each. Both rooms had views of this huge electronic billboard right across the street. We had to shut the curtains at night as the bright light would shine through and keep us awake. Our rooms were small but comfortable. The rooms were also clean. There is a desk int he room and flat screen television as well. The closet has an iron, ironing board and luggage rack. The beds were comfortable for the most part but very noisy with the sounds of the springs. I feel the mattresses should be replaced with better ones.The service was ok. There were long lines to check in and out.The bathroom was nice and the shower stall had a curtain to pull shut. Shower pressure was good.Hotel offerered free breakfast voucher for one day to Cafe R which was located on 32nd Street between 6th and 7th avenue. The voucher entitled guests to 1 pastry(bagel, muffin, croissant or danish), choice of 1 beverage (coffee, orange juice an water) and fresh fruit.Breakfast hours are 6:30am to 10:30am. We elected not to use the free voucher and we went to the nearby McDonald's for one breakfast. There was also a nearby Starbuck's (next to the hotel) where we went for our 2nd breakfast while in NYC.Room prices were 200 + per night with AAA rate.Overall, the hotel was nice and convenient to many different things in NYC and we would visit again.

Really bad, rustic, smelly, bugs infested and downtrodden rooms, need serious upliftment or else there is no point coming back to this hotel. Some of the staff was rude but some friendly too - one lady staff told us to book renovated rooms next time but alas. The only saving grace is the hotel location, which is stone throw away from all hustle & bustle, metro lines, Penn station, Path station, port authority and LIRR.

Upon arrival my daughter and I were impressed with the lobby area being elegant and beautifully decorated in Christmas decorations ! Check in was a breeze and took only a few minutes. Staff is friendly. You need to show your hotel key to security when taking elevator to your room. Upon entering 14th floor there is a nice lobby area with a huge tv, couches, chairs and table in which you can relax. My room was renovated, clean, and comfortable. Room had one king size bed which sleeps two perfectly ! The room had no closet door and the only other problem was the tub water had a yellowish color which was not good. Had to run the water for hours before it turned clear. Not sure but maybe rusty pipes caused the discoloration. We were out all day the following day and upon arrival back to our room to rest up (around 4:00 pm ) the room was not made up so I had to get a hold of housekeeping to make the beds and clean room. Dorthia was quick to respond and was ready to jump in and make sure our room was up to par ! The hotel is located in a awesome location ! Right across the street from Penn Station and steps away from Macy’s and Times Square ! There is Manhattan Mall around the corner from hotel which has 4 floors but only 2 are in operation with the biggest store being JC Penney. Across from mall is Target and down the street a K-Mart. Spent time at the Color Factory which was amazing and fun ! Went to the Brooklyn Bridge which if you take a taxi from hotel to bridge it costs about $12.00. You could also take the subway which is a much lower fare. Soho is close by to Brooklyn Bridge, the walk to Soho is not long and once there you have the option to shop at many stores and get a bite to eat at Starbucks. There are many restaurants and cafe’s as well. Shake Shack is a fast food place that has awesome burgers and cheese fries ! I had a strawberry milkshake which tasted awesome as well ! Hotel being steps away from Rockefeller Center we engaged in some Christmas events. The enormous Christmas tree is a must see for everyone along with all the Christmas decorations that fill the city ! I must of took a couple thousand pictures of everything I explored capturing all the beauty of New York City ! The hotel is a great place to stay but make sure you get a renovated room and one which is located on a higher floor. I believe the hotel has 18 floors. We stayed on the 14th floor. There are a few shops and coffee shop in hotel but no restaurant. They do have room service which is brought in from an restaurant outside the hotel. We gave room service a try and had no problem, the service was quick and food came hot. You get your moneys worth on the food which I couldn’t even finish due to the bacon burger being so huge accompanied by a large amount of french fries, a pickle, and cole slaw.The menu offers a lot of variety; there is a lot to choose from the menu.All and all my daughter and I had a wonderful and fun filled time !!

The hotel is a prime location and one of the best prices in New York, however for one of upgrades bedrooms it sure needs some attention! The enamel was coming off the bath, the shower head was that low I had to knee in the bath tub to get under it. The toilet leaked when filling back up and the taps are far to over sensitive with regards to temperature control. My major concern was that, when we first arrived, following a long flight from the UK, we got to room and decided to have an hours nap. There was a knock at the door which we ignored as we were in bed, but then a man (presuming an employee) entered our room and proceeded to inform my girlfriend that the water was being turned off. She was sitting in bed in her bra! If there was no answer at the door, then why did he feel the needs to enter the room?? We then got up, got dressed and went out. Returning to our room around 8.30pm and went straight to bed with jet lag. Around about 9.30pm there was another knock at the door, again we ignored it as we were back in bed, and the same man tried to come back in. However, the door chain was on to stop him this time. Why on earth did he feel the need to keep coming into our room? I would like an answer please. On a more positive note, the bed was one the of comfiest I’ve been in and the rest of the staff were extremely helpful and kind.

Overall clean but not up to a 3 star rating. Towels stained and carpet ripped. The check in folks did find our reservation but when asked to assist with lack of wash rags, told us that is a different department, call "0". I tried and it rang 30 times with no answer. Never did get wash rags.

Firstly, the room was basic and definitely not good value for money but we didn't spend much time in it so it was ok. However, we arrived at 10pm after an 8 hour flight and had to stand in line to check in for 2 hours. We attempted to use the check in kiosks but they wouldn't work. The group in front of us asked for a discount as it was after midnight when they eventually got checked in and were given it without hesitation but when we asked we were told it wasn't possible. Both the manager and the lady who checked us in couldn't have cared less. We didn't even get an apology for the delay, she just sighed at us and said it hadn't actually been very long. We had been up for over 24 hours at this point and our first night was completely ruined. We thought maybe it was just a one off but the entire time we were there, the queue was huge and we constantly heard people complaining. We queued for 45 minutes to check out until a member of staff eventually came to us and took us out of the line to purchase luggage tags from him. While the location was unbeatable, the customer service was appalling and it will definitely stop me making another booking

The hotel is in severe need of renovation. Dirty carpets, stained bathrooms, holes in the walls, restroom door doesn’t close properly, mold, stains, dirt.... never expected this hotel to be so disappointing. Never again.

When I checked in they didn’t have the room I reserved available for that evening but I was able to move the next day. The initial room wasn’t nice at all, the bed was uncomfortable, there was only 1 pillow, and the room was very old, clean but old. Once I moved rooms, it was nice, comfortable bed and plenty of pillows. Only complaint was there wasn’t a mini fridge or microwave in the room making it hard to keep food after meals.

I arrived at 7pm and was checked in under 15 minutes by a friendly receptionist who gave me some advice on how to get back to JFK by train, as it had taken 2hrs to get to the city by shuttle bus as NY was in gridlock. The lifts were quick, the room was clean (I stayed on the 6th floor), the bed was comfy and the WiFi was very fast. That's all you need for a trip to the big apple. Thank you for a pleasant stay!

strange queueing to register longer than coming through customs and going outside for breakfast but otherwise very good. comfortable room, friendly staff, nice breakfast, superb location and easy checkout
user_name:
tednakhle
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: Easy to get to from Penn station. Love the friendly staff. The luggage hold at the end of your stay makes everything so easy. Great place to stay, so close to the heart of NYC. Near great shops, restaurants and activities. Get into the heart beat of NYC!

For such a huge hotel I think the staff do an excellent job....clean, and very comfortable...I'm sure the upgrade of ALL the rooms will come in time..and I hope the hotel continues for many years to come ( as I hear of rumours of escaping demolition)Well done great place.

Great location near of everything! Macy's supper close, just one block... superThe renewal room it's great, spacious, confortable bed. The TV, the sofa, everything was excelent. We are so happy! The bathroom too little but that was ok for two guests.☹ The towels were too old.

Check-in on the kiosk was a breeze. We were in our room in 10 minutes. The location is perfect for a visit in NYC. Hotel is close to major shopping and great attractions. You can walk to Bryant Park or the Rockefeller tree. A short uber ride can take you The Hudson.

First time staying here. Glad to find out we had a renovated room. The line to check in was very long so we opted to use the automated kiosk. Very quick and easy but it didn't give us the vouchers we needed for free continental breakfast or drinks at night. (We did get them the next morning). The room was of typical size for NYC. The bathroom was small. One small ledge for toiletries. The water temperature changed from hot to cold and back to hot multiple times while showering. The renovation did not seem to include everything. The bathroom floors were neat up and the walls were neat up as well. It was very warm in the room upon arrival so we tried to open the window but couldn't. We had to call down for help. It was very stuck but did open with brut force. Location was good. Right across from Penn Station. Staff was pleasant.

Check in was difficult. The room was the size of a closet. The bathroom door would not shut. No refreshments or way to make coffee unless you purchase them in the lobby for an outrageous price. The continental breakfast was a joke, and a 5min walk from the hotel! And all for $300 per night! The only thing they have going is their location. If it wasn't for that, they would have been closed long ago!

Yes the hotel is in desperate need of full on renovations of all rooms, but it's a great price for the location. MSG is about 100 steps from your room to their entrance and tons of stores surround the hotel. Here's a genuine pro/con listPros: amazing customer service! The woman at the front desk (blonde, older, glasses) was helpful and another concierge pointed us in the direction of self check out. It's quiet. We were on the 5th floor and the only thing we could hear was police sirens. Price of room, obviously. Lastly, William, the doorman was so personable and funny! Cons: it's old. Our room was clean, smelled fine, and most importantly, the water pressure and temperature worked. But the bedding and towels were so rough and it just felt dark everywhere (particularly the hallways)Overall, it's not a hotel you wanna put on your IG. However, it's nice for a short visit

Hotel Pennsylvania was a great choice. Our room was very large and newly renovated. It could have accommodated a comfy chair in addition to two queen beds. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. The closer was huge but could have used a light. The location was fabulous for our purpose and the staff was very friendly. A great addition is Express Check In which allows you to avoid the long lines at the check in desk. I would definitely stay here again.

On check in Maria "B" was AMAZING!!! She solved all of our problems and gave us a room with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. I work while traveling and the internet in the room is perfect! Better than what I have at home. The room is also very spacious and clean. I will recommend this hotel to my friends, family, and clients.

The hotel is in a good location, close to a number of shops and facing Madison Square Garden. The room where I stayed with my family was organized, but I needed a renovation on the ceiling because it had infiltration.

Where do I start.Queued for an hour to check in. I was shocked at the appearance of the Receptionist. Her jacket was about 2 sizes too small and the blouse needed either a good wash or throwing out!When the lift opened on 15th floor my heart sank. The carpets looked like they were water damaged and rucked up. I eventually found my room and my legs just buckled. It looked like the room hadn’t been used for years. This was not the room I booked.I went straight back to reception to complain. I was given an ‘upgrade’ so off I went to the 10th floor to a brighter newly decorated floor and opened the door to the room that I booked originally! Although brighter and cleaner the rooms are very plain, and wait for this...the bedspread is actually a sheet!I will say the room was warm and I only put the heating on a couple of times.There is no tea/coffee making in the room but there is a 24hr cafe in reception and I have to say they make a lovely cup of tea.The only pleasant members of staff were the chambermaids and one male member of staff who directed me to a nice diner to get breakfast.The female staff looked so miserable and no wonder with the amount of complaints guests were making. Everything looked so shabby even the uniforms and I did not meet one guest who spoke well of the hotel.So, this is one place I will not be returning to.
user_name:
Rhona S
Lambourn Woodlands, United Kingdom

review_body: The location was perfect for seeing the Billy Joel concert and convenient to the Port Authority terminal. The room renovations are nice as well. We look forward to returning to see a future show real soon.

Always a problem the the heating cooling, the knobs are always broken or loose and you hhave to reach in and turn them by hand-NOT an easy thing to do and if perhaps you are older a or lacking in strength - forget call done for some plyers.This is odd buy I wish sometimes the doors(closet/bathroom) would stay open.

Property is very convenient to MSG, the rooms are a bit old, but bed comfortable. Very busy hotel. Live always long to check in. Used Kiosk to check in but then had to wait on the check-in line to get breakfast vouchers.

After hearing such bad reviews of this hotel we was very worried and gutted. We contacted them and explained they said we would get an upgrade so we were looking forward to our stay. As it was it was great we arrived 10:30ot was pretty quite in the huge foyer with coffee shop, little newsagents and even a travel goods and souvenirs and a travel/tour guides to buy tickets for anything, got seen very quick, realised check in was 3 but they didn't have Penn 3000 as promised as they had all gone! I wasn't happy he said we could have an refurbished room and as we didn't get what we were expecting he gave us a room with 2 queen beds and he gave us 10 tokens for a free continental breakfast,( coffee porridge or large pot of fresh fruit, bagel and a pastry it was very nice,but we found out if you pay $10.89 for upgrade they gave you 1 small and 1 large plate to fill with what ever you wanted from buffet which was out of this world it had all sorts even pasta meat balls chinese foods and sushi and 4 different coffees or juices it filled us til late afternoon ) we could have our room right then so we were very happy. We paid the $250 dollars tax!! This is expected in most hotels apparently but some its included you really should check as this doubles Original price.. the room was on 14th floor each had beautiful huge foyer by the 12 lifts yes 12 6 either side, with huge seating area a projector screen showing the news. Each floor had drinks machine and ice machine to fill you champagne cooler in room.The room was amazing only upsetting thing is the view was of other part of hotel we dropped our bags in and the room it was beautiful, clean with small fridge and free safe, in closet with clean iron and board, with hair dryer and huge tv beds were amazing put stuff in safe freshened up and went straight out, when we came back 8 hours later!! reception was getting busy As for staff poeple said they were rude!! We realised it's the American way they are just direct and busy people you get used to it!! I thought they were fine. NY is amazing so much to do

After a stressful travel Maria B helped me get everything sorted out. She’s the sweetest person alive and She is truly superwoman. Give her a raise! And travelers don’t give her a headache! Very accommodating

Locational advantage. Walkable distance from Macy’s and other shopping places. So it was easy to carry shopping bags back to hotel room. Rooms have very limited amenities. I missed coffee maker in the room.

Arrived at Penn station using Amtrak from Boston, was able to exit and cross the street to the hotel. Is a very large hotel with 3* rooms which was clean and comfortable with good free wifi. The location means you can access NY attraction easily. Complaint, their business centre has a fee paid for by putting money on a prepaid card. Can get complicated to use. Counted 12 lift shafts but you could spend 20 mins trying to go down, as they are always full. Best to get on an up lift, and stay on till it goes down.Recommend the hotel if staying for a few days.

Nice, large upgraded room. Beautiful view of the Empire State building. Sparse furnishings, but wonderfully comfortable bed. Bathroom lighting not real bright. Sink stopper was disconnected from the control rod. No Do Not Disturb hang tag in room. No mini refrigerator, microwave, or coffee maker in room. Excellent, friendly staff. Complimentary beverages a nice touch. Continental breakfast? Eh. I thought it was a good value for the money and location. Don't forget. It's New York. It will be noisy.

The hotel is old which I knew before booking but what I was not expecting were gnays/flying bugs in the shower. They were on the shower curtains, wall and on the floor of the shower. For some unknown reason the TV channel would automatically turn to channel 79.

The hotel was a perfect location for us as we traveled by train. The room was very old but was perfect for our group of 5. We were within walking distance to all major attractions with a great view of the Empire State Building right out our window.

Hotel in the best location. You can walk everywhere midtown like Times Square, Fifth Ave, Empire State Building, Rockafella Centre, it’s practically next door to Macy’s. Don’t be fooled by bad reviews, yeah the hotel isn’t 5 star but the location is. I’d def go there again.

Huge old hotel. I had stayed there 3 years ago and I found some improvement this time. The receptionists are never clear, you don’t get the whole information about everything. I’m still trying to find out why we have been charged with $321 after we left the hotel but nobody answers me. I guess the location is so good that outweighs the disadvantages.

Hotel room was spacious enough for my baby to be crawling around. Restroom was clean and big. Customer service at check in and check out was great. There were a few things that could be improved. Starting with room service, they only cleaned our room once. We had our trash cans pretty full especially with having our baby with us. And there is no kitchen in the hotel. No microwaves not hot water at our reach for baby milk. We had to purchase hot water from a vendor that was inside the hotel. And that was if they weren’t closed already. For free breakfast we had to go to a restaurant that was outside of the hotel. Maybe 2min walk. Still a little inconvenient. Otherwise good location.

We stay there for 1 nigth, the staff is very friendly, the check in had a long line but it moves fastly. The room vas good. The check out is very easy and fast. The location is close to metro station and close to empire state

OK. Beds comfortable. Noisy. Convenient. Line to buy voucher to store bags is ridiculous, they should let the bellman do it, not front desk. Free breakfast across street not worth it. Not plush but it works. 50/50 staying there again.

Pennsylvania hotel is a very good one. Outstanding location, clean and a good service. Subway is located in front of what allows you gobto anywhere in the city. The room is clean eit enoigh space for a couple. The services provided are good.

The rooms that have not been upgraded definitely still look as over 50 years old.. The room we were put in was behind the elevators which are insanely loud, I had to buy ear plugs and Nyquil just to be able to sleep after the first night there. The front desk area is constantly busy so I never even tried to change rooms because of the line. The only good part of this hotel is the location and the front desk person at check in was polite and did get me in my room early. But we were only given 2 towels each day, zero wash clothes the entire time, and after the 1st night only 1 hand towel. And the room temperature could not be regulated. Not to mention the morning we checked out, there was a massive roach crawling in the bathroom.

Where do I start???Booked this trip for my wifes birthday, emailed them several times months in advance asking for a little special treatment, however never received a response on each occasion.Arrived on 5th December and was given the worst room I have ever been given room 300a (I wouldn't put a dog there) my wife was close to tears, went to reception and was told that was the only room they had left with a dbl bed, accepted a slightly cleaner room with 2 single beds on the premise that I could get a refurbished room in the morning for 50 dollars extra per night. Next morning I went to reception and was greeted by Maria who said that I could have an upgraded room for 50 dollars per night, I said yes as it is my wifes birthday, Maria amazingly said that she would upgrade us for free as it was her birthday.Had to pay $160 facility fee (for zero facilities). When I went to check out the man on reception said that I would have to pay $175, I ask what for and he said facilities fee, I said I had already paid $160 for this and he nonchalantly said "ok" without even checking the screen which indicated to me that he was trying to con us. I asked for some luggage tags and had to pay $5 PER TAG, total RIP-off hotel who rely on new customers rather than repeat. Was told that $100 deposit would be refunded but I really dont trust them and feel that I may have to spend several hours of emails etc to get it back. Would never go there again and total trip would have been spoilt if it hadn't been for MariaFrom a very unfussy traveller.

Terrible, terrible hotel! Filthy carpets, old and ripped bed linen, non working faucets in the bathroom, bugs crawling in the shower. This was a surreal experience. I couldn't wait to get out of that place. I guess the only good thing I can say is that staff were polite in the reception and bag check areas. Other than that, I had the utmost negative experience ever!

I will admit that the reason I picked the Hotel Pennsylvania was its' location to Penn Station. I was travelling with my 84 year old mother, and a walk across the street was perfect. This is the main thing I was satisfied about. Otherwise, this hotel is in dire need of updating, and unless you want to pay for an upgrade to a "refurbished" room, stay at another hotel. Carpets were old and really stained, leaving a poor impression. House cleaning failed to clean out the refrigerator. Bed had old box spring mattresses that 'crunched' when you moved on them. But, the worse was the bathroom. The acrylic cover for the hot water knob was broken and jagged (see picture). The toilet leaked from the back. There was mold in between the tiles on the walls, and the tub was missing chunks of porcelin (see pictures). I understand that many classic hotels are trying to make a comeback and upgrading slowly. However, for $350 a night, I expect better mattresses and a decent bathroom. Front desk staff were helpful. This was my worse experience at an upscale hotel.

Literally would put 0 stars if I could. Warning you now to stay the h*ll away from this establishment!!!! When we first checked in they put us in a room on the 10th floor, which had a leaking toilet leaving water on the bathroom floor, no fitted sheet on the mattress, only a random sheet draped over the bed, the shower would randomly get scolding hot to the point where it would burn two adults. The thermostat was in a dirty hole that was in-operable. The “newly renovated room” had cracks all throughout the molding, I think a Motel 6 would have been nicer.. after being fed up with issues, I decided to make a call to the front desk and get it taken care of. The manager then tried to make it right by moving us to a suite on the 17th floor. He then told us that a bellhop would be up with luggage help, which he brought nothing with him to carry our luggage and shortly left after giving us our new key card. after getting onto the 17th floor and seeing the room, we were impressed and thankful that the manager tried to make the situation better, UNTIL My fiancé and I were laying in bed and I got a notification for a charge for $800 that my bank had marked as potential fraud. before going down to the desk, I called Chase to get more information, which then they informed me they tried to charge my card $800, $750, $700, $650, $600, $550, $500, $450, $400, $350, and so on. At this point we were livid. we walked down to the desk to assess the situation and the manager acted clueless and said that we should look at the room we were initially in to see why they had charged us. My fiancé and I followed the security guard and the manager to the 10th floor room, ready to show them all of our issues that we had initially complained about. When they unlocked the door, our jaws dropped after seeing a smashed TV that was untouched when we left. they said that we were the only ones that had been in and out of the room, but somehow they tried to charge us for a broken TV that they wouldn’t have known of if no one had been in the room. We asked to see security footage of the hallway, which they did not let us see or give us any additional information. not to mention, the door didn’t even fully shut unless you slammed it in the first place, so really anyone could have been in and out after we had left the room. We had to get NYPD involved, which side note, the police completely agreed that the hotel had no right to charge us and that it seemed like the TV had been damaged by hotel staff and the staff was possibly afraid to lose their job blamed it on it’s customers. in return, the manager was upset that the police were agreeing with us and asked us to vacate the premises at 10:15 in the evening after we had already paid in full for four nights. This facility is extremely unprofessional, rude, and filled with slimy and disgusting individuals. this place is a joke and I feel bad for their staff being so afraid to lose their job that they feel the need to lie and blame a customer. I have attached a picture of the damages of the TV to show you how it was smashed. One thing to add to the argument, is the only thing that was moved in the room from the time we left to when security brought us back up to the room, was a steel luggage rack that could’ve easily damaged the TV, that was folded up about 3 feet from it. All I can say, is f**k this hotel and stay as far away as you can.

This midtown Manhattan hotel, marking its 100th year in 2019, certainly makes the grade for location and for tradition. Unfortunately its service and facilities don’t pass muster. They add a $40/day “resort fee” and disclose it only after you’ve booked a reservation. What does $40/day buy? One drink per person per stay at an offsite pub only good after 7:30 pm. Daily “breakfast”, a beverage & a pastry at an offsite food court. Exercise & swimming, also off-site. Decent wi-fi, but they don’t tell you about the secret access code unless you ask. Our room on the 10th floor had some newer furniture, but apparently they didn’t get around to installing a credenza or chair. The room was mostly empty floor space. On day 1 we got two hand towels and one washcloth; day 2 just two hand towels and no washcloths; and on day 3 one hand towel only. There was no way to regulate temperature in the room. On the plus side, they provided a pretty good TV, and there’s a place in the lobby to buy coffee. Maybe they’re still working on this place and it will be better in the future. For now, stay for the location, but don’t expect much else.

Our 5 night stay at Hotel Pennsylvania was great. We didn't have a view room but likely slept better away from the busy streets. We chose an upgraded room for our stay.Check in and check out was fast, courteous and efficient. The included breakfast is down the block but not far and there is a cafe in the lobby of the hotel. The staff operating the tour booth in the lobby were very helpful with any questions we had. The Macy's window displays were right on our way to Times Square and Rockefeller Centre as well as so many other things to see. The location is great, I'm not sure we would have ventured down to that area if we stayed closer to Times Square...so glad we did.We had one incident when checking out with a couple of cons offering to pay us for our room keys...security took care of them right away. We would recommend Hotel Pennsylvania for your next stay in New York!

Great location staff very helpful breakfast big let down.felt I was in line for a soup kitchen . Place needs major overhaul and better lobby security.. Bedrooms spacious but could do with major clean up and revamp and attention to detail

The location is absolutely great. But the rest is not. No one is friendly, they do not care the visitors. I was trying to ask question but they acted very rude. Never mind it was my first and last one to stay here. Thanks!

Horrible. Beyond dirty. Very old hotel. Very old and uncomfortable jelly bed. No Comforter on bed. Super small bath towels, no Hair dryer. no air conditioning in the cold weather. Very noisy. traffic of 30 minutes to get a elevator. Ok location, About 15 min. Walk to time square. Coffee and a old and cold bagel for breakfast

Trying to make the most of two-days/1 night stay at a reasonable rate for NYC -- Hotel Pennsylvania made it possible. Across the street from both Penn Station and subway access, we checked in early (additional charge) and were quickly arriving at either Ground Zero or Lincoln Center, for $3 per person. But be prepared for a waiting line to check in (also pre-pay for your baggage storage tickets for the next day's checkout/departure), and know that the free continental breakfast is almost a city block away and across the street. The renovated rooms have eye-appeal (although need a second bedside table), but the repainted bathrooms are still vintage. Overall, simply thankful for the visit this hotel made possible.

The location of this hotel is excellent - across the street from Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's. 5 minute walk to Times Square.The hotel is not glamorous!! The first room I checked in to was facing MSG and the window was broken so it was cold nd noisy. But I was given a quieter room on request. The room was basic but clean and the bed was really comfortable.There's a gym on the 19th floor - again pretty basic but perfectly usable.If you are looking for a great location this is a good choice, just know that it's not The Ritz!

Stayed at your hotel dec 5-9 and must say I didn’t know what to except.. The staff was friendly at check in and everything went very smoothly. My room was clean but bathroom was quite small, understandably being the age of the hotel . My only complaint, bath towels to small and only one bedside table. Well and also no chest of drawers... would like to see money invested in this hotel bc it is very outdated throughout. The potential being across from an iconic MSG would seem like a very lucrative investment. This time of year the price was reasonable.. just needs some work !

Location is great. Not more...and this thing keeps me asking for at least 200 characters. So.. if you choose it, just not ask anything from the people there. They are not friendly at all.. and if you leave in the morning be wise and keep a key with you so you can use the not so public bath located in the basement.

Had a good time in NYC. We selected to stay here because of its location. We had scheduled a classic room and it was clean but old, very old. We promptly upgraded with no problem. Newly remodeled rooms are great! Manager was very helpful. Breakfast was included, simple but really all you need with small children. As we all select this hotel because of its accessible cost, be mindful that there will be lots of people so pack your patience. Lines are inevitable in NYC and this hotel is huge! Elevators are always full. We enjoyed the upgraded room with a view of the Empire State Building. Cleaning staff was crazy nice. All in all we enjoyed our stay - location is really great!

The hotel is absolutely abysmal, the rooms were dirty and have the cleanliness of a rubbish bin.The rooms are not as shown on the website pictures and are not even liveable. The shower and toilet does not work properly and the rest of the room doesn’t look like it has been cleaned since the 1950s.When we asked to move room our luggage was stored into a random room that was not for luggage and upon return found our cases had gone missing.The stay at this hotel was anything but enjoyable, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice week/weekend in the city.Some look at the hotel and see a palace like I did when I first walked in however I’m now walking out thinking a hostel would have been a better idea then this hotel.

I recently stayed at this hotel, while in New York City for a convention. I'm a frequent business and personal traveler and my expectations are fairly flexible - especially when trying to save money. But this place was the most horrible hotel experience I've had in the last decade.I and several members of my company were all staying here due to its proximity to The Javits Center. The automated checkin kiosks seemed to be working, but after 11 minutes of struggling through the menus, they weren't able to issue keys. So, we all had to wait over 2 hours and 10 minutes just to check in at the desk. The first problem was that there was a huge line and sometimes only a single clerk. The second problem was that everybody who got a room assignment was coming back down, jumping the line, and demanding a new room.Once we were finally checked in, we expected the rooms which were shown on the hotel website and promised by our travel agent. But, we were given rooms which were approximately 1/4 to 1/3 the size, certainly less attractive, and lacking almost every amenity. I'll attach pictures to this review. Three of my colleagues had to change rooms multiple times just so they could get rooms without MOLD - which was clearly visible on the walls and ceiling. My room had a disgusting ventilation system, but I was too tired to try and switch it out until the second night. It's clear that the pictures on the website were NOT the rooms which most people get assigned. It was also clear the front desk staff didn't care.In the elevator lobby, there were signs which read that you must show a key to gain access. There was a guy in a hotel uniform posted there, but he wasn't checking anybody's keys and at times, he was even asleep. The lack of security was evident by the fact that there were two hookers roaming around on my room's floor - knocking on doors and making offers. When I reported this, the so-called security guy didn't even pretend to be concerned.Many of the rooms come with a "free breakfast." But it turns out that this is just coffee/juice and a muffin at a nearby (and somewhat hidden) deli. There is no food or restaurant in the hotel itself. So, we had to head out into the rain just to get our measly free food.I and my colleagues stopped by the front desk multiple times, to speak with a manager. Whenever we did, we were rudely told that either no manager was on duty or none were available to speak with us.If you are tempted by this hotel's website and/or prices, I beg you to do yourself a favor and look elsewhere - even if you need to stay in a local youth hostile or sleep on a bench in Central Park. Don't believe what you see on this hotel's website.

Newly remodeled...old hotel with remodeling. Comfortable beds, nice big room. Front desk was very helpful and accommodating. Early check in is worth price. 12 noon checkout at no charge. Breakfast is fine. Nice stay!

Sleeping on a bench in Penn Station would have been cleaner. The “standard” room is code word for “hasn’t been updated in 20+ years”. Frequent business traveler here- any Marriott or Hyatt property will feel like the Four Seasons after this experience.

Although the room was clean and the location of the hotel was convenient to major shopping and attractions, I probably will not stay in this hotel again. I believe the hotel is trying to renovate, however the room we stayed in needed to be restored. I would also recommend checking in at the Express kiosk due to the long lines at the check in desk.

The staff was friendly and efficient. The location is very convenient. The room was clean and comfortable. The lobby is always filled and busy with check ins, make use of the Express check in kiosks. It would be nice to have a coffee maker and a refrigerator in the room. This is a good choice and I would recommend this hotel. I would stay here again.

The hotel is great. Making strides to be a luxury hotel again. We did have a recently restored room, be careful I think there are rooms that are very old still. The staff was AMAZING. Our room was very clean

Nice upgraded room. From my window I could see MACY"S BELIEVE! for Christmas. It was a magical winter view. I enjoyed my two chairs and table. The room was a little chilly but my blanket from the Mand M store kept me warm. The shower was hot and steamed up my room real well. The bathroom was well stocked with towels toilet paper,tissues,, used all the toiletries. I enjoyed watching St.John basketball and wrestling.

Very comfortable bed, helpful staff, close to everything and very reasonable, only drawback was it was in need of decorating but overall very enjoyable stay. Also could have done with tea and coffee facilities in room, that’s just me being a typical English traveller.

Decent value and a great location. Just thought the time it took to check in and check out was too time consuming.Our room was on a lower floor, so if you intend on sleeping, go higher up since it is a very busy part of the city.

Yes it’s old but that is part of the charm. Regarding the free breakfast, you have to leave the hotel and cross the street. Not great in cold weather. The free drink coupons were appreciated. The Irish pubs were great. The location is perfect. I would definitely return.

Hotel Pennsylvania is a historic hotel dating back in the 1900's and the Times Square location is convenient for subway and the famous Macy's Thanksgiving Parade. We have positive and negative experience. Don't be fooled by the photos that you see in their website. The property has several buildings connected to each other. Some suites have been renovated and others not an the bathroom is really tiny. At check in, the front office staff was very nice and gave us our room key. When we got to the room, instant disappointment, it started the moment we open the squeaking door, musty smell with a very old filthy ripped carpet, bathroom tub rusty and you don't even want to step in it-every thing is old and really tired. I took some photos. So we dash back to the front office and was begging if he can release us from our four nights stay but he insisted that unfortunately, he cannot do that and we would lose our money. He did in fact, offered to move us to a room in the renovated floor and because we were so dead tired from travelling, we just gave in. the room has view of 1/2 of the tower of the Empire State. the room was freezing cold and the thermostat cannot be adjusted. for the cost of the room that they charge, we could have stayed comfortably in another hotel. Our reservation included breakfast and you have to ask for the vouchers. the restaurant is not on site so you have to get out of the hotel and walk close to a block. We were ill treated in their designated restaurant, most of the staff were rude and just because we queued for a "free" breakfast of fruit, pastry and coffee or juice, it does not mean that we were at their mercy. $5 charge for each luggage storage should be complimentary. this was my first trip to NY and having spent a few days there, I now have found other possible hotels that will provide me with a much better hotel accommodation. I just feel so bad for other guests that have come from all corners of the world that have stayed in the suites that were not renovated but paid for the costs of the room that it was not worth the penny.. some of them may come back to NY but probably like me that will never come back to The Penn Hotel. it was the front office staff that checked us in that made the difference. so Pennsylvania Hotel, your proximity to Madison Square Garden, Macy's=,Penn Station, the Broadway to name a few is convenient but please try to renovated your rooms for your sake and the sake of your future guests..

Hotel location is perfect. Recently renovated room was very good! When we arrive to check-in, we met the most dedicated and diligent front office employee, Maria “B”. We had some problems regarding our reservation process. Maria “B” was the only one who help us and definitely solve the problem at the checkout date. She solved everything before we left! Was more than helpful. Was dedicated and very kind, considering that we need to leave immediately to airport. Thank you Maria “B”, you have made the difference between very good and excellent! We will come back...

We were travelling back from Niagara Falls and the train was due to arrive back in NYC at 10pm so we decided to overnight before continuing our trip and chose this hotel due to its proximity to Penn Street Station. What a mistake. Forty minutes to book in as only two people on reception. Booked a classic room with a King size bed but that is definitely no what we got. If it was not for the fact we had been travelling for 12 hours and were shattered we would have left. See photos of room below - bathroom door was rotten, furniture was old and tired, curtain was ripped., amongst other things. There were no coffee or tea facilities in the room either. We had booked for breakfast but had not been given vouchers by reception and the diner was a block away. The queue for reception to get them was at least another 30 minute wait. Also did not get access code for WiFi. If you need to leave luggage it’s $5 each bag and you have to get luggage labels from reception, another wait in line!

Very nice basic hotel room was cleaned and linen changed daily don't bother with the breakfast included when booking its only a price of cake or bread and butter and a coffee but apart from that we enjoyed our stay staff very helpful

This hotel is very nice in the middle of everything in manhattan I had a suite was very affordable hotel was clean and perfect location for where I was going in New York I would definitely recommend to others

This hotel is in a great location right across the road from Penn station. However. I would not call it a hotel. More like a glorified dorm. No restaurant, or lounge. You have to leave the hotel for any food. Rooms are smaller than a Microtel. Mattresses are good but it is really tired. I realize this is NYC but $300. Canadian a night is a lot for what you get. Seems that everything downtown is under renovation except the Pennsylvania. I am guessing the room in the photo is one of only a few at about $600 per night. We booked for location and were disappointed. One cheap office chair was only seating or the bed. Paying Canadian dollars for this with fees (for what) was pricey.

The only reason to stay at this hotel is the location... otherwise this hotel has very little going for it. Street noise all night... you could literally hear the people’s conversation in the next room. The rooms are so tiny you can barely get past the bed. Only beds in the room no sitting chairs, or desk... And while the hotel did provide luggage racks... you couldn’t put them up in the room because they would’ve been in the walkway.The included breakfast required you to leave the hotel and go across the street for a croissant and a cup of coffee. I doubt very few people will do that. I would not book this hotel again.

Before booking any New York hotel be aware of the infamous New York “facilities charge”. So before booking anything, web search how much your hotel could change you on top of the listed prices. This is not a local tax (that is extra) merely but a method of adding to your bills for items such as use of the lifts, phones, etc. HotelThe hotel is massive with 1700? rooms, and is a local landmark due to it’s scale and corner location. It is sort of extended “E” shape. The exterior architecture, reception area and lift lobby show signs of past Art Deco glamour. The other areas and corridors, having been or are in the process of upgrading in various styles of the fashion of that time. With some floors appearing refreshed others not. The fellow guests appeared mainly to be American student groups or foreign tourists. There was always a long queue at reception, I arrived very late and had to wait about 20 minutes to check in. Overall my stay was a functional experience except breakfast, which could be deeply unpleasant. Breakfast was taken across the road in a buffet restaurant. Guest were given tokens for either the buffet (heavy fried items of low quality) or continental; plastic box with chopped melon, sweet sauce, choice of sweet item like muffin, croissant, etc. and choice of small weak coffee, bottle of water or juice. Pick the wrong time and very crowded and noisy. Go early or best avoided due to angry people who seem to be expecting the buffet. I would not take either option but it was included in the price. However I would sometimes skip and go to the nearby Pret café for (much) better coffee and environment or Macy’s back garden square if sunny.RoomMy room was an “unfurnished” double on the 14th floor. No view as such as was inward facing so looking at other hotel wing room windows. The room was a good size for New York and had a spacious bathroom. There was: a double bed, two side tables with large table lights, desk and chair with another lamp, wardrobe, a small safe and small TV. It was cleaned daily but the walls and woodwork were covered in marks and the furniture was chipped. It felt “tatty” for the price. The room had no art deco features apart from an original chipped bathtub and some old floor and wall tiles. The room, furniture and bathroom needed an refresh.
