Note I did not ask for a room exchange, as the desk queue was always bad. The room “facilities” charge was an extra 218 US Dollars for the whole stay.AreaGreat location at corner of 34 St and 7th Ave. Sit directly above subway for up/down town at 34 St/Penn Station and opposite Pennsylvania Station for trains for JFK airport and Washington DC, bus stop at side for uptown. Next to Macys and easy access to the High Line garden. In walking distance for most common uptown and downtown sites. Overall the area was full of low-grade tourist shops/eateries with limited options of quality. Only the food court in Penn. Station stood out – not cheap but at least food was cooked to order. The small garden at the back of Macy’s for better coffee or (when raining) the local Pret et Manger for decent cheap coffee and view of the Empire State from the window stools. Crowds stuck to 7, 8 and 9th Avenues so could be walked around and the area felt safe. Tourist touts outside hotel but no problems were obvious. BadTatty, unfurnished room, groups of students eating supermarket/takeaway food in the lift areas, long queues for reception, high “facilities” charge.Traveller TipOnly accept a refurbished room. Ask for an outside view facing room if you want a view. Using bankcards was a problems as the area likes cash for anything under 20$ US.Hotel TipContinue the new refurbishment in a single style i.e. art deco repro. The mis-match detracted from the upgrade. Have an eating lounge for the students. To maintain room standards have a monthly room wall and woodwork cleaning program.Would I stay again?Great location but boring area but no. It did not offer value when the “facilities” change was added and at times it felt like a hostel. I would not take the breakfast option.

I have to say, after worrying about all the reviews we read me and my two sisters were dreading our stay here. We couldnt have been more wrong, on arrival we checked in with no problem and the check in staff are lovely. Next one was opening our room door!!! Well what a surprise, room is spotless and if all you want is somewhere clean, warm and safe then this place ticks the boxes. All the reviews about mice, rats, homeless people hanging around and unfriendly staff are not true, we certainly havent encountered this. The location is amazing. So dont believe everything you read, we're delighted with our room. Thankyou to everyone who works hard at hotel Pennsylvania.x

We arrived early (2:30pm) so checking in wasn't a big deal like some other reviews mentioned. We might have waited 10 minutes before being helped. As far as the check-in process is concerned; some things could have been clarified to help make our stay more enjoyable. The coupons we were given for meals and drinks were not explained very well; we could hardly hear what our agent was telling us about each voucher. We valet parked the car and we would have liked to have retrieving the car explained to us. (You go to the Bell Captain desk and he called for the car for us but, you have to pay the attendant outside)We wanted to walk around a bit after checking out and wanted to check our bag. If that is something you want to do be sure to get a ticket (for each bag) from the front desk at check-in. We stayed in the renovated section and, while it was nice, it still could use some spiffing up for that kind of money. All in all, we would definitely stay here again but, now we have a better idea of what we need to do to make the stay more enjoyable.
user_name:
dnrif
Little Egg Harbor, New Jersey

review_body: The staff were very polite and we were always helped immediately. The room is also very good. The breakfast is enough and the coupons for food and drink in the "Stouts" were good. Great value for money. Will book again.

We were attending a concert at MSG and hotel is across the street. Very convenient. Clean room. Comfortable bed. Rates were excellent and overnight parking only $37.00. For NYC, that is fantastic. Would return.

This was the best location we could ask for. The rooms were s little dated. But the website tells you that and you can always upgrade, but we were to busy in the city having everything withing walking distance to spend much time in the room. Everything was exactly as described, free breakfast was as described, just a great location, great staff, and no surprises. I'll be staying here again in future

The room was very simple and for just being renovated we thought we would have better quality in amenities. I also was upset as when we checked out we were asked to pay to store our luggage because our flight didn't leave until almost 8p. We ended up just going to the airport.

Very good location excellent staff only bad thing I could say about is that u have to go just across the road for breakfast but that’s a minor, really good place to stay, subway was just across the road Macy’s round the corner as well !

Much much better than past years ,clean and renovated room house keeping much better than last times :no loud voices in passage as before.thank you mr steven the front desk manager,you made our stay very pleasent:you are professional ,active ,patient with customer and a leader. Thank you raymond the very very nice and patient front desk employee.trying to help all guests.

We booked there Nov 27. We got to check in around 9pm. Only 2 people working the desk. 90 mins later we got a room. 1st room was not even close to what we had paid for. Waited in line 30 mins got another room and it was discussing. Fresh blood stains on carpet, mold in bathroom, hair on floor and on a wall in the bathroom, floor not vacuumed, dirt, dust, and mold in heater. Room was very small and bed was very hard. Have pictures to prove. Don’t waste your money, book elsewhere.

Very Basic, may have been a grand hotel in its time but in need of refurbishment. The shower is low so great for a small person. However the room was clean and enough for the time spent in it. The lobby area is nice and the staff helpful but when going for free breakfast over the street I would not recommend the ten dollars upgrade as it’s terrible. The free breakfast is a tub of fruit a croissant and a coffee.

The room was very clean and tidy,the bed a bit uncomfortable,the curtains you could see the lights through them, the location was great close to everything the overall stay wasn't so bad only thing is bath towels are never there this is my second stay there and you have to request it

The best place ever. You can walk from the hotel everywhere in Manhattan. Subway station were close. Room was good enough - quiet, all facilities, great bed. I think the hotel is an example of good price/value balance.

New penn plaza room was amazing. Plenty of space and loved the separate sitting area. Room spotless and serviced every day. Staff as always very helpful. Will definitely be staying here on next visit to NYC.

1st room smelled of cigarette smoke and had a fresh pet stain on the rug. Manager quickly assigned another room that was clean. Front desk staff not very friendly, needs improvement on basic customer service attitude (try adding words like - welcome, thank you, enjoy your stay, etc). Security by the elevators very nice and helpful. Love the location, and got a great price on a renovated room. Overall the place needs updating, but good place to stay on a budget.

great room for the price esp during a NYC holiday. Room was modern clean and well maintained. Valet parking does not work. Just find a garage on your own. breakfast option across the street was minimal but adequate.

It is a great value for the price. Directly across from the train station. I’ve stayed here many times. The room I got this time was updated a bit more than last time, but still needs work. The sink and toilet were crooked. Sink drain was slow. Wall outlets were falling out of wall. Looks like they put more money into the floor lobbies than the rooms. Bed was clean. Mystery stains on the walls and lampshades.

The location of this hotel is perfect for New York sightseeing and getting around Manhattan. Unfortunately, this is the only positive point I can share and is the reason I can give, at the most, one rating.The hotel lobby with the Christmas tree and decorations, which are very tasteful, is passable and of decent appearance. The front desk staff are unwelcoming, unhelpful, unfriendly and have an appearance as unkempt and tired, as the hotel.I stayed with family, a party of eight for four nights; we had three rooms between us. Each of our rooms were of the same, awful standard. We were on the 15th floor and the sight that met us when stepping out of the lift was quite disgusting; the carpet in the hallway is not only dirty but full of stains and only worthy of going into the nearest skip! The room doors are all damaged and in a poor state, an extremely unwelcoming sight. The rooms are quite filthy and the carpets only slightly better than the hallway; I didn’t feel comfortable walking bare foot in the room. The bedsheets seemed clean but the same cannot be said of the blankets and bedspreads. The beds are rickety and seem quite old. The bedrooms all have a flatscreen tv, however, I would prefer to see a decent carpet and money spent on decor. On a positive note, after the first night we asked housekeeping for extra pillows, these were delivered to the room quite promptly.There are so many original features in the hotel that, I feel, with some tlc and efficient maintenance Hotel Pennsylvania could be quite beautiful, unfortunately, at the moment, it is a glorified hostel.It amazes me that a hotel of this size doesn’t have its own restaurant or bar; going out of the hotel to a cafe down the road isn’t ideal and the breakfast in the cafe is far from ideal. The staff almost threw the breakfast allocation onto our plates and the hot drinks were lukewarm.Although we didn’t stay in the hotel for any length of time and only used our rooms for showering and sleeping it would’ve been nice to have a clean room and the furnishings and decor to be of a higher standard, especially as the price paid was by no means the cheapest in Manhattan.I will not stay here again, at least until I know there have been renovations made to the rooms, doors and hallways. I would also not recommend this hotel to anyone, as it currently stands.

We stayed here recently for 5 nights, we checked in with no hassle and headed to our room on the 8th floor, needless to say I wasn’t in there long before going to the front desk to request a new room! It was disgusting and looked like something from terror towers! When I asked for a new clean room I was asked if I wanted to upgrade! No I didn’t want to upgrade I wanted a clean room like I had paid for! We got a new room on the 4th floor which was better but not great! We had no hot water on the first night and the hot tap in the sink didn’t work but I was not going through another room change! The location is great but the noise was a bit much. The free continental breakfast consists of “one trip down the buffet line” in which you are given 1 fruit cup, 1 bagel or muffin and 1 drink, (tea/coffee or a fruit drink!) might I add that the breakfast is served in a cafe down the road and isn’t actually in the hotel, the cafe is crowded as serves the public also and you will struggle to get a seat, we collect our breakfast and took back to our room each day. After day 5 you get a bit sick of eating the same thing everyday as the fruit cup never changes from melon! On the last day they had run out of bagels and were serving hard bread even though there was plenty bagels left for the paying customers?! They were even running low on muffins so cut them in half!! If you do stay here I recommend upgrading and not having the breakfast but bear in mind this hotel is very dated and the carpets on the floors are disgusting. Unfortunately I didn’t take pics of the first room as I just needed out of there asap.

Booked a room with 3 beds, but when we got here they gave us a room with two beds and a put you up bed which didn’t fit in the room. The doors keys didn’t work so we couldn’t get into the room. They did more us the next day to the room we had originally booked. Staff were not helpful and the hotel in needs a makeover. Breakfast was included but only a coffee and danish over the road. If you just want a base and not worried about room size then this is fine

Spent one night at the hotel but it was great. We walked everywhere so it was a perfect location. The staff was excellent. We arrived a little early but they were able to help us out. It was a great experience.

People at front desk were nice and helpful. Our room on the 16th floor was a little small but was clean and had a nice beds with a comfortable mattress. Location was perfect. Close to everything. Only negative is the continental breakfast not great (free). The wall little thin so you can hear baby cry in next room.

Though the rooms are a bit on the small side and might need a little do-over, it was clean and quiet (!) and the location was great for what we wanted to do. Our key card stopped working during our stay and it was replaced with zero hassle, the front desk staff was very nice.

Excellent price to value ratio. Service was fantastic. Community style hotel with shared space on each floor right by the elevators. Very large rooms. Eclectic style. Several elevators for fast lobby to floor service.
user_name:
Scottlyn01
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My sister was staying there and I send some pakages (4 to be exact, perfectly under their limit and with the name of the person staying there). ‘Benny’ sign them and my tracker all say the same: delivered. They don’t take the responsibility to look for them! Besides that everyone except the manager treated my horrible! Once I was even hang up on while saying what happened. And yes, I was being the most polite I could be.  The service is undeniably bad! I’m still trying to have them look for it but they just don’t even try.

Liked · Location of the hotel is genius and the historical meaning of the hotel is impressive as wellDisliked · The condition of the room is short of disastrous. The staff is clearly overwhelmed with the amount of guests they host and as a result borderline rude. Facilities like ice and vending machines in the floors are not maintained. The 'included Breakfast' is misleading as it is rather limited and outsourced to an Cafe around the corner.

I have stayed here for years. I’ve never had such a horrible person wait on me as this lady. She was outright nasty and was blatant about it. The room was great. Very clean and great size. I stay here because I spend a lot of time in Macy’s and old navy. Location is purely it and not the quality of the hotel.

Decent. Pros location, clean, decent price, best water pressure ever in the shower.Cons just average hotel, beds not comfortable at all for being remodeled early this year, we froze overnight because u had 2 options which were freeze or roast. Would stay again because of clean and price. Stay in executive rooms or supposedly real bad. Nice view of madison square garden as well!

Just to say a HUGE thank you to Maria B in Hotel Pennsylvania for her assistance this morning, we needed to change rooms and she made it happen with such ease and nothing was a problem to her. She has made our experience in New York so much more special!! From,Sandra and Paige Dunne from Ireland x

We stayed in the old side of the hotel. This is an OLD hotel, did not expect it to be super upgraded. The room was spacious. The bedding was dated but probably after renovations it will be renewed. The room and bathroom were clean. Tlhe corridors are wide and long, the noise level was low. There is HEAT in the building. Although there are individual controls the room was HOT at times. The flat screen tv is the modern piece in the room (which looked out of place). There were no dressers just a vanity table. The bathroom is very small. Registration was long as there were only two clerks when 15 parties were in line. No one mentioned their Express Check-In. One minor complaint - even though you are "holding" the reservation with a credit card, to pay upon your arrival - your room may be cancelled. Before 8 am on the morning of check-in, the card will be charged. If there is no money/credit on the card; your room will be cancelled. You will get a email that appears to be a scam. I called the hotel to determine if the email was a scam. It was not; my room had been cancelled. Fortunately, I was able to re-reserve my room on another card; which was charged immediately - before I even arrived at the property. Otherwise it was a good stay.

Best location ever! The hotel is huge and some rooms are a bit old, but it’s clean and good! The best is the facilities and access. The breakfast is outside and very bad, but in the overall it’s quite ok

The location was great. Close to subways and main stores and attractions. My only complain is the noise from outside you can hear it on the 11th floor and the next door hotel guests, but this is not the hotel's fault. Check in and check out process was seamless, but you will have to have your luggage stored. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Would come back.

Had to change my room to one with a bathtub. it was no hassle they found me a very comfortable room. The clerk at registration was very pleasant and helpful. I was working on the parade and it was a very convenient location.

This hotel was so frightening, we did not stay! We just wanted a simple room in good location but everything was filthy, sheets were stained. Just absolutely disturbing is the only way to describe it. We stayed in the room only long enough to make an alternative booking!

Booked one of the classic rooms for two nights and it was gross. Turned on the hot water in bathroom sink it was brown. The heat/ac was corroded and didn’t work. We upgraded to one of the newer remodeled rooms and it was 100 times better. However I didn’t like paying the difference to get clear water. I’m not high maintenance and would’ve been fine in a room that wasn’t updated but I draw the line at brown water.

I rode the train which was 6 hours late, my room had been canceled I was put in a regular room and because of my disability I could not get in the bath tub to take a shower. The front desk told me that they would have a handicapped accessiable room the net morning and they did. It was beautiful I truly enjoyed my stay. On the way back from getting food I fell in the middle of the street. I was not hurt but sore. The room helped me get around even with the fall. When I return to New York I am going to request that same room. My 11 year old great grandson loved the room and the rollaway bed he said felt like a real big bed. My last stay was not postive but this was the best!! The staff was great as usual. The hotel was quiet and clean. Improvements have been made and they are for the best.

My 9-year-old daughter and I stayed at Hotel Pennsylvania over Thanksgiving week 2019. She and I felt safe the whole stay, loved the history of the hotel and the location is great. Easy access to the subway and walking distance to Times Square.

Hotel is great location. Rooms clean and sheets very nice. Could not control the temperature in the room except by struggling to open the window. No amenities in the rooms , ex City maps , tourist suggestions, snacks etc. NO COFFEE POT! The free breakfast was Ok but small coffee cups.  Concierge was horrible and disrespectful. She did get us into Arno’s on Wednesday night. The young man nice.

The hotel was in a great location and since we basically used it to sleep and light lounging it was perfect. If someone is in need of a clean environment then I would not recommend they stay at your facility. My son and I are very low maintenance so it worked just fine however our room had faulty plumbing, burned out light bulbs, wholes in the shower wall, horrifyingly stained carpets and consistently stained linens of which were not changed out on a daily basis. If it wasn’t for the pristine location I wouldn’t recommend staying at your establishment.

Nice place clean, too hot in room and we didn’t turn on heater, opened window in morning. Bell man was really really nice. Also hotel check in girl was nice. Close to all train, Maddison square Garden.

I went to the hotel Pennsylvania for thanksgiving with family and friends during our stay Maria B who went out of her way to make us feel very welcomed and she showed us where to get breakfast and where to eat her hospitality to us was above and beyond.

We had such a nice check in woman. Her name WAS Maria B. She was so helpful. And explained everything to us from breakfast to fun.To WERE the parade was.Also were we could get great for food. Thank you Maria B.
user_name:
lisabM8393EH
Warwick, Rhode Island, United States

review_body: Our stay was fair, very conveniently located,check in was painless. The room was a little odd and needs up dating. When we stepped off the elevator I thought I had stepped into the set of "THE SHINING" I had heard that the free breakfast was in a location across the street so I was prepared but the choices that were advertised were not what we received. We were offered a small cheap Danish and coffee about the size of shot glass.

Stayed in room 469 and got the value we expected! Nice big room, big bed, clean and serviced each day. Check in and out was very easy. Everyone very pleasant and would stay there again! Opposite MSG, Penn Station, walking distance to Times Square, Theatres, many ships and eating options, just a great location to see the sights and sounds of New York!

We stayed for 10 days at Pennsylvania..it was my secind stay here. Last time I stayed in March 2016 for 15 days.This time i booked 2 1BR Suite rooms. I really appreciate the room size, real big. They were newly renovated. Decent carpets then the normal rooms. Wld certainly stay again if similar rooms are guaranteed in future.

Ideal location, luckily we had a view of the ESB, room was adequate but I’m sure it was not the same as shown shown on booking site. (Which looked more spacious)No drink making facilities in the room, the biggest disappointment was the voucher breakfast system. Walk across the road to Jacks to be greeted by what I would describe as soup kitchen facilities, a trestle type table and a choice of porridge, bagel, fruit pot or pastries, which were handed to you like a food kitchen for the poor. You could have the ‘upgrade’ but for this price you may as well ate elsewhere. Anyhow staff at hotel were friendly, it was clean and functional and a good base. Would I stay there again, NO. I paid the extra for included breakfast but didn’t find out until after payment it was a voucher system.

Carpet in the corridor and in the rooms not up to expectations. The security manager the one who sits near the lift was very rude, he has to be more courteous to customers. I am referring the Manager who was on duty on 25th morning during check out time.

The hotel looks as if it's been grabbed from centuries ago and place in there. It's stuck in time. Definitely needs a coat of fresh paint, full cleaning, new carpets and all. It smells like humidity, old and dirty.Not only this but also on my first night they got me a dirty room which was not what I paid for. It's been more than 1 month since I came back from NYC and I still haven't received my refund, which they said they were gonna do quickly. On the photos attached is the room I got and the one I should have been given.I couldn't sleep on my first night since there was a lot of noise on the rooms next to me and my room was so dirty that I slept on top of the bed cover and showered with a towel at the bottom of the floor. Disgusting!

We explored all over and walked alot. It was fun and alittle bit festive. We were a bit early for all the Christmas decorations but saw some.Definately would come back and stay at the Pennsylvania Hotel, but might ask for a quieter room. We were on the corner and traffic, sirens and horns went all night.

I had a superior room which had an iron box, a hair drier, a working heater and a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. The beddings were clean and the shower worked perfectly. The only issue that the hotel could improve on is the breakfast that is very basic, otherwise, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I would definitely recommend it to those visiting New York.

We were attending a wedding in the city, and needed a place to stay for a couple nights. This property was convenient to our location and reasonably priced, so we booked a room. For whatever reason, Google Maps directed us to a side entrance, but the bellhop was kind enough to meet us at our car and help us unload. The hotel staff was friendly, and our room was clean and comfortable. The room also had free WiFi.The room we reserved came with vouchers for a free continental breakfast at Cafe R a few doors down. We found the restaurant to be crowded, but they got us through the "Hotel Penn Breakfast Line" quickly. We each received one free fruit cup, a bread product (muffin / bagel, etc) and juice OR coffee. For $10, you could upgrade to one trip through the hot buffet line, but the listed price for that experience was only $11, so I think you're better off with the free breakfast personally.During our stay, we were able to take advantage of the fitness & business centers, as well as some of the nearby shops & attractions. This hotel is located directly across the street from Madison Square Garden & Penn Station, so getting around was easy *except* for trying to catch an Uber on 32nd or 33rd street in the evening. You're much better off walking to 7th ave to go downtown or 6th ave to go uptown.Parking is available via Valet only for $37 / night; We parked off-site and walked over.Overall the staff was friendly and the stay was comfortable - would stay again!

The hotel has a really good location. Nevertheless when we arrived we had booked in the non upgraded rooms, this rooms were $50 less expensive of the one that have been renewal, the room was really scary really old like a chapter of the Shinning Movie. In the other hand, The renewal floor and room were really cosy and confortable. So my advice if you stay in the hotel ask for the upgrading or recent renewaled floors, is money well spended

Hotel Penn website is not accurate. It sells you on the idea that all their rooms have been "updated" well they have not "ALL" be updated. Only the higher floors have been so if you want a updated room YOU must ask for one or book a room that says it's on a "higher floor". Their website doesn't not tell you this. I'm telling you this. AND if you check out and have to wait in the lobby for a period of time, KEEP your room key because this place locks it's men's & women's room doors. So if you turn in your key you will not be able to get into the bathrooms. Note to hotel: PLEASE UNLOCK YOUR LOBBY BATHROOMS SO YOUR CUSTOMERS CAN USE THEM !!!!

I stayed years ago in this hotel and I was satisfied, so I decided to give it a second chance on my recent business trip to NYC. I booked one of the "renovated" rooms and I have to admit the rate was good considered NY standards. The check-in took forever, after a long flight from Europe, to enter the hotel and see an endless line of people is not the best start. Each front desk operator seemed to be particularly slow. And as a matter of facts, when it was our turn, things started to get even slower: I booked my room about 2 months in advance and the front desk agent started to look on his computer and roll his eyes... We asked what it was wrong and he replied that our room was not ready (it was 4pm!). He tried to give us one of the older rooms which I refused. Then he tried to give us a king bed when we needed two separate beds. He finally went in the back office and talked to the manager and he found a room of the same category we expected. But the story is not over yet: when I gave my credit card for incidentals, we were told that we must have the same card used for booking the room, which was not ours, since the hotel was booked by our office. After further discussions he then refunded the original credit card and charged my personal with the whole amount. I can see why they have this policy but it was not written anywhere otherwise we would have been prepared for! What is somebody receive the hotel room as a gift?The room was much smaller of what I remembered from my previous visit. It was yes renovated but not well kept. The windows didn't close properly, leaving cold air coming in all day. The good things were comfortable beds, big TV screen and obviously the great location.

We had a room with a king bed on the sixteenth floor. The room was renovated and was much larger than I was expecting in Midtown Manhattan. The hotel entrance is right across from the 7th Ave entrance to Penn Station which made it very easy since we had luggage with us. There is a 24 hour coffee shop in the lobby along with a small convenience store as well. If you are planning to check your luggage as you check out on your last day, I would suggest purchasing luggage check tags ($5.00 each) when your checking in so you don’t have to wait in the reception line a second time. (They offer express check out.)

I wouldn't mess with these people. They tried taking money from my card th moment I gave my card info and it was only suppose to save th date unless I cancelled by Monday. So glad my bank caught it and didn't gv them jack

My family enjoyed the time they spent in the hotel and NYC. The hotel is in the middle of everything. You need only to walk or to take the subway to whatever destination you want in New York City. The front desk is friendly and professional.

The employees were exceptional. The front desk person handled a problem with my booking. I was then escorted to my room with a manager who wanted to be sure all was well with the room. The floor manager was in the room preparing everything before I got there. Of course the rooms are a little tired, but it was more than made up for with the enthusiasm of the staff. Keep up the good work!

Shocking is an understatement. This hotel should have been closed down 30 years ago. When checking in there were at least 30 people refusing to stay telling us of rats and cockroaches in one of the rooms. Check in took about 90 mins. Staff were miserable and everything was too much trouble. The whole hotel is in a poor state of repair and rooms were unclean. Just don’t do it spend just a little more or stay a little further away, it will spoil your trip if you stay in this dump

Spent one night at this historic hotel. It is an old property but currently undergoing refurbishment. The hotel is huge and very busy. The Staff is polite and the rooms clean. The hotel is directly opposite Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. If you looking at a convenient hotel this is it.

I was surprised with the renovated room, I didn't expect that much... the room is pretty good, the room was cleaning every day and the towels were changed also every day, the location is in the middle of everything, the staff is very friendly and helpful, Sherry is very kindly. I believe when they do the renovation of all the rooms, for sure the Stars will going to jump up. The breakfast is very limited but you can have the buffet for $10.00 or start with this and eat something better later.

Hotel had be stated on booking . com to be refurbished but was not a good refurbishment. Bath looked liked it had been painted in gloss paint. Door looked like a coffin could of been done better. Yet still had a good time in NYC its OK for somewhere to just sleep and a good price.

PROS: Extremely well situated; within a 2 minute walk of a subway that took you to Times Square (1stop, 2 minute ride), Central Park (3 stops, 5 minute ride), or downtown to the 9/11 memorial (10 minutes), and directly across the street from Penn Station/Madison Square Garden. Our room was extremely quiet, we were in an interior room instead of street side; we could only hear street noise when there were sirens. That’s the main reason we stayed in the room instead of asking to be moved. The accessible room was very large. Breakfast vouchers.... you only get 2 per person per room (although we stayed for 4 nights). The restaurant was a 2 minute walk outside the hotel, but you got a beverage (small juice, or tea or coffee), a pastry (bagel, croissant or danish) and a tall cup of fresh fruit (cantaloupe, watermelon, honeydew and pineapple). Service was quick and easy. Price: despite the money we paid ($360 Canadian a night), it was still cheaper than most hotels in the area. CONS:We Paid a little extra for the mid range Penn 5000 room which was supposedly renovated in 2019. On entering the room we were taken aback immediately by the decor.... no pictures on the walls, old shabby furniture and no comforters on the beds. I felt like I was in a military barracks, although they’re nicer than the Penn. It was quickly apparent that the room had NOT been renovated, (see pictures) but we had asked for an accessible room, and it was very quiet and we were anxious to hit the streets of NYC, so we didn’t complain immediately. That night as we were preparing for bed we realized that the toilet was leaking. Someone came up immediately, but the repair job, while adequate, left the room looking even worse!! We took a box of Kleenex from between the two towel racks in the bathroom and realized that the box had been placed there to hold the top rack, which promptly fell down. There was no way to moderate the temperature of the room, and if you opened a window it was near impossible to close again without climbing up on the window ledge and standing on the window lip. (We got the toilet repairman to close it when he came and didn’t open it again) There was no hairdryer, ironing board, or safe in our room, although the website said we would have all three. Only two working outlets, and an extra in the bathroom which was loose.

We made a refundable booking few months ago. When we cancelled the booking the hotel promised to return the money. Since then, for few months although we keep calling and send emails we are not getting back our refundable deposit money. This is a Shame!!!!! Not less then a fraud.

Oh how I wish I could give this hotel a 0-star review. Completely UNACCEPTABLE!My friend was in town from Japan and was staying at this hotel in early October. I was in the room with him around midnight, and out of nowhere part of the bathroom ceiling came crashing down! There was heavy sheetrock and dirt scattered all over the floor. His toiletries and clothes in the bathroom were covered in dirt and dust. If either of us had been in there at the wrong time, we could've been injured.We were in absolute shock that something like this would happen. We phoned hotel services and the woman on the phone seemed genuinely concerned and told us to go straight to the front desk and ask to speak with the manager.My friend isn't fluent in English, so he wanted me to explain to the staff what had happened and get (at least some of) his money back. I tried telling the woman at the desk that I needed to speak with a manager, but she rolled her eyes and told me that she was dealing with a customer (although that customer had just walked away). I had to wait for the other employee to finish dealing with someone (about 10 minutes) before I could ask him to get me the manager.Another ten minutes later the manager, an African-American guy with glasses, comes out, doesn't acknowledge my friend or myself and proceeds to print out new room keys. He hands them to us and tells us to move our stuff to this new room.NO APOLOGY.I tell him, "Wait wait wait. The ceiling just freaking fell onto all his stuff in the bathroom. You're not going to offer him his money back or at least apologize?"The man answers, "Well you can either take the room, or you can go stay at another hotel." At midnight? What kind of manager is this? I become indignant and demand that he give my friend his money back, and the guy smugly tells me, "you're just arguing with yourself at this point."Anyone who stayed in that room was in danger of having sheetrock fall on their head, and the manager doesn't seem to give a damn. I tell him that if the ceiling had hit someone on the head and they had to go to the hospital, the hotel could've been sued. And then he has the audacity to tell me, "You can try all you want (to sue us)." (Hmm... I wonder what his supervisor would think about him egging on someone to sue the hotel?)He then asks me if I'm the one staying in the room, which I'm not, and then tells me that he's not talking to me anymore. I tell him that my friend doesn't speak English well, and the guy just ignores me. My friend can't put together the words to continue asking for his money back, so he just says "ok" and takes the room keys.We wipe the dirt off his things and pack his stuff. He had to throw away some toiletries. Ultimately, he was able to get money back from his travel insurance company, but the hotel should have been the one to make up for this mess.That manager NEEDS TO BE FIRED! The customer service at the hotel up to that point had been a mixed bag, but the manager did not care about the safety of the hotel's guests, and he certainly did not have a clue about what good customer service is.If you want to put yourself in PHYSICAL HARM and then have to deal with a staff that will TREAT YOU LIKE THE DIRT that litters the lobby floors, I highly recommend this place!

It's great value for money. Room was clean. Mattresses very comfortable. Location is great. Walking distance to major attractions. Staff was very friendly over the phone and during check in process. I like the express check out to avoid line to the reception.

Major disappointment!!! When booking this hotel shows pictures of their renovated rooms and when checking in they give you an old room and giving you the option to upgrade to a renovated room for 50$. The non renovated room are super old, stinky and dirty.

Booked a Plaza Collection upgraded king room. The room was tiny. Photos on the hotel website looked nicer, newer and bigger than the actual room. The bathroom looked like a quick makeover and no face towels were provided. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. There are 12 elevators, but only 4 were moving and each was full every time it stopped on our floor. Had to wait for four elevators until we were finally able to get on. Check-in/out lines were long. The check-in kiosk was ok except that my email didn't want to pull up the reservation# which is needed for the kiosk. Also, didn't give you the breakfast vouchers so you still had to stand in check-in line to get them. Complimentary breakfast was not on-site, but was pleasantly surprised as it was located just down the block at a neat restaurant that offered a variety of food options and a market. Breakfast was fruit cup, bagel or danish, and juice/coffee/tea. Wasn't fancy but was suffice. Location of the hotel was key. Across from Penn Station/Madison Square Garden/NYC Subway. We take the Amtrak every time we visit NYC and use the subway to get around NYC, so the hotel location was perfect. Overall, I would stay again just because of the location.

This hotel is close to majority of things you would want to visit in NYC. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms on 9th floor which was good. There was a big screen TV and room felt clean. The breakfast was included into out stay at cafe R and it was not good at all but luckily there is a Bagel shop next door to cafe R which serves awesome bagels.We used express check-in and check-out and it was great to skip the long line to front desk. People at the front dest generally not very friendly and seem to be fed-up with customers asking them questions. There was also this guy next to elevators - bellhop or what ever his title was, I asked him about breakfast place and another time about luggage drop he was really not happy. I do feel sorry for him being terrorized with the same question over and over again but maybe they should get one of those chatbot stations to get answers to common question or put some visible signs in the lobby. Overall hotel is definitely worth the 850 USD I payed for 5 nights

To be honest, this hotel is well past its prime, but I must say that nothing was actually WRONG with the hotel or my room - it was friendly, clean, and you can't beat the location. I was somewhat taken aback by the shabby furnishings in the elevator lobby on my floor. My room (I booked a "Penn Collection" room, ie. remodeled) was definitely unusual - it was very large by NYC standards and large even by U.S. standards. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was definitely not modern but clean and functional. The room itself had a strange vibe in that the walls and trim were reminiscent of a older poorly-maintained apartment that was repainted, and the relatively small amount of furnishings in the room made it look spartan. It certainly didn't have a warm feeling. But it got the job done, and I got a great night's sleep on a comfortable bed in a fantastically convenient location. If you're looking for luxury, this isn't it. But a good night's sleep in the heart of everything, this hotel fits the bill. It's quite possible that the non-remodeled rooms are much worse (and even mine wasn't nearly up to modern standards) but I was very pleased with my stay.

I booked this place for a friends weekend after a cruise. We liked the location and it was affordable as far as Manhattan hotels go. We arrived and stored our luggage until check in time (there was a charge for this service). Upon check in we waited in line for at least 20 minutes before a lengthy check in process and finally being able to relax in our room. The room did not have a bed spread only a few sheets, there was what looked like dust and mould under the radiator. I sunk when I sat down on the bed, as it turns out the bed frame was broken. After calling the front desk, they sent the bellman up with keys for a new room down the hall. This room had luggage in it as it turned out to be occupied by other guests. After calling the front desk again they showed us to our third room, still as run down as the first although this one had a bedspread and was indeed vacant. We were not comfortable with the fact that we were just given room keys to someone else's room, what was to say that wouldn't happen to us? We waited in line at reception to explain our dissatisfaction and they just asked if we wanted to cancel. Just like that! I have worked in 5 different hotels in 3 different cities and we have never been so quick to cancel a reservation. We booked somewhere else nearby and had no more problems. I am not usually not picky about hotels nor do I usually write bad reviews. This one takes the cake! Don't waste your time stay somewhere else!

I was very impressed with the hotel from start to finish. Check in was extremely easy and quickI reserved a 1 bedroom suite with a pull out couch, the room was MUCH larger then I expected and clean! The bathroom was quite dated but also clean. Housekeeping was very polite and efficient; I asked if I could get sheets for the pull out couch and they came to my room and fixed the bed for me; they also were quick to bring me more towels when I called for them. Unfortunately my heater went out in the living room area but an engineer was to my room within 30 mins to fix it and get it heated up!

The hotel is so dirty, outdated, I have never stayed in a hotel with such bad condition. Even motels and inns which cost much much less were cleaner. We checked in a standard room first. Standard does not mean dirty and with AC not working, went to admin they moved us to another room - upgraded (+ $35). Ac worked, but all lamps were dusted. Looks like nobody cleaned them before and during our stay. We stayed 5 nights and every night called for missing towels or shampoo or something else. Just came from Japan - the hotels in Tokyo and Kyoto which cost less per day were very clean, with great services. Shame on you NYC Pennsylvania hotel administration!!!

My rating should read 0 star rating. On arrival we were given a room that was cold, dirty and smelled. Asked desk manager 'Melvita' for change of room, following 3 rooms were worse. She was so rude, arrogant and told us that the rooms were fine before Looking for $57 more per night for another room and told us it was a newly decorated room, otherwise we could cancel. ( it was 8.30PM) only for the time we would have. Having argued our point we had to pay an extra $25 per night. The upgraded room was a little better for first couple of nights but when cock roaches came up through the plug hole of the bath we had enough. On voicing this to another ignorant person at reception she didn't even answer us. DON'T STAY HERE. it's a filthy bug infested dump. There are lovely hotels in the same location. They don't care about their customers.

Location was excellent across from Madison Square Garden. Staff was helpful at check in and check out. Liked the fact they gave coupons for free drinks and the free breakfast around the corner. Would stay there again.

Location was excellent; room was spacious and very clean; bed was most comfortable; bed linens perfectly pressed; heater was quiet and efficient; housekeeping was great;the housekeeping manager on the floor asked me about my stay; loved continental breakfast with fresh fruit; room furnishings were contemporary; front desk staff not welcoming; at ckout Shahid did not thank me for staying with them or wished me well, summoned the next guest while I was still standing and reviewing the statement at the desk I just received. Head them up and herd them out. If you have any problems, ask for a front desk manager. They seem to be more caring. Other than the seeming apathetic front desk staff, everything was fine. I would stay at the hotel again definitely and have recommended it to my friends and family.

This is always where I stay when I'm in New York. It's perfect for my needs -- affordable and conveniently-located. I always take Amtrak to New York and the station puts us out right at the Hotel Pennsylvania.

Room was clean- no frills and good price. Would highly recommend. Loved that you played Pennsylvanis 6500 while on hold! I really dont have anything else to say and am trying to meet the 40 charachter setting,

If you are only traveling for tourism and need to mobilize easily in the city, this could be a good option as it’s very close to Penn Station. Rooms are basic, this an old building, and they have baggage room if you need to leave your luggage a few hours after check out.

This hotel is in the perfect location, particularly if you are coming in from Penn Station. It’s a bit hectic and not all of the staff are too friendly, but I would still stay there again. Overall, I recommend it.

Awesome location, right in the middle of Manahattan. Close to everything we wanted to see and the plays we attended. Friendly hotel staff and helpful if needed. Our grandaughter loved her room. Real nice time had by all.
user_name:
Scott C
Springfield - Delaware County, Pennsylvania

review_body: The location is right across from Madison Square Garden, and Penn Station is right next door. On the other side is the World's Largest Macy's. It is only a 5 min walk to Times Square. The location is perfect to get wherever you want to be.

Great location. Easy to get to from Newark airport. Subway and Train station (Penn station) right there under Madison square garden!! Room was clean, bed was comfortable, definitely would stay here again.

I cannot emphasize enough how much we loved staying at Hotel Pennsylvania. Very lively lobby, friendly staff, and we loved the coffee shop on the first floor. Next time we go to Manhattan, we are staying AGAIN at Hotel Pennsylvania!

My wife recently stayed at this hotel with her 2 children for a 4 night stay in newyork.The hotel was basic and when she checked in she was asked by the receptionist for her card details because it's a formality and no money would be taken.Well since she has comeback home she has noticed that the hotel took $100 from her card. She has since emailed the hotel to ask why that has happened and I have also emailed them and messaged them on Facebook messenger but they haven't replied.I think it's very poor service.

Really enjoyed the stay in this hotel lovely room great view on the 16th floor of entire state. Great location very central to all attractions. Only complaint was breakfast wasnt great in the cafe across road.

This is only second time I’ve stayed at HP. I did not stay in a renovated room to save $. But the room was clean and when I asked for a rollaway bed, extra blankets, pillows and towels, I found them there without a problem. Very convenient location across from MSG and Penn station!

It’s directly across from Penn Station so it’s perfect for those that are coming to town via train. I was surprised by how wide the hallways are and how open the rooms are. I like the history of it being the largest hotel in the world in 2019. Nothing very fancy, but great price for what I needed.

I was here for business and I would definitely stay again. Room was really clean, staff was friendly and really helpful and it’s in a great location! I would definitely recommend visitors to stay here.

We arrived to the hotel exhausted after a long flight and train journey. Anxious to get checked in quickly and get settled into the room and hoping everything went smoothly at check in. We were greeted by the most friendly and professional lady Maria B she put us completely at ease gave us loads of tips and tricks for our trip and made check in a complete pleasure.Hotel is very old and worn looking but just wanted somewhere clean to sleep shower and keep all our shopping ! We stayed in a recently refurbished room. Floor 16.It was basic but clean comfy bed and decent shower even if it went from cold to mad hot. Great heater in room. NYC was Baltic. The location of this hotel is amazing and why we picked it. I would definitely stay again.

Let's start with the good. Location, price, hot shower, good water pressure, historical, reasonably clean.Negative staff (borderline rude and unhelpful). The whole floor we stayed on smelled like marijuana nightly. Bathroom very small. Breakfast not worth bothering with.

Gr8 location. Walking distance to Penn station, Madison S. G., T.SQ, Grand Central Station, Empire St., Macy's (ha), & numerous others. Breakfast at Café R of baggle, coffee and fruit was satisfying (option to purchase buffet) however multiple offerings should satisfy 1's appetite.Staff friendly & very helpful. Booked directly w/Hotel and landed an updated room.Would have liked a handle in shower and blackout curtains for darker room.Will return.

I was concerned after reading some of the reviews but I updated our room to the newly renovated side and was very pleased. Very clean , comfortable , we would definetely stay here again. And the valet Will was great , very helpful , went out of his way to help us.

Perfect location for seeing the sites. The hotel is being refurbished - I was aware of this and booked an unrefurbished room because it was less expensive. However, judging by the condition of the room, I'd say the refurbishment is long overdue.Not sure if its anything to do with the refurbishment, but breakfast is served down the street, that alongside the room having no tea/ coffee making facilty was disappointing.For a place to lay your head after a long day in the city, its good value - though I'd choose an updated room next time.

good attention and cordiality from the people to make all the arrangements for a fantastic tour. Best regards to all employers and thanks for your kind attention. I will come back as very soon as I can

Before I begin, I’ll start by saying I work in this industry in mid-level mgmt . I know very well what hospitality and genuine care and concern are supposed to feel like. From the moment I arrived at Hotel Pennsylvania, I knew this would be the first and last time I’d stay here. With the exception of Flora at the Front Desk, everyone I encountered seemed to be irritated or “unbothered.” Sidebar: I think it’s a shame that the Front Office agents/team members don’t receive an incentive for selling upgrades to guests. You want the extra revenue, but you don’t want to reward the team that gets it for you? No bueno!! In any case, even the “manager” that was supposed to return my call seemed more concerned with getting me off the phone than resolving my issues with the overwhelmingly powerful smell of cleaning chemicals in the room. They are so strong that my allergies are going haywire and I am unable to breathe. This manager (with a Spanish accent; he didn’t identify himself on the phone) assured me a Floor Manager was on their way up here to investigate the smell in the room. That was :40 minutes or so ago. I will call down again and ask to be moved. I can’t breathe in this room. Flora was very nice and accommodating. Very friendly and we shared a nice moment. Thanks Flora for caring just a little bit. No one else I encountered did. Kudos to you. After awhile, Fedelia (HSKP Mgr) came up to the room with one of her Room Attendants (possibly the RA that had serviced the room earlier in the day) — I asked them both to come in and tell me if they smelled something. The room attendant said oh yes, it’s probably the detergent in the bathroom —I knew i wasn’t crazy— I asked her if it was strong or just me, she said it was strong and she could smell it. The Floor Manager, Fedelia said, but the room is clean, right?! I agreed that the cleanliness wasn’t the issue just the smell of chemicals. She attempted to call Steve, I think. And there was no answer. So they both left to go to the Front Office.That gesture made me feel a little more welcomed and appreciated. Thanks ladies. Needs some work on the service aspect of this business for sure! ESP in Mgmt!

Hotel Pennsylvania may not be a 3,4 or 5 star hotel but if you’re not concerned with panhandlers and busy sidewalks and non modern rooms and just want a room to sleep in the this place will fit the bill. Water temps in the showers fluctuate from cold to scalding hot so be prepared.

The room was okay. The bed was comfortable, but the sheets were not very soft. My bathroom is in need of renovation, as the shower was less than to be desired. The view was awful, as it looked onto the other parts of the hotel.

Let me start by saying I think many people go to hotels expecting to have their ass whipped for them and want to be treated like kings when in reality they are just garabage people. However I will say by no means is this hotel the most lavish and amazing. It was exactly what I expected for the price I paid and if you think $130 is alot for New York or let's be honest any popular area you probably shouldn't be staying in hotels to begin with..... The rooms are not mosaics of art and the building itself is old and needs to be remodeled but again I knew this going in so I didn't expect anything more or less, so when I got in my room I was pleasantly surprised that all the negative reviews I heard were just simply over exaggerations or not true at all. This hotel is in a prime location across from the Madison square garden,Penn Station, a couple blocks from Port Authority and Time Square if that's your thing, steps away from 1 2 3 N Q R and W train which can take you pretty much anyway within 30 min on the subway and one transfer, and of course the mid town Night life is all around you. The service was quick and painless the express check in was broke and I had to wait in line but I'm not a unrealistic person and know things malfunction or just don't work sometimes so I wasn't mad at all the receptionist was friendly and explain everything I needed to know and again since I don't expect these hardworking people to bend to my will it was a very fast and pleasant expierence it's crazy when you are a decent human being and don't let little things bother you the quality of life you have.Ps there is a 100$ hold that will be refunded to you as long as you don't destroy the room just know that when you book a stay in almost any New York hotel there is a deposit.

In my travels around the world for Business and Pleasure; I’ve never stayed at such a filthy establishment in my life; this place has the worst service and conditions I’ve experience. My advise to anyone wishing to stay here; DONT!!! Yes, location is excellent but find another hotel..Anyone that gave this place more than 1 circle; I would hate to see your home!Pic of Knicks Vs Mavs game at MSG

It's an older hotel but the other sections are being updated (at a higher price). I'm ok with the present state of the room that was clean, good access to Manhattan and frankly the other more expensive places

Not only was the room really quite disgusting, the vibe of the whole place is off. Definitely didn’t feel alone on my solo stay. Never again. Ever. The shower and bed felt like they were both going to fall apart. Everything is just splattered with a horrible white paint. It was an overpriced uncomfortable night, no sleep was had: whether by haunted feels or a brick for a mattress.

Horrible staff, disgusting rooms, badly needs to be renovated. Got out of the room on the very first night and stayed at another hotel instead. Dont waste your money or time at this hotel, spend some more money and go somewhere cleaner and comfortable

The location of the hotel was perfect for visiting many attractions. The room was really great and was cleaned every day.. All the staff were friendly, happy and helpful. There was free wifi in the room, a televison and even an alarm clock.We would definitely go back and stay at the hotel.

We had booked a one night stay at this hotel to go to a concert in NYC, however we had something personal come up and no longer needed the room, I thought I would have been charged anyway so I went to the front desk just to see if there was anything they could do, and luckily I had the pleasure of dealing with an employee called 'Maria B'. She was so kind and understanding of our situation and had a manager help us out and cancel the room for us free of charge. I am so grateful to her for being such a nice understanding good person, it really helped us out that night that we were able to go on our way and not be down the money for the hotel which we weren't going to be able to use. Thank you Maria, we really appreciated it. We hope to stay at the hotel sometime in the future.

The otel is well located and the subway at Penn station has allowed us to easily move to the different places of interest in NYC.Unfortunately, we were diappointed by some rooms.For our family, staying on the 10th floor, the room was beautiful, but our friends who had rooms on the 4th floor, it was catastrophic. The floor is not renovated.For that, I think that the stay at the Pennsylvania Hotel was better for us than for them.

We booked this hotel based on a recommendation. We went on the hotel's website and checked it out. Everything looked amazing, the rooms looked great(recently renovated) and the price was great. However that all changed once we got in. The only great thing about it was the location, walking distance from some of the must do things in NYC. Would I stay here again? Probably not. Would I recommend it to a friend? Not at all. The Lobby just reeks of smoke once you walk in, it is also outdated. Check in was quick, we got complimentary continental breakfast coupons for Cafe R down the street. As mentioned in some of the reviews its a very simple breakfast, but not terrible. We stayed at one of the "renovated" rooms, what a joke! The room looked nothing like the picture and the bathroom was horrendous. I had to double check we weren't in one of the old rooms by mistake. During our stay, there was a posted notice saying that they were having to temporarily shut down the steam service in the hotel. Inconvenient but understandable as it was "beyond their control". This was done overnight so wasnt a big concern. However the room was freezing! Even after the steam was turned back on. I had to go to the front desk and ask if they were still having issues as my room was not warming up even at the highest settings. They did send someone I was told as we were not in the room and it got a tad (and when I say a tad, I do mean a TAD) bit warmer. The maid service was non-existent. They gave us 1 roll of toilet paper for the entire stay (3 days, 2 people). We left a note for the maid to please provide us with some more and even left her a tip for her troubles. Note and tip were gone, no TP though. The bathroom itself was very outdated and gross looking. Water pressure was good, and the water would get hot enough, maybe even too hot at times. To end on a positive note, as mentioned in the title, the location was great. We were walking distance to alot of places we wanted to see (Time Square, Empire State, etc.) You got Penn station right across the street which was convenient. The king size bed was comfortable. The hotel did feel safe, and outside of the issues we had in the hotel we enjoyed our stay in NYC.

Excellent service!! Fantastic location!! Easy walking access to all the sites you’d want to see in NYC. Free breakfast!! Rooms not terribly fancy, but very clean and comfortable. Good price, too!! Highly recommend!!

Enjoyed our stay, however, the hotel should be slightly more flexible in as far late checkout is concerned. Otherwise our trip was great and memorable. Hopefully we will return next yearfor a better time.

I stayed here for one week in October and the hotel was lovely! I stayed in one of the new Penn 5000 rooms and it was great. I would definitely recommend and hoping to visit/stay here again in the future.

This hotel is a dump. The building looks great from the outside, it also looks good in the lobby, but as soon as you go towards the hallways/rooms, you begin to think you are in 1 star hotel, the carpet is filthy, the walls, the furniture, the bathrooms, are all extremely old and things are falling apart. The location is great, if that is important for you, but you will be sleeping in filth....I spent $780 for 2 nights, what a waste of money.

Our checkin was a great start with Maria B being extremely friendly and doing her job exceptionally well. She advised if we had any issues or problems to come and see her. The hotel was in a great location. Our room was spacious, comfortable and housekeeping staff attended daily. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Apart from the above and a broken bed, we were lied about our payment options. First, they told us we would only pay a $100 dollar deposit. We would pay the rest upon arrival. False, they charge us the full amount on our credit card even before check-in. We had to add another night to our stay, they didn't let us pay straight away. We needed to pay cash. Instead, they charged our credit card behind our back a second time. We will NEVER stay there again.

It was just one day stayThe best thing about this hotel is it's location. It is Just outside Pen station and there are 3 metro and one Path line is located arround 2 minutes walk to the hotel.Check in was quick and check out was super quick, we had to just drop our keys as we had paid the amount online.For breakfast you have to go another place which is accross the road. Breakfast is limited to one fruit bowl, one bread of choice and on ed drink of your choice. If you want full buffet they you hav ed to pay $10 per person.Very good hotel if you just want this for night stay and travelling during the day.Do not expect much of service though.

I called and called for towels, face clothes. It took forever. Then housekeeping stopped answering the phone and if they answered I was hung upon. I saw a maid with a cart and ask for towels and she told me know I could not have any. She said I should wait. No rugs for the bathroom. Good location but that’s all. Overall poor service.

Customer service at this place is shameful. I made a reservation on the hotel's website shortly after rotator cuff surgery, while still on pain meds. I meant to reserve a night 2 1/2 weeks in advance. Instead I managed to make it for the same night I booked in online. Considering I'm in Cincinnati and the hotel is in New York City, it was an obvious mistake, probably related to the pain drugs. I discovered the problem a week later and called the hotel immediately. I was told I needed to talk with the accounting department. I called everyday for a week, and sent emails explaining my situation to the accounting office and executive office. Nobody answers the phone in either office. Nor has anyone responded to me emails. What's worse, the wait time to reach an operator, who needs to transfer your call, is anywhere from 5 to 10 minutes. I've had to eat the charge for the room I couldn't possibly occupied. The absence of any reaction from the hotel is insulting, and wouldn't happen at any self-respecting hotel that cared in the least about their reputation. I advise that you never go near this place.

Room was fine/nice. Good size. King bed was alittle hard. Think I had an updated refurbished room. Heard other rooms are very old/dated. Room alittle cold because windows very drafty. Nice view. Check in was much faster this time than my previous visit. Which was almost an hour wait....this time 10-15 minutes. Stayed here again because it is right across the street from penn station and Madison square garden. Went to a show there. Only big negative that I experienced both trips was the elevator situation . They have 12 but only a few in use and there is a long long wait and they are so crowded that you have to wait a very long time to get an elevator. And they stop at almost every floor even when completely full. It is a big problem at this hotel. 18 stories. Not practical to take the stairs. I was on 12th floor. Waited a long time for an elevator and the ones that stopped on my floor were full.... plan on taking a good 10-15 minutes to get to the lobby.... it is really crazy. The hotel is huge. Not sure the number of rooms but there are a lot of people who stay here all the time..... honestly the only reason I stayed again is the location.... it is right across the street from Madison square garden and I was going there that night. Not sure I would stay again but it is relatively inexpensive (for nyc standards) and if you take the train as I do, you can't beat the location! Neighborhood is ok, not great. Near Macy's and not too far from Times Square... definitely walking distance .

The worst hotel I've been ever, smell of pee in the whole floor, needs to be shut down, not for human beings. Good location, but never seen such hotel, and not cheap, i was very stupid to book, all the reviews saying sonething else are false

First time visiting New York with hubby on business. Had a slight issue with room charge but Maria B. helped us out and also upgraded our room to a beautiful view. Thank you so very much! So far this trip is off to a good start!

Maria B was an overall helpful desk agent when it came to checking in. She was extremely nice and even worked with me to get a better experience at hotel Pennsylvania!! I would definitely comeback here if she’s at the front desk again.

I found this hotel was in a great location for sightseeing. Everything is close by. I stayed with 3 of my family. We arrived on an evening about 7pm no queuing at reception. The first room we were allocated was on the 2nd floor, 266, we all agreed we should upgrade to a renovated room, as the room was very dated. Our upgraded room was on the 17th floor, 1702, this was a very good sized room, unfortunately no view of the city from our window, but that didn't matter as you only had to step outside the hotel for a fantastic view. We only used the breakfast vouchers once, as we ate elsewhere, but it was ok. There is a coffee shop in the lobby that is open 24hrs if you're an early riser. Overall for our short stay there we had no problems at all, the room was clean, the beds comfy, there was a hairdryer, iron and ironing board, also a big TV, if you whished to watch any.I for one will definitely be back.

Was small but clean and updated. The clawfoot tub was nice and the price was too! My room had basically a king bed with standing room around it and a TV and a good sized bathroom. The room had a safe, and iron and ironing board and was clean and neat.

Staying here a week . We upgraded to the penn plaza after reading bad reviews on the regular rooms . I wanted to post these pics to give you an idea . For the price we paid the location is great and with the upgrade I can give the hotel a 4 star . Keeping something in mind the price with the upgrade got closer to maybe the holiday inn . The regular penn plaza room is very small we had to get moved because our heater was not working good . If you book get the bigger size rooms it is a lot bigger for a party of 4 . They accommodated our issues after visiting the front desk . Being that said I recommend if you want a good location and not break the bank. I still have 4 days let here but so far so good . I know the bad reviews scares people but all you have to do is ask and they might help .

Ok, everything was quite good - staff was personable, snack shop open until wee hours in the night, comfortable bed, large lobby, and great location in New York. Ok, our complaints are: 1) We were there in early Nov and outside temp was around 30-degrees. The room was extremely hot and we could never get the temp gauge to work right. So we had to open the window an inch to let in cold air, to compensate for the heat in the room. 2) The toilet was positioned waaaaaay to close to the toilet roll. I am an average size guy 5'11" and my right knee were crunched up against the wall, while my left knee was hitting to tub. Meaning to crap, you need to be on an extreme angle and leaning sideways just to pull paper off the roll. That was uncomfortable. Based on the room design, there is no way to fix this unless you make the tub shorter.

First time staying there - perfect location - across from a concert I attended at The Garden. The place is massive, huge lobby and well over 1000 rooms. Check-in is very slow, so keep that in mind - long lines like you would have checking it at an airport. Overall, not too bad, as they opened another window and the man at check-in was quick. The place is a bit run down in some places, could use some upgrades. I had trouble getting into my room - but I went to the room with an A after the number which was kind of confusing. Security directed me by phone and all was good. Got to my room - modern, yet nothing special. Small. The bathroom was suitable. Nice TV. The woodwork trim was pretty beat up, looked like from years of painting over it. Towels had a slightly strange odor, can't explain - like a chemical. No fridge in room or coffee maker, but there are tons of places nearby and a shop in the lobby. The Elevator had a beer can and was kind of dirty. Overall, good value and location. Don't expect too much, it's not luxurious though back in its heyday this must have been an incredible place. I spent far more time out of the hotel than in it, so I was satisfied.

I made a reservation at the Hotel Pennsylvania on Wednesday November 6th for the night of November 12th. I called on the 10th to try and cancel only to find out I could not as I had gone past the hotels cancellation time by 3 hours. However I was advised that I could talk to accounting and a Manager I spoke to advised me they would make notes not he reservation. I called today November 11th only to find that no notes had been placed on the reservation, and the Reservationist I spoke with questioned if I actually called yesterday or not. Well I did. I have the call logs on my phone to reflect calling the 800 number numerous times only to be hung up on, It was not until I called the hotels local phone number that I was able to speak with a real live human being.

We had a handicapped accessible room. We had a walk in shower which made it accessible. The bed was very comfy. Of course there was a few drawhacks. The room was on the 17th floor, we like lower floors, and far from the elevator. It was a 'hike' to get to the room. It was the farthest from the elevator.

The room service was excellent. The personnel friendly. I asked if it was possible to provide me a room at a higher floor and it was done for me. But what I enjoyed the most was the architecture of the building and the view from the window.

The staff was friendly. I would reccomend for someone else to stay here due to the location to everything. But the room was not as it was pictured. It was definitely renovated but the bathroom did not look updated and the toilet looked like it belongs in a public bathroom. Not that it was dirty, just the style of the toilet reminds me of a public bathroom. The tub did not look new either. It was not dirty but you can tell it has been around a while. There was no hand soap on the bath room. The bed was a little on the hard side. Okay for one night unless you like extra firm mattress. The area when you walk off the elevator was beautiful! This was a great walk to everything!!

I’ll check in to this hotel on November 9, 2019,They have extremely long line to check in, the hotel front desk staff is not that personable. Once we were given a key to our room on the third floor, it was like I walk into an old horror movie. It was dingy dusty and dirty. The rooms was cold the windows were broken. I went to the front desk and asked to be changed, the front desk assistant advised that we had chosen a classic room which was a standard room that was not renovated. And she would change my room but it would be the same. She gave me another room and this room was even worse than before. As soon as I answered in the room I saw something in the corner pink and bubbly foaming out of the corner. And theFurniture was covered with dust. I was then given two more opportunities for rooms. The last time they gave me was equivalent to a Motel 6 or maybe a low-budget red roof Inn. It was acceptable however for the amount of money that we paid to stay at this hotel this should not be allowed. I spoke with another couple on the elevator, one lady and Buy said she hadn’t had it in her room and her child became sick. They refuse to change her room. The next couple I spoke to. Stated they found a rat in their room and demanded That the rumba change. And it was. Do not book this hotel. It is a complete dump and should be shut down by the board of health.

The hotel is huge (1800 rooms) but with 12 elevators you on't wait long. However the hotel is old and desperately need a renovation. Things didn't work or work well - eg desk lights. The hot tap went backwards. The carpet was full of dust. The windows hadn't been washed for decades. Being close to Penn Station is a plus.
user_name:
Andrew L
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

review_body: Nice hotel. Great location. The hotel is front of the subway station and madison square garden. There stores and restaurant. It was clean and nice employees. The room was a lit of bit old but there where very clean.

Least cooperative hotel! We emailed the hotel several times, where we still haven’t received any reply. Therefor we tried to contact the hotel through phone where we got connected further, and no one could take the matter further or come back to us with a specific answer. We had a need to upgrade or change our order and there has been zero help or willingness to cooperate. What was supposed to be a pleasant first time stay in the city of N.Y. has become a stressful and bad experience where we most probably will need to split us up on different hotels and places.

I rang the hotels reservations before booking and asked what room type I needed to book to ensure we got an adapted room with a walk in shower as my partner Is disabled,advised to book room type with ADA which was adapted,booked adapted upgraded room which reservations advised,received a confirmation email from the hotel with the room type on as I'd even rang them after I'd booked and asked them to check I'd booked the correct room.After a 7.40 hour flight,and a 2.30 hour shuttle transfer we arrived at the queue to check in,eventually it was our turn to be told they had not got any adapted rooms left,I had to argue for over an hour with the check in guy going to speak to his manager 3 times,my disabled partner who is also terminally ILL,waiting at the side in his wheel chair with the luggage,we were both shattered to the point where I put my head on the counter and closed my eyes,eventually after blaming everyone as to why we hadn't got the adapted room and he couldn't give me what he didn't have,and I had booked it wrong , despite me ringing them before and after booking the room,and receiving an email confirming the adapted room,he never accepted responsibility,or assured me he would sort this out,I advised him that we were there for a week and without a walk in shower with shower chair my partner would not be able to have a shower all week.He eventually gave me my room cards etc to which I said is this an adapted room, of course he said,so puzzled I asked him how he had managed to now get me an adapted room after telling me for an hour he didn't have one,he just said that's my problem to sort out not yours,no apology, I was just so relieved to get our adapted room,the room was large had a massive bed,a leather sofa a tv and the adapted bathroom,the only thing I would say was no kettle,so no drinks unless bought in coffee shop,disappointed with that,been to New York 5 times and always had a coffee maker in room,I would say you need to book an upgraded room as they have recently been refurbished,the hotel is a 109 years old so quite outdated and old fashioned but a good base and has lots of history,just spoilt by the messing about at check in,and shame on the check in man for trying to blame everyone but the hotel for them not having our room they had obviously cocked up but if I'd not stood my ground for an hour we would not have got the adapted room,I would add I have worked in the travel industry for 20 years and booked disabled passengers many many times and know what is involved and how important it is to get the right room,he was so rude even accused me of repeating myself,for saying over and over that I had rang the hotel and received an email confirming the adapted room.

Had to make a last minute room reservation and found an offer for a 2 double room here. Lobby area is spacious and appropriate for a hotel of this standing and star rating. Check-in was easy as we arrived sometime around 8 in the evening. Room 15-17A. Room was good enough for both of us. Bed comfortable but provided with only 1 pillow.Air conditioner switched to heater settings from October, room was quite stuffy, window could only be opened to about 4 or 5 inches to let the cool air in and for circulation. Toilet/Bath room okay, but not much of a shelf to place our toiletries bags on.The vending machine on our floor was not topped up from the time we checked in till the time we checked out.
